BT1-089.answer: A: Yes, you can. Hatching a Digimon does not count as playing them, so it can attack.
BT1-089.question: Q: During my breeding phase, I hatch a level 2 Digimon from my Digi-Egg deck. I then digivolve that Digimon into a level 3 Digimon during my main phase. If I use this card's effect to move that Digimon to my battle area, can I attack with it immediately?

BT1-089.answer: A: While it is possible, this can only be done if you have a Level 2 Digimon in your Breeding Area. If you have a Digimon that can be moved out from the Breeding Area it must be moved out. If you have no Digimon in your Breeding Area and cards in your Digi-Egg deck, you must hatch.
BT1-089.question: Q: Is it possible to suspend this tamer with its [Main] effect and not use its effect?

BT1-090.answer: A: When you pass the turn the memory counter is set to 3 and "end of turn" effects will now resolve giving your opponent 2 additional memory and moving the memory counter to 5. (See more in End of Turn Procedures)
BT1-090.question: Q: I pass turn after using [BT1-090 Gravity Crush]. How much memory does my opponent have?

BT1-092.answer: A: You have to both draw 2 cards and give a Digimon +2000 DP if possible. However, if one effect cannot be done (you do not have Digimon, or you have no cards in deck) you can still use the other one.
BT1-092.question: Q: Can I choose to only trigger ＜Draw 2＞ or give one of my Digimon +2000 DP? Do I have to do both?

BT1-093.answer: A: You have to give the Digimon both +2000 DP and ＜Security Attack +1＞ if possible.
BT1-093.question: Q: Can I choose to give one of my Digimon only +2000 DP or ＜Security Attack +1＞? Do I have to do both?

BT1-094.question: Q: My opponent has used an Option card or other effect to give one of their Digimon ＜Blocker＞. Can I use this card's effect to delete that Digimon?

BT1-095.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to give one of my unsuspended Digimon ＜Blocker＞?

BT1-099.answer: A: Even if this card's effect is used, nothing happens.
BT1-099.question: Q: What happens if I use this card's effect on a Digimon with no digivolution cards?

BT1-100.question: Q: I use this card's effect when my opponent's Digimon has no digivolution cards. If that Digimon later gains digivolution cards, can it attack?

BT1-102.question: Q: What happens when I use this card while I have 1 or fewer cards in my security stack?

BT1-102.answer: A: No, you would draw 1. Cards turned over by the security check are not included in the number of security cards.
BT1-102.question: Q: I have 4 security cards. My opponent attacks me and I flip [BT1-102 Blade of the True] as the security check. Do I draw 2 cards with the [Security] effect because it is still in the security stack?

BT1-104.question: Q: If one of my Digimon digivolves after I use this card, does that Digimon still receive this card's effect?

BT1-104.answer:
A: Yes, it does. (See more in Effect Resolution#Global Effects)
[1]
BT1-104.question: Q: After activating this card's effect, I use [BT1-089 Mimi Tachikawa]'s effect to move a Digimon from my breeding area to my battle area. Does this card's effect also apply to that Digimon?

BT1-104.answer:
A: No battle occurs. After resolving all other [When Attacking] and [Reaction]/[Counter] timing effects, the attack ends. (See more in Attack Resolution)
[1]
BT1-104.question: Q: I attack an opponent's Digimon with a Digimon that's gained the [When Attacking] effect from this card. The [When Attacking] effect reduces my opponent's Digimon to 0 DP, deleting it. What happens next?

BT1-104.answer:
A: No, [When Attacking] effects are resolved before blocks are declared, so you can't activate this Digimon's effect after your opponent declares a block. (See more in Attack Resolution)
[1]
BT1-104.question: Q: I use this card, then attack with one of my Digimon, which is blocked by an opponent's Digimon with ＜Blocker＞. Can I use this card's [When Attacking] effect to delete the blocking Digimon by reducing its DP to zero?

BT1-104.answer:
A: Yes, it does. However, Digimon played that turn without ＜Rush＞ cannot attack.
[1]
BT1-104.question: Q: I use this card, then play a Digimon. Does it receive this card's effect?
Q: I use 2 copies of this card. When I attack with a Digimon, can I activate its [When Attacking] effect twice in a single attack, giving an opponent's Digimon -4000 DP?

BT1-104.answer:
A: Yes, you can still use BanchoStingmon's effect if the attack target's DP decreases before BanchoStingmon's effect activates as long as it was 12000 DP when it was targeted for the attack.
[2]
BT1-104.question: Q: I have activated [BT1-104 Golden Ripper] and attack with [BT3-058 BanchoStingmon]. If I attack with this card and use [BT1-104 Golden Ripper]'s effect to decrease the attack of the attack target from 12000 DP to 10000 DP before I use its effect, can I use this card's effect to give it 7000 DP?

BT1-105.answer: A: The DP value printed on a card is its original DP. This card's effect temporarily allows you to treat the DP value printed on an opponent's Digimon as if it were 3000.
BT1-105.question: Q: What does "original DP" refer to?

BT1-105.answer: A: Yes, when a Digimon's DP becomes 0, it's deleted.
BT1-105.question: Q: I use this card's effect to change the original DP of an opponent's Digimon to 3000. I then use [ST3-11 Seraphimon]'s effect to give an opponent's Digimon 4000 DP. If the opponent's Digimon drops to 0 DP, is it deleted?

BT1-105.answer: A: Yes, effects that increase or decrease DP work as normal, raising the Digimon's DP to 6000.
BT1-105.question: Q: This card's effect has set a Digimon's original DP to 3000. If [ST1-13 Shadow Wing] is used to give that Digimon +3000 DP, is its DP now 6000?

BT1-105.answer: A: No, its original DP becomes 3000. 3000 DP and 1000 DP (from the effect) add up to 4000 DP.
BT1-105.question: Q: If I use this card's effect on a Digimon that's already getting +1000 DP from an effect, does its DP become 3000?

BT1-105.answer: A: Even after digivolving, the Digimon's DP is treated as 3000 until the end of the turn.
BT1-105.question: Q: I digivolve a Digimon while this card's effect is active. What happens to the Digimon's DP?

BT1-105.answer: A: The effect that was used last takes precedence.
BT1-105.question: Q: If I set a Digimon's original DP with this card, and then use another card to set its original DP again. What happens?

BT1-105.answer: A: Yes, the effect prevents the reduction of DP. But it does not prevent its original DP from being set to another number.
BT1-105.question: Q: Can [BT1-105 Blast Fire] to decrease the DP of a Digimon with "DP cannot be reduced"?

BT1-105.answer: A: No, the Level 2 Digimon has no DP and so its DP can't be changed and it will still be trashed.
BT1-105.question: Q: If after using this card's effect to set my opponent's Digimon's DP to 3000 and it gets ＜De-Digivolve＞ and becomes a Level 2 Digimon with no DP. Does this card's effect set the Level 2 Digimon's DP to 3000 and stop it from being trashed?

BT1-107.answer: A: Yes, they continue by checking the card that was added to your security stack.
BT1-107.question: Q: I have 1 card in my security stack. My opponent attacks me with a Digimon with ＜Security Attack +1＞, and flips over this card during the security check. Its ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞ activates, adding a card to my empty security stack. Does my opponent continue the security check?

BT1-109.answer:
A: No, digivolution costs can't be reduced to less than zero. You can digivolve the card for free, but you can't gain memory with effects that reduce digivolution costs.
[1]
BT1-109.question: Q: I have a level 6 Digimon with a digivolution cost of 3, and use this card's effect to reduce that cost by 4, to -1. Can I digivolve into that Digimon by gaining a memory?

BT1-109.answer:
A: No, it doesn't. Since the card doesn't specify breeding areas, the effect doesn't apply to Digimon there.
[1]
BT1-109.question: Q: Does activating this card's effect also reduce the digivolution cost of cards in my breeding area?
Q: During the turn I used this card, I digivolve a green Level 5 Digimon into a Level 6 Digimon using another card's effect, can I reduce the digivolution cost?

BT1-109.answer:
A: Yes, you can. As long as you're digivolving from a green Digimon, the effect applies.
[3]
BT1-109.question: Q: During the same turn I used this card, I digivolve a green Digimon into a non-green Digimon. Can I use this card's effect to reduce the digivolution cost?

BT1-110.answer: A: No, if your opponent's Digimon has ＜Blocker＞, it can't be suspended with this card's effect.
BT1-110.question: Q: My opponent uses an Option card or other effect to give one of their Digimon ＜Blocker＞. Can I use this card's security effect to suspend that Digimon?

BT1-111.answer: A: No. You can either suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon, regardless of DP, or 2 of your opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less. You can't mix and match.
BT1-111.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to suspend both 1 of my opponent's Digimon, and 2 of my opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less?

BT1-111.answer: A: Yes, this card's effect allows you to pick 1 Digimon and suspend it, regardless of DP.
BT1-111.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to suspend 1 of my opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or less, and no other Digimon?

BT1-112.answer: A: Yes. The effect has no limit to the number of times it can be used. As long as you keep deleting your opponent's Digimon, you can keep using the effect to unsuspend your Digimon.
BT1-112.question: Q: I've given one of my Digimon this card's effect. Can I unsuspend it over and over again every time I use it to delete an opponent's Digimon in battle?

BT1-112.answer: A: No, the effect doesn't activate in battles with Security Digimon.
BT1-112.question: Q: I've given one of my Digimon this card's effect. If it deletes an opponent's Security Digimon in battle, can I unsuspend my Digimon?

BT1-112.answer: A: Yes, if your Digimon deletes an opponent's Digimon and survives, you can unsuspend it, even if the opposing Digimon had ＜Blocker＞.
BT1-112.question: Q: I've given one of my Digimon this card's effect. I attack with it, and my opponent blocks it. If my Digimon deletes the opponent's blocking Digimon and survives, can I unsuspend my Digimon?

BT1-112.answer: A: No. You can only unsuspend the Digimon with this effect if it deletes the Digimon it's currently attacking by battle. Other Digimon and effects don't count.
BT1-112.question: Q: I've given one of my Digimon this card's effect. I attack an opponent's Digimon with it, and an effect causes one of my opponent's other Digimon to be deleted during the battle. Do I still get to unsuspend my Digimon?

BT1-113.question: Q: I use this card's effect on one of my opponent's Digimon, which they then digivolve. Can it now attack?

BT1-113.answer: A: No, this card's security effect only affects Digimon. Your opponent's Tamers unsuspend as normal.
BT1-113.question: Q: Does this card's security effect also prevent my opponent's suspended Tamers from unsuspending during their unsuspend phase?

BT1-114.answer: A: Yes, it can. Even if this Digimon's attack effect causes your memory to move to 1 or greater on your opponent's side, it doesn't become your opponent's turn until the end of the attack.
BT1-114.question: Q: Can this Digimon attack when I have less than 5 memory?

BT1-115.answer: A: Yes, it does. This card's [When Attacking] effect doesn't depend upon the color of your Tamers.
BT1-115.question: Q: Does this card's [When Attacking] effect activate when I have a Tamer that isn't blue in play?

BT1-115.answer: A: No. No matter how many blue Tamers you have in play, the effect only grants +1000 DP.
BT1-115.question: Q: I have 2 blue Tamers in play. During my turn, does this card's inherited effect grant +2000 DP?

BT1-115.answer: A: No, you cannot because it was already used. [Once Per Turn] effects are per card.
BT1-115.question: Q: After unsuspending itself with its [When Attacking] [Once Per Turn] effect, I digivolve into a new Digimon and attack with it. The security check reveals a card that ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ it back into [BT1-115 Veedramon]. Can I use the [Once Per Turn] effect of Veedramon again?

BT1-115.answer: A: Yes, you can use the [Once Per Turn] effect of the new [BT1-115 Veedramon] again. [Once Per Turn] effects are per card.
BT1-115.question: Q: After unsuspending itself with its [When Attacking] [Once Per Turn] effect, it got ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ into a level 3. I evolve it back into [BT1-115 Veedramon]. Can I use its effect?

BT10-001.question: Q: Will a 2 color red card meet the requirements for this effect?

BT10-004.question: Q: Does this effect also activate when your own Digimon are suspended?

BT10-006.question: Q: Does this effect also activate when this card is trashed by your own effect?

BT10-008.question: Q: Does the tamer card also need [Xros Heart] trait?
Q: If the effect only reveals 1 card with the [Xros Heart] trait do I add it to my hand even without having a 2nd card to add?
Q: If both a Digimon card and tamer card with the [Xros Heart] trait are revealed with this effect, must I add both of them to hand?

BT10-009.question: Q: If I choose not to move all digivolution cards from under this Digimon to under a tamer, will this Digimon still be deleted at the [End of Attack]?

BT10-009.answer: A: No, because there is no action being taken if you have no digivolution cards the effect cannot be activated if you have no digivolution cards.
BT10-009.question: Q: Even without digivolution cards, can I activate the [End of Attack] effect?
Q: Can the tamer being unsuspended and the tamer being given the digivolution cards be different tamers?

BT10-011.answer: A: No, no matter how many tamers are suspended at the same time you will only get 2000 DP.
BT10-011.question: Q: When multiple tamers are suspended at the same time, can I get more than 2000 DP?

BT10-011.answer: A: Yes, provided memory is on the opponent's side.
BT10-011.question: Q: If [BT8-013 BetelGammamon] is in the digivolution cards, does the [All Turns] effect let me attack with ＜Blitz＞?

BT10-011.answer: A: No, if this card is added to Kimeramon's digivolution cards with its [When Digivolving] effect it will gain BetelGammamon's ＜Blitz＞, but the time to trigger that effect has passed.
BT10-011.question: Q: if BT8-013 BetelGammamon digivolves into [BT8-084 Kimeramon], and Kimeramon places this card into its digivolution cards with its [When Digivolving] effect, does this card's [All Turns] effect allow Kimeramon to attack with ＜Blitz＞?
Q: If there are multiple cards with [Gammamon] in their names does the [All Turns] effect give me access to all of their effects?

BT10-011.answer: A: No, inherited effects are not targeted by this effect.
BT10-011.question: Q: Does the [All Turns] effect give me access to inherited effects as well?

BT10-011.answer: A: Due to this card's [All Turns] effect and inherited effect. You will have two of [BT8-008 Gammamon]'s "[Your Turn] [Once Per Turn] When you play a red Tamer, ＜Draw 1＞." As such, you will draw 2 cards in total.
BT10-011.question: Q: I have this Digimon in my battle area, this Digimon has [BT8-008 Gammamon] and another copy of this card in its digivolution cards. If I play a Red Tamer, how many cards do I draw?

BT10-016.question: Q: If Jesmon is in the digivolution cards and I control a Digimon with [Sistermon] in its name, does the when digivolving effect give me 4000 DP?

BT10-016.answer: A: Yes, however the rule that "A Digimon cannot attack the turn it was played" cannot be ignored.
BT10-016.question: Q:  Will the benefits of the [When Digivolving] effect be gained by Digimon newly entering the battle area after the fact?

BT10-019.question: Q: The [On Play] effect says: "Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Add 2 cards with the [Blue Flare] trait among them to your hand." and it says: "you may return 1 [MetalGreymon] from your trash to your hand", if I have a [Kiriha Aonuma] in play, can I choose which of these actions to perform?

BT10-023.answer: A: Yes, if the bonus card you draw for digivolution results in your hand having 7 cards, this effect will not activate.
BT10-023.question: Q: For the [When Digivolving] effect is the condition of having 6 or less cards in my hand checked after I draw for digivolution?

BT10-024.question: Q: Can the [On Play] effect target opponent's Digimon that have no digivolution cards?

Q: If I target a Digimon with less/equal digivolution cards than/to this Digimon with the [On Play] effect and later on that Digimon's digivolution cards surpass this Digimon's digivolution cards is it then able to attack and block?

BT10-027.answer: A: No, if both a level 3 and level 4 are present, please choose to either play both of them or neither of them, you cannot play just one of them.
BT10-027.question: Q: If I have both a Level 3 and level 4 Digimon card in this Digimon's digivolution cards, may I choose to play just one of them with the [When Attacking] effect?

BT10-030.question: Q: If I target a level 5 or lower Digimon with the [On Play] effect and later on that Digimon becomes level 6 or higher, does it still have ＜Security Attack -1＞?

BT10-032.question: Q: If the effect only reveals either an option with [Plug-In] in its name or a yellow tamer but not both, do I add that card to my hand?
Q: If both a Plug-in option and yellow tamer are revealed with this effect, must I add both of them to hand?

BT10-032.answer: A: Yes, how much you pay to use the option card does not matter, however, a card like [BT2-099 Glorious Burst] modifies its own cost while the card is in you hand, if such a card is used while its cost in you hand is 1 or less this effect will not activate.
BT10-032.question: Q: If the option card is used without paying its cost or if its cost is reduced to below 2 will the inherited effect activate?

BT10-032.answer: A: No, you must use an option card from your hand, or with an effect that says to "use" an option, in order to activate the inherited effect.
BT10-032.question: Q: If I activate the ＜Delay＞ effect of an option card in my battle area can I activate the inherited effect?
Q: If I use an option card that has no target for its effect can I activate the inherited effect?

BT10-034.answer: A: Yes, the effect applies no matter which of your Digimon is attacking.
BT10-034.question: Q: If this card is in the digivolution cards of a Digimon with [Shoutmon] in its name, and a different Digimon of mine attacks the opponent, will the security Digimon still be reduced by 2000 DP?

BT10-040.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 security when I attack do I apply both parts of the [When Attacking] effect?

BT10-041.answer:
A: It cannot be added to your security stack, so after the option's effect hasresolved, it will be sent to the trash.
[1]
BT10-041.question: Q: If my opponent used [BT9-103 Kongou], what happens to the option I use with the[When Digivolving] effect?

BT10-041.answer:
A: It will be placed in the Battle Area, this card's effect is to place it on top of your security when the option card would be placed in your trash, but if the option card is in your Battle Area at the resolution of the option's effect then it would never be placed in your trash, so it can't be placed in your security either.
[1]
BT10-041.question: Q: With the [When Digivolving] effect if I use an option that says "Then, place this card in your Battle Area", what happens?

BT10-041.answer:
A: Yes, the effect has already been activated. [BT4-105 Tactical Retreat!] is placed into security after this card is placed in security. So, [BT4-105 Tactical Retreat!] is the top card.
[2]
BT10-041.question: Q: With the [When Digivolving] effect of this card I play [BT4-105 Tactical Retreat!]. The [Main] effect of [BT4-105 Tactical Retreat!] chooses to place this card into the security. Will the [BT4-105 Tactical Retreat!] still be placed into security now that this card is no longer in the battle area?

BT10-042.answer: A: Yes, it affects Digimon with either condition.
BT10-042.question: Q: Does the [Opponent's Turn] effect affect Digimon with ＜Security Attack +X＞ and Digimon with ＜Security Attack -X＞ ?

BT10-042.answer: A: No, ＜Security Attack +1＞ will always apply from the moment digivolution is complete, so activating the [When Digivolving] effect is impossible.
BT10-042.question: Q: If my opponent has this Digimon, and I digivolve into a Digimon with a [When Digivolving] effect and ＜Security Attack +1＞ can I activate the [When Digivolving] effect?

BT10-042.answer: A: It refers both to ＜Security Attack +X＞ and ＜Security Attack -X＞ .
BT10-042.question: Q: What does ＜Security Attack＞ mean?

BT10-042.answer: A: No, even if the Digimon has both ＜Security Attack +1＞ and ＜Security Attack -1＞ the Digimon will still be treated as having ＜Security Attack＞ .
BT10-042.question: Q: If a Digimon has both ＜Security Attack +1＞ and ＜Security Attack -1＞ does that mean they cancel each other out and the Digimon will be treated as not having ＜Security Attack＞ ?

BT10-042.answer: A: Yes it will fully resolve, however as it will gain ＜Security Attack +1＞ during the effect, it will immediately be affected by this card's effect from that moment onwards.
BT10-042.question: Q: If my opponent controls this Digimon and my MetalGreymon digivolves into [BT9-015 MetalGreymon (X Antibody)] will its [When Digivolving] effect fully resolve?

BT10-042.answer: A: The attack continues because it didn't have ＜Security Attack＞ when it declared the attack, and the attack on this Digimon won't be canceled.
BT10-042.question: Q: If my opponent attacks this Digimon with a Digimon that doesn't have ＜Security Attack＞. It activates a [When Attacking] that gives it ＜Security Attack＞ afterwards. What happens to the attack?

Q: If a Digimon only gains ＜Security Attack +X＞ while meeting certain conditions, such as "While you have a Tamer in play", will it be affected by this cards effect while those conditions are not being met?

BT10-042.answer: A: Yes, the [When Attacking] has already activated.
BT10-042.question: Q: This card's effect stops the opponent from activating [When Attacking] effects, if the Digimon did not have ＜Security Attack＞ and activated a [When Attacking] effect that also applies "at the end of turn", does the "at the end of turn" still activate if it gains ＜Security Attack＞?

BT10-046.question: Q: Can I also add cards to my hand with the [Ancient Plant]/[Carnivorous Plant] trait with this effect?
Q: If the effect only reveals either a card with [Vegetation]/[Plant]/[Fairy] in one of its traits but not both, do I add that card to my hand?
Q: If both a card with [Vegetation]/[Plant]/[Fairy] in one of its traits are revealed with this effect, must I add both of them to hand?

BT10-046.answer: A: Yes, "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:VegetationCategory:Ancient PlantCategory:Carnivorous Plant
BT10-046.question: Q: When it says "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" (植物型), does it include traits other than [Vegetation] (植物型)?

BT10-048.answer: A: No, it will not. The Digimon was suspended by ＜Digisorption＞ before it was digivolved. So its inherited effect was not active when it was suspended.
BT10-048.question: Q: If this Digimon is digivolved into a Digimon with ＜Digisorption＞. Does this card's inherited effect trigger?

BT10-048.answer: A: Yes, "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:VegetationCategory:Ancient PlantCategory:Carnivorous Plant
BT10-048.question: Q: When it says "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" (植物型), does it include traits other than [Vegetation] (植物型)?

BT10-048.answer: A: Yes, "[Fairy] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:Fairy
BT10-048.question: Q: When it says "[Fairy] in one of its traits" (妖精型), does it include traits other than [Fairy] (妖精型)?

BT10-052.question: Q: If the opponent attacks while this Digimon itself is suspended, can I change the attack target to this Digimon?

BT10-052.answer:
A: Yes, this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect is a [Reaction]/[Counter] timing effect, so GrandisKuwagamon's [When Digivolving] effect will always be activated first, and you'll be able to activate this card's effect afterwards.
[2]
BT10-052.question: Q: My opponent's Digimon attacks and activates a [When Attacking] effect to digivolve it into [BT9-055 GrandisKuwagamon], with the [When Digivolving] effect they change the attack target to one of my suspended Digimon, after that is it possible to change the attack target again to a different suspended Digimon with this card's effect?

BT10-053.question: Q: Can I suspend this Digimon itself to activate the [Main] effect?

BT10-053.answer: A: No, it is the attack declaration that causes your Digimon to be suspended, not ＜Blitz＞ directly, so the inherited effect cannot activate.
BT10-053.question: Q: When a Digimon attacks and suspends with ＜Blitz＞, can I activate the inherited effect?

BT10-053.answer: A: Yes, "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:VegetationCategory:Ancient PlantCategory:Carnivorous Plant
BT10-053.question: Q: When it says "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" (植物型), does it include traits other than [Vegetation] (植物型)?

BT10-053.answer: A: Yes, "[Fairy] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:Fairy
BT10-053.question: Q: When it says "[Fairy] in one of its traits" (妖精型), does it include traits other than [Fairy] (妖精型)?

BT10-056.question: Q: During my opponent's turn, if this Digimon and my Digimon with [Vegetation]/[Plant]/[Fairy] in their traits are deleted at the same time, does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect allow them to activate the [On Deletion] effect being granted?

BT10-056.answer: A: Yes, "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:VegetationCategory:Ancient PlantCategory:Carnivorous Plant
BT10-056.question: Q: When it says "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" (植物型), does it include traits other than [Vegetation] (植物型)?

BT10-056.answer: A: Yes, "[Fairy] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:Fairy
BT10-056.question: Q: When it says "[Fairy] in one of its traits" (妖精型), does it include traits other than [Fairy] (妖精型)?

BT10-057.question: Q: Is it possible to utilize the [When Digivolving] effect to suspend this Digimon itself, so that I gain 2 memory, in order to immediately unsuspend this Digimon and give it ＜Piercing＞?
Q: If I have 4 suspended Digimon do I get 4000 DP and ＜Security Attack +2＞?
Q: If this Digimon itself is suspended, do I count it for the [Your Turn] effect?

BT10-057.answer: A: Yes, "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:VegetationCategory:Ancient PlantCategory:Carnivorous Plant
BT10-057.question: Q: When it says "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" (植物型), does it include traits other than [Vegetation] (植物型)?

BT10-057.answer: A: Yes, "[Fairy] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:Fairy
BT10-057.question: Q: When it says "[Fairy] in one of its traits" (妖精型), does it include traits other than [Fairy] (妖精型)?

BT10-058.answer: A: Place them at the bottom of your deck in any order, Please see the official site for details.
BT10-058.question: Q: What happens to the cards that I don't add to my hand?
Q: If the effect only reveals 1 card that I can add to my hand, do I add it to my hand even without having a 2nd card to add?

BT10-058.answer: A: Yes, you must add as much as possible.
BT10-058.question: Q: If the effect reveals 2 cards that can be added to hand, must I add both of them to hand?

BT10-059.question: Q: If my opponent does not have a target for this card's ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ on 1 of your opponent's Digimon, is it still possible to place this card into the digivolution cards of one of my Digimon?

BT10-061.question: Q: If I'm unable to add any of the revealed cards to my hand, am I still able to delete one of my opponent's Digimon with a Play Cost of 4 or less when performing DigiXros with 2 cards?

BT10-066.question: Q: If I am unable to play a Digimon with the [All Turns] effect, is it still possible to add a card from this Digimon's digivolution cards to my hand?

BT10-068.answer: A: Your Digimon's  DP is returned to its original value, and on top of that their  DP is increased by 2000 more because of the other part of this card's [When Digivolving] effect.
BT10-068.question: Q: If because of this card's [When Digivolving] effect my Digimon's DP cannot be reduced, but one of my Digimon already had its  DP reduced earlier, what happens to that Digimon's  DP?

BT10-069.question: Q: If neither player controls a tamer to delete with the "Then" part of the [When Digivolving] effect, does this Digimon still unsuspend?
Q: With the "Then" part of the [When Digivolving] effect, if only I control a tamer, do I have to delete it?

BT10-070.answer: A: No, this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect is a [Reaction]/[Counter] timing effect, so all of your opponent's [When Attacking] effects will have to activate first, and you'll be able to activate this card's effect afterwards.
BT10-070.question: Q: If a level 4 or lower Digimon attacks, can I delete it with this card's effect before it has a chance to activate any [When Attacking] effects?

BT10-070.answer: A: No, you must have exactly 3 to activate ＜Blitz＞.
BT10-070.question: Q: For this card's [On Play] effect, if I have 4 or more digivolution cards, can I activate ＜Blitz＞?
Q: Does this card have ＜Blitz＞ in the deck, when revealed by [BT5-009 Shoutmon]?

BT10-070.answer: A: Only if it has 3 digivolution cards, but the check will ignore the [On Play].
BT10-070.question: Q: If this Digimon has [BT5-014 OmniShoutmon], does this Digimon gain ＜Security Attack +1＞?

BT10-071.answer: A: No, it was after the Digimon was deleted that the trash increased to 10 cards, so the timing does not work.
BT10-071.question: Q: There are 9 cards in my trash, if the Digimon that this card was in the digivolution cards of was deleted in battle and that put the trash to 10 cards, will the inherited effect of ＜Retaliation＞ activate?

BT10-073.question: Q: If the effect only reveals either a Digimon card with the [Bagra Army] trait or a [Yuu Amano] but not both, do I add that card to my hand?
Q: If both a Digimon card with the [Bagra Army] trait and [Yuu Amano] are revealed with this effect, must I add both of them to hand?

BT10-073.answer: A: Yes, "[Bagra Army] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:Bagra Army
BT10-073.question: Q: When it says "[Bagra Army] in one of its traits" (バグラ軍), does it include traits other than [Bagra Army] (バグラ軍)?

BT10-077.answer:
A: No, when an opponent triggers 2 effects at the same time that will ＜Draw 1＞, this effect can activate in response to either of those effect activations, but not both at once, in either case ＜Draw 1＞ will only add 1 card to their hand, so they will only trash 1 card when this effect is activated.
[1]
BT10-077.question: Q: In regards to the [Opponent's Turn] effect, if my opponent attacks with a Digimon and activates 2 [When Attacking] effects that each ＜Draw 1＞, can I cause them to trash 2 cards in their hand?

BT10-077.answer:
A: Yes, they added 2 cards to their hand with their effect, so this effect will cause them to trash 2 cards, in regards to the example given they will end up trashing 4 cards total, 2 from their own effect and 2 from yours.
[1]
BT10-077.question: Q: In regards to the [Opponent's Turn] effect, when the opponent activates an effect like "＜Draw 2＞ then trash 2" resulting in a net change of 0 to their hand size, can I activate this effect?

BT10-077.answer:
A: It will only trash 1 card.
[2]
BT10-077.question: Q: My opponent uses a card with "..＜Draw 1＞. Then, ..., ＜Draw 1＞". Does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect trash 1 or 2 cards?

BT10-077.answer:
A: Yes, you can choose which draw it triggered against.
[2]
BT10-077.question: Q: My opponent uses a card with "..＜Draw 1＞. Then, ..., ＜Draw 1＞ for each of your X". Can I choose whether my opponent trashes 1 or X cards?

BT10-077.answer:
A: As the opponent increased their hand by 1 twice, rather than 2 at the same time. They will trash 1.
[3]
BT10-077.question: Q: My opponent activates [EX4-014 Gaossmon]. Do they trash 1 or 2 cards when I activate this card?

BT10-080.question: Q: When activating this card's effect to digivolve into a Digimon card from the trash, can this card itself be the card I select to digivolve into?

BT10-081.question: Q: There are 9 cards in my trash, if this Digimon being deleted puts the trash to10 cards, will the [On Deletion] effect activate?

BT10-084.question: Q: In regards to the [Opponent's Turn] effect, can I also activate this effect in response to my opponents effects that trash my digivolution cards?

BT10-084.answer:
A: Yes, you can. In that case, trash as many digivolution cards as possible.
[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: This Digimon has only 1 digivolution card, when one of my other Digimon with 2 digivolution cards would be affected by an effect such as "Trash 2 digivolution cards", can the [Opponent's Turn] effect be activated?

BT10-084.answer:
A: Yes, you can. If you do, trash the total number of digivolution cards that would have been trashed from each of the Digimon that you replaced with this Digimon.
[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: If a "trash the bottom digivolution card" is applied on 2 of my Digimon. Can I activate this card's [Opponent's Turn] so that it trashes only this card's digivolution cards?

BT10-084.answer:
A: Just 1, the amount of cards that could be trashed by the effect does not matter, only the amount that would have been trashed as a result of that specific activation.
[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: When one of my other Digimon with only 1 digivolution card would be affected by "Trash 2 digivolution cards", I decide to active this Digimon's [Opponent's Turn] effect, how many of this Digimon's digivolution cards do I need to trash?

BT10-084.answer:
A: Yes, you can. If you do while this Digimon has no digivolution cards, digivolution cards will not be trashed. If there are effects that activate when digivolution cards are trashed, such as "By trashing a digivolution card," (e.g. Costs) the effect will not proceed because digivolution cards were not trashed.
[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: A "trash digivolution cards" effect targets one of my Digimon when this Digimon has 0 digivolution cards. Can I activate this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect?

BT10-084.answer:
A: Yes, it is. If you can trash the number of digivolution cards specified by the effect from this Digimon, your Digimon with 0 digivolution cards can indeed activate such an effect,
[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: Is it possible for one of my Digimon with 0 digivolution cards to activate an effect that reads "By trashing X of this Digimon's digivolution cards" by way of activating this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect and trashing those cards from this Digimon?

BT10-084.answer:
A: Yes, you can. If you trash 1 digivolution card for each of your Digimon, you do not have to trash your other Digimon's digivolution cards.
[1]
BT10-084.question: Q: My opponent activates a "Trash the bottom digivolution card of all of your opponent's Digimon" effect. Can I use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to trash just this 1 Digimon's digivolution cards without trashing my other Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT10-084.answer:
A: No, you change the target of the effect and trash 2 from the bottom of this Digimon.
[2]
BT10-084.question: Q: If my opponent activates [BT5-088 Sora Takenouchi & Joe Kido], and I choose to activate this card's effect in response. Do I get to choose which of my digivolution cards are trashed?

BT10-084.answer:
A: It would trash 1 digivolution card (as much as possible) after redirecting the effect.
[2]
BT10-084.question: Q: If this Digimon has [BT9-109 X Antibody] and my opponent activates [BT5-088 Sora Takenouchi & Joe Kido] and I choose to activate this card's effect in response. How many cards does this Digimon trash?

BT10-084.answer:
A: It would trash 2 digivolution cards (as much as possible) after redirecting the effect.
[2]
BT10-084.question: Q: If my other Digimon has [BT9-109 X Antibody] and my opponent activates [BT5-088 Sora Takenouchi & Joe Kido] targeting that Digimon, and I choose to activate this card's effect in resposne. How many cards does this Digimon trash?

BT10-086.answer: A: The player that activated the effect chooses which card is trash.
BT10-086.question: Q: When the opponent's security are revealed with this card's effect, who gets to choose which card is trashed?

BT10-087.answer:
A: Normally when you DigiXros the requirements can only be placed from your hand or battle area, but with this card's effect you can also place requirements from under your tamers as well.
[1]
BT10-087.question: Q: What does the [Your Turn] effect do?
Q: Can I place requirements from under my other tamers as well? Not just thistamer?
Q: If I have a tamer in the digivolution cards of a Digimon, can I also place requirements from under that tamer as well?

BT10-087.answer:
A: No, this effect only targets 1 Digimon. The effect of this card will not trigger when 2 Digimon are played at the same time.
[2]
BT10-087.question: Q: If I use [BT7-097 Tidal Wave] to play 2 Digimon with [DigiXros] requirements and I suspend 1 of this card, can I place cards underneath both Digimon for their [DigiXros]?

BT10-087.answer:
A: No, you can only activate this card's effect when playing exactly 1 Digimon and when that Digimon has [DigiXros] requirements.
[3]
BT10-087.question: Q: If I play 1 Digimon with [DigiXros] requirements and 1 Digimon without [DigiXros] requirements at the same time, can I activate this card's effect?

BT10-088.answer:
A: Normally when you DigiXros the requirements can only be placed from your hand or battle area, but with this card's effect you can also place requirements from under your tamers as well.
[1]
BT10-088.question: Q: What does the [Your Turn] effect do?
Q: Can I place requirements from under my other tamers as well? Not just thistamer?
Q: If I have a tamer in the digivolution cards of a Digimon, can I also place requirements from under that tamer as well?

BT10-088.answer:
A: No, this effect only targets 1 Digimon. The effect of this card will not trigger when 2 Digimon are played at the same time.
[2]
BT10-088.question: Q: If I use [BT7-097 Tidal Wave] to play 2 Digimon with [DigiXros] requirements and I suspend 1 of this card, can I place cards underneath both Digimon for their [DigiXros]?

BT10-088.answer:
A: No, you can only activate this card's effect when playing exactly 1 Digimon and when that Digimon has [DigiXros] requirements.
[3]
BT10-088.question: Q: If I play 1 Digimon with [DigiXros] requirements and 1 Digimon without [DigiXros] requirements at the same time, can I activate this card's effect?

BT10-089.question: Q: If I have a tamer in the digivolution cards of a Digimon, can I play a [Dorulumon] from under that tamer?

BT10-090.question: Q: If I have a tamer in the digivolution cards of a Digimon, can I play a [Ballistamon] from under that tamer?

BT10-092.answer: A: Place them at the bottom of your deck in any order, Please see the official site for detail.
BT10-092.question: Q: What happens to the cards that I don't add to my hand?

BT10-093.answer:
A: Yes, the digivolution cards placed by this card will be placed first.
[1]
BT10-093.question: Q: When my DigiXros Digimon would be played, is it possible to separately place cards into its digivolution cards by both its own DigiXros and this tamer's effect?

BT10-093.answer:
A: The digivolution cards will return to where they were previously before placing them as digivolution cards.
[2]
BT10-093.question: Q: If my opponent has [BT8-071 Psychemon] and I attempt to play [BT10-084 Tacimon] while I only have 2 memory. What happens to the digivolution cards placed underneath by this card when Tactimon returns to the hand.

BT10-093.answer:
A: No, it will not as the Digimon card was not in play at the time of placing digivolution cards underneath.
[2]
BT10-093.question: Q: If my opponent has [BT11-088 Bagramon] in play and I activate this card to place digivolution cards underneath a Digimon. Will the [Opponent's Turn] effect of Bagramon activate?

BT10-096.question: Q: Does this card's security effect let me play a [Taiki Kudo] revealed from the top of my deck?
Q: If among the revealed cards there is no Digimon card with the [Xros Heart] trait, may I still play a revealed [Taiki Kudo]?

BT10-096.answer: A: No, if both a Digimon with the [Xros Heart] trait and [Taiki Kudo] are revealed, please choose to either perform both of those actions or perform neither of them, you cannot perform just one of them.
BT10-096.question: Q: If I reveal both a Digimon with the [Xros Heart] trait and [Taiki Kudo], may I choose to just add a Digimon with the [Xros Heart] trait to my hand and not play a revealed Taiki Kudo? Or vice versa?

BT10-097.question: Q: If [Kiriha Aonuma] is among the cards revealed by this card's effect, can it be played?

BT10-097.answer:
A: Yes, you can add 1 card if only 1 card is revealed.
[1]
BT10-097.question: Q: Can this card's effect add fewer than 2 cards to my hand if it reveals fewer than 2 cards with the [Blue Flare] trait trait among the 6 revealed cards?

BT10-097.answer:
A: No. For this card's effect you reveal cards, add 2 cards with the [Blue Flare] trait trait among them to your hand, then play 1 [Kiriha Aonuma] among them. Therefore, if there are 2 or fewer cards with the [Blue Flare] trait trait including [Kiriha Aonuma] among the revealed cards, you can't play [Kiriha Aonuma] because you would have to add it to your hand.
[1]
BT10-097.question: Q: If there aren't 2 other Digimon cards with the [Blue Flare] trait trait among the six revealed cards, can I still play [Kiriha Aonuma] from among the revealed cards?

BT10-097.answer:
A: No, if you perform any of this effect you must perform as much of it as possible, so if both cards with the [Blue Flare] trait trait and a [Kiriha Aonuma] are among the 3 cards revealed, you must perform both "add [...] to your hand" and "play 1 [Kiriha Aonuma]," or you must choose to perform neither.
[1]
BT10-097.question: Q: This card's effect reveals 6 cards. If both cards with the [Blue Flare] trait trait and a [Kiriha Aonuma] are among the cards revealed, can I choose to only activate the effect that adds the cards to my hand and not play [Kiriha Aonuma], or the other way around?

BT10-100.question: Q: If I don't play a [Pulsemon] from my hand, do I still place this card into the battle area?

BT10-101.question: Q: If I have exactly 3 security do I apply both parts of the effect?

BT10-101.answer:
A: Yes, by the time the security effect is activated this card will no longer be counted as part of the security stack.
[1]
BT10-101.question: Q: If I have 4 security when my opponent performs a security check, and this is the revealed card, for this effect do I count as having 3 security?

BT10-103.question: Q: Can the Digimon suspended by this effect, and the Digimon returned to deck by this effect, be different Digimon?

BT10-105.answer: A: No, the "can't be deleted by your opponent's effects" part of this card's effect still applies whether the target of the option is now a Tamer or a Digimon.
BT10-105.question: Q: If I use this option on a Digimon which is later de-digivolved into a Tamer, will my opponent be able to delete that Tamer with an effect on their turn?

BT10-108.answer: A: No, a card being revealed from the top of the deck does not count as being in the deck.
BT10-108.question: Q: If this card is revealed from the top of the deck and trashed from among those revealed cards, do I add this card to my hand with its effect?

BT10-110.answer:
A: No. Because [Jesmon GX]'s [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking] effects cannot be activated due to your opponent's [BT10-042 Venusmon], even this card can't activate those effects in these circumstances.
[1]
BT10-110.question: Q: I have a [Jesmon GX] that has ＜Security Attack＞ in play, while my opponent has a [BT10-042 Venusmon] in play. If I use this card and target my [Jesmon GX], can this card's effect activate [Jesmon GX]'s [When Digivolving] effects?

BT10-110.answer:
A: No, using this option does not "place" a card in the Battle Area, so [BT13-007 King Drasil_7D6] does not gain any memory when this card is used.
[2]
BT10-110.question: Q: Does using this option trigger [BT13-007 King Drasil_7D6]'s inherited effect?

BT10-110.answer:
A: No, when this card is used, it is only sent to trash after the effect is finished activating, so it is sent to trash after [BT13-090 LordKnightmon]'s effect activates
[2]
BT10-110.question: Q: I use [BT10-110 Seiken Meppa], targeting [BT10-112 Jesmon GX] to activate its [When Digivolving] effect. I place [BT13-090 LordKnightmon] with the effect of [BT10-112 Jesmon GX] and activate [BT13-090 LordKnightmon]’s [When Digivolving] effect. Am I able to add the same [BT10-110 Seiken Meppa] card that I used back to hand?

BT10-111.answer: A: It means this Digimon may be treated as if it were 1 of the listed requirements for that DigiXros, for example if the listed requirements are [Shoutmon X4] +[Beelzemon], this Digimon may be treated as [Shoutmon X4]/[Beelzemon] for that DigiXros.
BT10-111.question: Q: "When you would DigiXros this turn, this Digimon may replace 1 of the DigiXros requirements." What does that mean?

BT10-111.answer: A: No, this effect only lets you treat it as 1 requirement for the DigiXros.
BT10-111.question: Q: If this is the first card I place into the digivolution cards when digixrossing, can I continue treating it as other additional requirements and meet all of them with just 1 card?

BT11-005.question: Q: If this Digimon with [Greymon] in its name and the opponent's Digimon are deleted at the same time, will this card's inherited effect activate?

BT11-006.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate even if cards in hand are trashed by my opponent's effect?

BT11-007.answer: A: No, you can add a red tamer card to your hand even if it doesn't have [Vaccine] trait. Only red Digimon cards cannot be added to your hand unless they have [Vaccine] trait.
BT11-007.question: Q: The effect of this card is that the red tamer card among the cards revealed from the deck cannot be added to the hand unless it has the [Vaccine] trait.

BT11-007.answer: A: No, even if you only have a red Digimon card with the [Vaccine] trait or a red tamer card, add it to your hand.
BT11-007.question: Q: Can this card's effect be added to the hand unless there are both a red Digimon card with the [Vaccine] trait and a red tamer card among the 3 cards revealed?

BT11-007.answer: A: No, the effect of this card is "add one card to your hand", so you need to add it to your hand as much as possible.
BT11-007.question: Q: The effect of this card is that if there are both a red Digimon card with the [Vaccine] trait a red tamer card among the three cards that are revealed, add only one of them to your hand, and add one to your hand. is it possible to put the back under the deck?
Q: If the Digimon that has this card as an digivolution cards and my red tamer disappear at the same time, will the gain 1 memory effect be activated?

BT11-008.answer:
A: Yes, since the target of the attack has been changed by ＜Blocker＞, it will work.
[1]
BT11-008.question: Q: If a Digimon that has this card as its digivolution cards attacks the opponent and the opponent blocks with ＜Blocker＞, will this card's inherited effect activate?

BT11-009.question: Q: Due to the effect "The name of this card/Digimon are also treated as [Shoutmon] and [Starmons].”, can this card be selected as the target of effects that target only [Shoutmon]/[Starmons]?

BT11-010.answer:
A: Yes, since the target of the attack has been changed by ＜Blocker＞, it will work.
[1]
BT11-010.question: Q: If a Digimon that has this card as its digivolution cards attacks the opponent and the opponent blocks with ＜Blocker＞, will this card's inherited effect activate?

BT11-012.answer: A: Yes. It is possible. In that case, add as many cards as possible to your hand.
BT11-012.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect add cards to my hand even if there is only one card that has the [Xros Heart] trait or [Blue Flare] trait among the revealed cards?

BT11-016.answer: A: No, I cannot. This effect is triggered "when the opponent's security is reduced", so even if you check multiple copies of your opponent's security, you can choose whether to trigger it at the first check. And since it's a [Once Per Turn] effect, if it activates when the security is reduced on the first check, it won't activate on the next check.
BT11-016.question: Q: Can this card's [Your Turn] effect activate twice when I check 2 opponent's security cards with my Digimon with ＜Security Attack +1＞?

BT11-016.answer: A: Yes, "[Bird] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:BirdCategory:Ancient BirdCategory:Bird DragonCategory:Giant BirdCategory:Holy BirdCategory:Ancient BirdkinCategory:AvianCategory:BirdkinCategory:Mini BirdCategory:Mysterious Bird
BT11-016.question: Q: When it says "[Bird] in one of its traits" (鳥), does it include traits other than [Bird] (鳥)?

BT11-016.answer: A: Yes, "[Beast] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:Ancient Mythical BeastCategory:Beast DragonCategory:Beast KnightCategory:BeastCategory:Holy BeastCategory:Mythical BeastCategory:Rare AnimalCategory:Four SovereignsCategory:Ancient AnimalCategory:Ancient AquabeastCategory:AquabeastCategory:BeastkinCategory:Dark AnimalCategory:Mysterious BeastCategory:Sea Beast
BT11-016.question: Q: When it says "[Beast] in one of its traits" (獣), does it include traits other than [Beast] (獣)?

BT11-016.answer: A: The Digimon card that is played with this card's [On Deletion] effect is "a red Digimon card with a 3000 DP or less that includes a [Avian]/[Bird]/[Beast]/[Animal]/[Sovereign] in one of its traits." For example, it means that the upper limit of "3000 DP or less" will be +2000. For example, if you have one red tamer, you can make a Digimon card with a 5000 DP or less, and if you have two tamers, a Digimon card with a 7000 DP or less.
BT11-016.question: Q: What does this card mean, "For each red tamer you have, add 2000 to the maximum DP of the card you can play by this effect."

BT11-016.answer: A: No, I cannot. It is valid only for the [On Deletion] effect that this card itself.
BT11-016.question: Q: Can this card's effect of "add 2000 to the maximum DP of the card you can play by this effect for each of my red tamers" also apply to other effects that play Digimon?

BT11-017.answer:
A: Yes, since the target of the attack has been changed by ＜Blocker＞, it will work.
[1]
BT11-017.question: Q: If this Digimon attacks the opponent and the opponent blocks with ＜Blocker＞, will this card's [Your Turn] effect activate?

BT11-018.question: Q: Due to the effect "The name of this card/Digimon are also treated as as [OmniShoutmon] and [ZeigGreymon].”, can this card be selected as the target of effects that target only as [OmniShoutmon]/[ZeigGreymon]?

BT11-020.answer: A: No, even if you only have a Digimon card with [Gaogamon] in its name or a blue tamer card, add it to your hand.
BT11-020.question: Q: Can this card's effect not add a card to my hand unless there are both a Digimon card with [Gaogamon] in its name and a blue tamer card among the revealed cards?

BT11-020.answer: A: Yes, at it says to “Add to your hand”, you must add a revealed card that fulfils the condition to your hand if you are able to.
BT11-020.question: Q: The effect of this card is that if there are both a Digimon card with [Gaogamon] in its name and a blue tamer card among the revealed cards, only one of them can be added to the hand and the other can be trashed. Must I add one to my hand?

BT11-023.answer: A: No, even if you only have either a Digimon card with [Veedramon] in its name or a blue tamer card, add it to your hand.
BT11-023.question: Q: Can this card's effect not add a card to my hand unless there are both a Digimon card with [Veedramon] in its name and a blue tamer card among the revealed cards?

BT11-023.answer: A: Yes, at it says to “Add to your hand”, you must add a revealed card that fulfils the condition to your hand if you are able to.
BT11-023.question: Q: The effect of this card is that if there are both a Digimon card with [Veedramon] in its name and a blue tamer card among the three cards that are revealed, add only one of them to your hand and add one to the bottom of your deck. Must I add one to my hand?

BT11-024.answer: A: Yes, "[Aqua] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:Ancient AquabeastCategory:AquabeastCategory:AquaticCategory:Sea Animal
BT11-024.question: Q: When it says "[Aqua] in one of its traits" (水棲), does it include traits other than [Aqua] (水棲)?

BT11-029.answer: A: No, it is considered to be activating a Tamer's card effect.
BT11-029.question: Q: If I activate this card's effect to activate an [On Play] effect, does that count as activating a Digimon's card effect?

BT11-030.question: Q: Due to the effect "The name of this card/Digimon are also treated as as [MetalGreymon] and [Cyberdramon].”, can this card be selected as the target of effects that target only as [MetalGreymon ]/[Cyberdramon]?

BT11-033.answer:
A: No, since the card was not revealed by a security check, its [Security] effect can't be activated.
[1]
BT11-033.question: Q: Can the [Security] effect of the card added to the hand with this card's "your opponent adds the top card of their security stack to their hand" effect be activated?

BT11-033.answer:
A: No, Burst Digivolution is a mechanic, not an effect, so it doesn't count as "When an effect adds cards to your opponent's hand".
[2]
BT11-033.question: Q: If my opponent returns a Tamer to their hand by Burst Digivolving, does this card's [All Turns] effect activate?

BT11-037.answer: A: This Digimon cannot attack the player, so it will attack the opponent's Digimon. If there is no opponent Digimon to attack, such as when there is no opponent’s suspended Digimon, it will not attack.

BT11-040.answer:
A: Each Digimon activates its inherited effect once, and only the Digimon that activates it later remains in the Battle Area. An interrupting "when you would" effect will trigger and activate only once during a series of effects derived from one effect activation, even if it is not a [Once Per Turn] effect. After the original effect has been activated, it can be triggered and activated again.

A: Your level 6 Digimon is selected as the target of "By deleting 1 of your Digimon". Then, if this card's inherited effect attempts to delete the [EX1-073 Machinedramon].However, if [EX1-073 Machinedramon] activates its effect in response, it will not be deleted by the effect of.Because it no longer gets deleted, this card's inherited effect cannot prevent the deletion, the level 6 Digimon gets deleted by the effect of [BT8-107 Pandemonium Flame].<br. />As such, because your Digimon was deleted, it can delete an opponent's unsuspended Digimon whose level is less than or equal to the deleted Digimon.

A: The original name will be changed to [Sukamon] and the colour will be changed to White, but the effect of "treat as XXX" will not be lost, so at the same time as being treated as [Sukamon] and White, the name and colour due to those pre-existing effects will not be changed.

A: [ST12-13 Sistermon Ciel], [BT6-084 Sistermon Ciel], and [BT7-083 Sistermon Ciel (Awakened)] are also treated as [Sistermon Noir]/[Sistermon Noir (Awakened)] respectively, but these are special game rules and not effects, so if this card's [On Play] or [When Digivolving] effects would target them, their names will be changed to [Sukamon]. A: Your level 6 Digimon is selected as the target of "By deleting 1 of your Digimon". A: It will keep the DP reduction, and if after applying the previous DP reduction to the new DP value (3000), its DP is 0 then it will be deleted.

BT11-043.answer:
A: The Digimon will be treated as a White Level 2 Digimon named [Sukamon], but it will not have DP, so it will be sent to the trash (not deleted) since a Digimon without DP cannot exist in the battle area.

BT11-043.answer:

BT11-044.answer: A: Yes, you can choose freely as long as the total play cost is 7 or less.

BT11-045.answer: A: Yes. It is possible. This effect triggers every time security is checked and flipped.

After the first effect has been activated, the second Digimon that was waiting to activate will activate its effect before the [Reaction]/[Counter] timing, but the first Digimon is already attacking, so it cannot attack. effect ends. As a result, only the opponent's Digimon that activated its effect first will attack.

BT12-083.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, can I place an opponent's Digimon into the evolution sources of another Digimon that currently has "This Digimon isn't affected by your opponent's Digimon effects"?

BT12-084.answer: A: Since the effect has already been activated, even if the [Sparrowmon] leaves the digivolution cards, the effect will continue until the end of the opponent's next turn.
BT12-084.question: Q: With this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect, all of my Digimon gain ＜Blocker＞ and the effect of not returning to the hand or deck. If [Sparrowmon] is no longer in this card's digivolution cards, what will happen to the effect(s) that my Digimon got?

BT12-088.answer: A: No, if the current DP of the Digimon is not 10000 or higher when the effect is activated, you will not gain 2 memory.
BT12-088.question: Q: A Digimon with this card as its digivolution card attacked the player while it had 10000 DP and checked security. If the [Security] effect of the flipped card reduces the DP to 9000 or less, can the memory +2 effect of this card's digivolution card effect be activated?

BT12-088.answer: A: This card's "When this Digimon checks your opponent's security stack" condition is triggered when this Digimon attacks your opponent or activates ＜Piercing＞ and performs a security check. "When your opponent's security is reduced" is triggered not only by security checks, but also when the number of security cards is reduced by other means, such as "Trash your opponent's security" effects.
BT12-088.question: Q: How is this card's "When this Digimon checks your opponent's security stack" trigger condition different from "When your opponent's security is reduced"?

BT12-088.answer: A: Yes, this card's inherited effect activates after the [Security] effect but before the battle with the Security Digimon.
BT12-088.question: Q: I attack the player with a Digimon that has this card as a digivolution card. The Digimon gets deleted in a battle with a Security Digimon. In this case, can I gain 2 memory off this card's inherited effect?

BT12-089.answer:
A: Yes. you can. In that case, the cards will still be in the digivolution cards of [Guilmon].
[1]
BT12-089.question: Q: After using this card's [Main] effect to place this card, 1 [Growlmon], and 1 [WarGrowlmon] as digivolution cards for [Guilmon], can I choose not to digivolve into a [Gallantmon] in your hand?
Q: If I activate another card's effect to digivolve one of my Digimon, can I digivolve my [Guilmon] into a [Gallantmon] in my hand?

BT12-090.answer:
A: Yes, it will still activate.
[1]
BT12-090.question: Q: For this card's [Your Turn] effect, will it activate even if the attacking Digimon is not "Blue and Green" but "Green and Blue" instead?

BT12-090.answer:
A: No, it cannot. That Digimon is not a "2-color Digimon" even if it has blue and green in its colours.
[2]
BT12-090.question: Q: Will this card's [Your Turn] effect work even if I attack with a Digimon that has 3 or more colors, including blue and green?

BT12-092.answer: A: This Tamer will be able to attack just like a Digimon and will also be subject to effects that target a Digimon. It can also be destroyed in battle with a Digimon or Security Digimon.
BT12-092.question: Q: What does it mean that this Tamer's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect causes it to also be treated as a Digimon?

BT12-092.answer: A: Yes, it will be deleted.
BT12-092.question: Q: If this card is also being treated as a Digimon due to its [Start of Your Main Phase] effect and has its DP reduced to 0 by an opponent's effect, is it deleted?

BT12-092.answer: A: Yes, it will trigger. If this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect has been activated, this card is treated as both a Digimon and a Tamer, so when it becomes suspended, it will trigger the "When this Tamer becomes suspended" effect.
BT12-092.question: Q: If this card is also being treated as a Digimon due to its [Start of Your Main Phase] effect and is suspended, does that trigger this card's [Your Turn] "When this Tamer becomes suspended" effect?

BT12-092.answer: A: No, it is not. This card's effect only treats this card as a Digimon (not a Digimon card), and, once it is placed as a digivolution source for another Digimon, the effect no longer applies and it is treated only as a Tamer card.
BT12-092.question: Q: If this card is also being treated as a Digimon due to its [Start of Your Main Phase] effect and is placed as a digivolution source for another Digimon by an effect that says "Place a Digimon as a digivolution source for another Digimon", is this card treated as a Digimon card in the digivolution sources?

BT12-098.answer: A: No, if you only reveal one or the other, you get to add the one card to your hand.
BT12-098.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck do not include both 1 Digimon card with ＜Save＞ in its card text and 1 card with [Hunter] trait, am I not allowed to add a card to my hand?

BT12-098.answer: A: No, you should add to your hand as much as possible.
BT12-098.question: Q: If I reveal both 1 Digimon card with Digimon card with ＜Save＞ in its card text and 1 card with [Hunter] trait, am I allowed to add 1 card to hand and put the other on the bottom of my deck?

BT12-099.answer: A: No, it can not. A Digimon that is unable to attack cannot declare an attack by this card's effect.
BT12-099.question: Q: Can this card's [Main] effect attack with my suspended Digimon or a Digimon played that turn?
Q: When attacking with this card's [Main] effect, does that Digimon's [When Attacking] effect activate?

BT12-100.answer: A: No, it can not. A Digimon that is unable to attack cannot be attacked by this card's effect.
BT12-100.question: Q: Can this card's [Main] effect declare an attack with my Digimon that was played that turn?
Q: When attacking with this card's [Main] effect, does that Digimon's [When Attacking] effect activate?

BT12-102.question: Q: If I place 1 of my blue Digimon as the bottom digivolution card of 1 of my other Digimon with this card's effect, what happens to the digivolution cards that the placed Digimon had?

BT12-102.answer: A: [BT9-109 X-Antibody] is also trashed since it is trashed by game rules and not by an effect.
BT12-102.question: Q: If I place 1 of my blue Digimon as the bottom digivolution card of 1 of my other Digimon with this card's effect, what happens if the placed Digimon had [BT9-109 X-Antibody] as a digivolution card?

BT12-104.question: Q: If I have a dual-color yellow and red Tamer in play, does it count twice for this card's [Main] effect?

BT12-104.answer: A: 3 of your opponent's Digimon get -4000 DP. This card's effect only targets 3 of your opponent's Digimon.
BT12-104.question: Q: If I have two yellow or red Tamers in play, does this card's [Main] effect cause 6 of my opponent's Digimon to get -2000 DP or 3 of my opponent's Digimon to get -4000 DP?

BT12-105.answer: A: Yes, you would win the game.
BT12-105.question: Q: If my opponent has 1 security, my Digimon attacks the player directly, and an opponent's Digimon that has been given the [On Deletion] effect of this card's [Main] effect is deleted by a [When Attacking] effect, do I win the game since the security card is trashed before the attack happens?

BT12-106.answer: A: No, it does not unsuspend. This card's effect is "All of your opponent's cards don't unsuspend during their next unsuspend phase", so Digimon played or moved into the Battle Area after this card's [Main] effect is activated are also affected by it.
BT12-106.question: Q: After I activate this card's [Main] effect, my opponent plays a suspended Digimon by an effect. Does that Digimon become unsuspended during their next unsuspend phase?

BT12-107.answer: A: Yes, you can. In that case, the effect ends without performing an attack.
BT12-107.question: Q: For this card's [Main] effect, can I choose an opponent's digimon that has an effect that makes it unable to attack?

BT12-107.answer: A: At the beginning of the opponent's Main Phase, both of the effects given by this card trigger at the same time, and the opponent chooses which to activate first. After activating [When Attacking] (and such) effects, both Digimon's pending effects must be activated before the [Reaction]/[Counter] timing, but an attack cannot be declared while in the middle of an attack, so the effect ends. As a result, only the Digimon whose effect is activated first declares an attack.
BT12-107.question: Q: If I use this card twice, giving two of my opponent's Digimon the "[Start of Your Main Phase] Attack with this Digimon." effect, what happens?

BT12-107.answer: A: When it becomes the opponent's turn, the opponent's Digimon loses the benefit of "This Digimon is not affected by your opponent's effects", so the effect given by this card causes it to attack at the beginning of the Main Phase.
BT12-107.question: Q: What happens if I target an opponent's Digimon with "[Opponent's Turn] This Digimon is not affected by your opponent's effects" for this card's effect?

BT12-110.answer: A: This card can activate if one of your Digimon digivolves into [Beelzemon (X Antibody)] while this card is in the trash. [Trash] indicates that this card can be used while it's in the trash.
BT12-110.question: Q: What exactly does the timing of [Trash] [Your Turn] mean?

BT12-110.answer: A: No, activating an effect from the trash is different from using an option card, so there's no need to meet color requirements and you do not pay a memory cost.
BT12-110.question: Q: If I were to activate this card's [Trash] effect, does it have a color requirement or memory cost?

BT12-110.answer: A: No, activating an effect from the trash is different from using an option card, so they would not trigger.
BT12-110.question: Q: When I use this card's [Trash] effect, do "When you use an option card" effects trigger?

BT12-112.answer:
A: It means that, as long as the cards with a [Xros Heart]/[Blue Flare] trait have different card numbers, there is no upper limit to the cards you can use for a DigiXros.
[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: This card's DigiXros requirements say "∞ Digimon cards with a [Xros Heart]/[Blue Flare] trait & different card numbers," what does that mean?

BT12-112.answer:
A: No. If there are 0 cards, it is not considered a DigiXros.
[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: The number of cards in the DigiXros condition for this card is "∞ cards", but is it considered DigiXrosed if there are 0 cards?

BT12-112.answer:
A: No, you cannot. With this effect, you can place only your [Shoutmon] in the battle area as the evolution source.
[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: When I would play this card, is it possible to place a [Shoutmon] card in the hand, breeding area, or trash as a digivolution card?

BT12-112.answer:
A: The digivolution cards are sent to the trash.
[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: When a [Shoutmon] card is placed in this card's digivolution cards by the effect of "When this Digimon would be played", what happens to the card in the digivolution cards of the [Shoutmon]?

BT12-112.answer:
A: The [BT9-109 X Antibody] is also discarded because it is not discarded by an effect.
[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: When [Shoutmon] is placed in this Digimon's evolution source with the effect of this card, that Digimon also has [BT9-109 X Antibody] in its digivolution cards, what happens to the X Antibody card?

BT12-112.answer:
A: No, you cannot. [DigiXros] can be performed after all "when... would play" effects have finished activating. Therefore, you would [DigiXros] after using this card's effect to place [Shoutmon] in its digivolution cards.
[1]
BT12-112.question: Q: When you place a [Shoutmon] card as a digivolution card this card's effect, can you place another card as a digivolution card first?

Q: When a [Shoutmon] card is placed in this card's digivolution cards by its effect, the digivolution cards of [Shoutmon] are in the trash. Is it possible to place the digivolution cards of [Shoutmon] as digivolution cards under this card with [DigiXros]?

Q: When an [Shoutmon] is placed in this card's digivolution cards with the "When this card would be played" effect, is it possible to place a card with the same card number as that [Shoutmon] for [DigiXros]?

BT12-112.answer:
A: If a card has [Xros Heart]/[Blue Flare] trait and a different card number it means you can DigiXros without any upper limit.
[2]
BT12-112.question: Q: What does this card's [DigiXros] condition of "∞ Digimon cards that have [Xros Heart]/[Blue Flare] trait mean?

BT12-112.answer:
A: No, 0 cards are not counted as performing [DigiXros].
[2]
BT12-112.question: Q: The number of this card's [DigiXros] is ∞, but is it considered DigiXros if it's 0?

BT13-004.question: Q: If the opponent has no suspended Digimon, and a Digimon attacks with this card as a digivolution card, and the opponent's Digimon suspends and blocks with ＜Blocker＞. Does this card's inherited effect take effect at the time of the battle with the opponent's blocking Digimon?

BT13-006.answer:
A: Yes, you can. You cannot delete your opponent's Digimon, but you can trash a card from your hand.
[1]
BT13-006.question: Q: Can you trash a card from your hand for this card's inherited [On Deletion] even if there are no level 3 Digimon?

BT13-007.answer:
A: Yes, you will not be able to digivolve including them.
[1]
BT13-007.question: Q: Does this card's "Your Digimon can't digivolve." also prevent effects that digivolve from Tamers and DNA Digivolving?

BT13-007.answer:
A: Once per turn, the play cost is reduced by 4, and then the play cost is reduced by -1 for each of this Digimon's digivolution card. For example, if this Digimon has 1 digivolution card and a Digimon card with the [Royal Knight] trait is played, the play cost will be reduced by 5.
[1]
BT13-007.question: Q: When a Digimon card with the [Royal Knight] trait is played, what does "and reduce the play cost by 1 for each of this Digimon's digivolution cards." mean?

Q: When this card's [Start of Your Main Phase], must you place the card that is revealed from the top of your Digi-Egg Deck and all of your Digimon with the [Royal Knight] trait as a digivolution card for this Digimon?

BT13-007.answer:
A: The player who activated this effect will choose the order. In addition, the order of digivolutiuon cards already underneath it will not be changed, and the cards placed by this effect will be placed as digivolution cards underneath the existing digivolution cards.
[1]
BT13-007.question: Q: If you place multiple cards on the digivolution cards at the same time for this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect, what order are they placed underneath?

BT13-007.answer:
A: Yes, it's an inherited effect of [Breeding], so it works in the Breeding Area. Also, if you move the Digimon to the battle area, the effect of [Breeding] will not be activated.
[1]
BT13-007.question: Q: Will this card's inherited effect activate while the Digimon that has this card as its digivolution card is in the breeding area?

BT13-007.answer:
A: No, you will not be able to reduce the play cost. Since the effect of [BT8-071 Psychemon] is not an effect that targets Digimon, it cannot be blocked even if this card is in the breeding area.
[1]
BT13-007.question: Q: When the opponent has [BT8-071 Psychemon], does this card's [Your Turn] effect still reduce the play cost of Digimon with the [Royal Knight] trait?

BT13-007.answer:
A: No, using and activating [BT10-110 Seiken Meppa]'s [Main] effect does not cause a card to be "placed" in the Battle Area, so this card's inherited effect does not trigger.
[2]
BT13-007.question: Q: Does using [BT10-110 Seiken Meppa] trigger this card's inherited effect to gain memory?

BT13-008.answer:
A: [Marcus Damon] will become a Digimon with 3000 DP, but it will still have ＜Rush＞.
[1]
BT13-008.question: Q: If I activate this card's effect and choose my [Marcus Damon] that is already treated as a Digimon with 12000 DP and ＜Rush＞ by the effect of [BT13-020 ShineGreymon: Burst Mode], what will happen?

BT13-008.answer:
A: Yes, it will be deleted.
[1]
BT13-008.question: Q: If [Marcus Damon] that is treated as a Digimon by this card's effect, is reduced to 0 DP will it be deleted?

BT13-009.answer:
A: Since both effects trigger at the same time, the player can choose which effect activates first.
[1]
BT13-009.question: Q: When one of my Digimon with [Sistermon] in its name is played, does the [On Play] effect or this card's [Your Turn] effect activates first?

BT13-010.question: Q: For card's [On Play] effect, can I return my own [Kristy Damon] to my hand even if I don't have a [Garudamon] in my hand?

BT13-012.answer:
A: Only you will check the cards in your security without revealing it to the opponent. If there is a card that can be played by this effect you can play it.
[1]
BT13-012.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving], what does "search your security" mean?

BT13-012.answer:
A: Shuffle the security without performing ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞.
[1]
BT13-012.question: Q: What happens if there is no red or yellow Tamer in my security?

BT13-013.answer:
A: No, you cannot because your Digimon with [Sistermon] in its name was played before this card became a digivolution card.
[1]
BT13-013.question: Q: After using this card's [Your Turn] effect to digivolve into [SaviorHuckmon], can I gain 1 memory from this card's inherited effect?

BT13-013.answer:
A: Since both effects trigger at the same time, the player can choose which effect activates first.
[1]
BT13-013.question: Q: When one of my Digimon with [Sistermon] in its name is played, does the [On Play] effect or this card's [Your Turn] effect activates first?

BT13-015.question: Q: For this card's [All Turns] effect, when your red or yellow [Marcus Damon] is deleted, can the deleted card be placed from the trash at the top of my security?

BT13-016.answer:
A: Since both effects trigger at the same time, the player can choose which effect activates first.
[1]
BT13-016.question: Q: When one of my Digimon with [Sistermon] in its name is played, does the [On Play] effect or this card's [Your Turn] effect activates first?

BT13-018.answer:
A: Yes, it will be deleted.
[1]
BT13-018.question: Q: If [Marcus Damon] that is treated as a Digimon by this card's effect, is reduced to 0 DP will it be deleted?

BT13-019.question: Q: For this card's "[On Play] [When Digivolving]" effect, can it play [Omnimon (X Antibody)]/[Gankoomon (X Antibody)] from the digivolution cards of a Digimon in the Breeding Area?

BT13-020.question: Q: If [Marcus Damon] is treated as a Digimon by this card's effect and then its DP is reduced to 0 by an effect, is it deleted?

BT13-020.answer:
A: No, you can't. You can only return your own Tamer to the hand for Burst Digivolve.
[1]
BT13-020.question: Q: Can I return an opponent's Tamer to its owner's hand for this card's Burst Digivolve?

BT13-020.answer:
A: No, the [Marcus Damon] played by this card's [When Digivolving] effect is only treated as a Digimon after it has entered the Battle Area, so Crimson Blaze wouldn't prevent it.
[2]
BT13-020.question: Q: Would [BT8-097 Crimson Blaze]'s "can't play Digimon by effects" effect prevent playing a [Marcus Damon] when activating this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

BT13-020.answer:
A: No, the [Marcus Damon] played by this card's [When Digivolving] effect is only treated as a Digimon after it has entered the Battle Area, so [BT13-102 Keenan Crier]'s effect is not triggered.
[2]
BT13-020.question: Q: Would [BT13-102 Keenan Crier]'s "When a Digimon is played by an effect" effect trigger when activating this card's [When Digivolving] effect to play a [Marcus Damon]?

BT13-029.answer:
A: In addition to ＜Blocker＞, effects such as "change the target of the attack to this Digimon" will prevent you from changing the target of your attack.
[1]
BT13-029.question: Q: How does this card's "this Digimon's attack target can't be switched" effect differ from the "This Digimon cannot be blocked" effect?

BT13-030.answer:
A: No, you can't. This effect only targets 1 of your opponent's Digimon.
[1]
BT13-030.question: Q: For this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect, if you have a total of 2 Digimon with [Royal Knight] trait and a blue Tamer. Can I trash the digivolution cards of different Digimon?
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect still work when this card itself is played?

BT13-030.answer:
A: Since these effects are triggered at the same time, you can choose which effect is activated first.
[1]
BT13-030.question: Q: When this card is played, in what order does this card's "[On Play] [When Digivolving]" effect and [Your Turn] effect activate?

BT13-033.answer:
A: No, you can't. You can only return your own Tamer to the hand for Burst Digivolve.
[1]
BT13-033.question: Q: Can I return an opponent's Tamer to its owner's hand for this card's Burst Digivolve?

BT13-033.answer:
A: The player that activated this card's effect. The player chooses the cards in their opponent's hand until there are only 8 left and the order they are returned to the deck before returning them to the bottom of the deck.
[1]
BT13-033.question: Q: Which player chooses the cards in my opponent's hand to return to the deck with this card's [When Attacking] effect?

BT13-033.answer:
A: Without revealing any cards, the owner of this card chooses cards to remove from their opponent's hand. Then, without revealing any cards, the owner of this card chooses how to order the removed cards and they are placed at the bottom of the deck. Throughout the resolution of this effect, the owner of [BT13-033 MirageGaogamon: Burst Mode] is never allowed to look at any of the removed cards, but the owner of the removed cards is allowed to look at the removed cards at any point before they are returned to the bottom of the deck.
[2]
BT13-033.question: Q: When I activate this card's [When Attacking] effect, what happens to the cards removed from my opponent's hand? Are they revealed to me before going back into the deck? To my opponent? Who decides what order they go into the deck?

BT13-034.answer:
A: It refers to the total number of security cards for both you and your opponent. For example, if you have 3 security cards and your opponent has 2 security cards, each player's security total is 5 cards.
[1]
BT13-034.question: Q: What dooes "total cards in both players' security stacks" for this card's inherited effect?

BT13-036.answer:
A: It refers to the total number of security cards for both you and your opponent. For example, if you have 3 security cards and your opponent has 2 security cards, each player's security total is 5 cards.
[1]
BT13-036.question: Q: What dooes "total cards in both players' security stacks" for this card's inherited effect?

BT13-037.answer:
