A: It refers to the total number of security cards for both you and your opponent. For example, if you have 3 security cards and your opponent has 2 security cards, each player's security total is 5 cards.
[1]
BT13-037.question: Q: What dooes "total cards in both players' security stacks" for this card's inherited effect?

BT13-038.answer:
A: It refers to the total number of security cards for both you and your opponent. For example, if you have 3 security cards and your opponent has 2 security cards, each player's security total is 5 cards.
[1]
BT13-038.question: Q: What dooes "total cards in both players' security stacks" for this card's inherited effect?

BT13-040.answer:
A: No, "When this Digimon would leave the battle area" does not trigger for DNA Digivolution.
[1]
BT13-040.question: Q: If I attempt to DNA digivolve this Digimon and another Digimon, can I activate this card's [All Turns] effect to prevent the digivolution?

BT13-046.answer:
A: It refers to the total number of security cards for both you and your opponent. For example, if you have 3 security cards and your opponent has 2 security cards, each player's security total is 5 cards.
[1]
BT13-046.question:
Q: What does "total cards in both players' security stacks" for this card's inherited effect
mean?

BT13-046.answer:
A: No, you have to reveal a card from your hand. If each player's security total is 6 or less, use the subsequent effects as much as possible.
[1]
BT13-046.question: Q: If there are no yellow cards in your hand or if you don't want to increase security, is it possible for this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to not reveal a card from hand?

BT13-046.answer:
A: Because it is a card containing yellow, it is placed above security. You cannot return it to your hand. 
[1]
BT13-046.question: Q: If I reveal a two-color yellow card from my hand with this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect, will that card either be placed in security or returned to your hand. Will it be?

BT13-052.question: Q: When there is only one Digimon with ＜Blocker＞ in my opponent's Battle Area, the Digimon with this card's inherited effect attacks, and the opponent's Digimon blocks. If the opponent's Digimon becomes suspended as a result, will this card's inherited effect give it +1000 DP during the battle?

BT13-053.question: Q: For this card's [On Play] effect, can I choose to suspend a Digimon and then choose a different Digimon to be unable to unsuspend until the end of the opponent's turn?

BT13-053.answer:
A: Yes, you can. However, it will not be suspended by this effect, but can still be unable to unsuspend until the end of the opponent's turn.
[1]
BT13-053.question: Q: Can the [On Play] effect of this card, "until the end of your opponent's turn, 1 of your opponent's Digimon doesn't unsuspend" target an opponent's Digimon that is unsuspended?
Q: When using this card's [On Play] effect to select a Digimon that will be unable to unsuspend until the end of the opponent's turn, can I target it even if it is not a Digimon with 7000 DP or less?

BT13-055.answer:
A: Both effects trigger at the same time, and you can activate them in either order. However, ＜Piercing＞ does not perform the security checks until all other effects have resolved. So the top card of security will always be trashed first.
[1]
BT13-055.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect trash the top card of security first, or does ＜Piercing＞ perform a security check if the Digimon deletes an opponent's Digimon in battle and survives?

BT13-056.answer:
A: No, you can't. Since this effect is a [Once Per Turn] effect, it cannot be activated at a different timing on the turn that was already activated (e.g. [When Digivolving].
[1]
BT13-056.question: Q: Can this card's [When Digivolving] [Main] effect activate during the main phase of the same turn as when it digivolved into this card?
Q: When this card's [When Digivolving] [Main] effect play [Royal Knight] trait, does [BT13-007 Yggdrasil_7D6] and this card's reduce the play cost in total?

BT13-056.answer:
A: Yes, it will. In addition, this effect targets "all of your Digimon with [Royal Knight] trait and all of your green Digimon", so even Digimon played before this effect is activated they will gain ＜Blocker＞.
[1]
BT13-056.question: Q: For this card's [All Turns] effect, when a Digimon with [Royal Knight] trait or green Digimon is played. Does it gain ＜Blocker＞?

BT13-057.question: Q: Can this card's [When Digivolving] effect suspend an opponent's Digmon or Tamer even if this Digimon is unsuspended?

BT13-058.question: Q: Is this card's [End of Your Turn] effect mandatory?

BT13-060.answer:
A: No, even if your opponent's there is only 1 suspended Digimon and 1 suspended Tamer, they can be counted as 2.
[1]
BT13-060.question: Q: For this card's [When Attacking] effect "For each 2 of your opponent's suspended Digimon or Tamers". Does that mean for every "2 of your opponent's suspended Digimon" or "2 of your opponent's suspended Tamers". If not, how does it work?

BT13-060.answer:
A: No, it cannot. It can only return your cards to the hand with "Burst Digivolve".
[1]
BT13-060.question: Q: Can this card's Burst Digivolution return the opponent's Tamer to hand?

BT13-064.answer:
A: Yes, this card does include itself in the trash.
[1]
BT13-064.question: Q: Does this card's [On Deletion] effect include this card among the cards with [Chessmon] in its name in the trash?

BT13-065.question: Q: Can this card's inherited effect delete an opponent's [Sukamon] without deleting itself?

BT13-065.answer:
A: Each Digimon activates its inherited effect once, and only the Digimon that activates it later remains in the Battle Area. An interrupting "when you would" effect will trigger and activate only once during a series of effects derived from one effect activation, even if it is not a [Once Per Turn] effect. After the original effect has been activated, it can be triggered and activated again.
[1]
BT13-065.question: Q: You and your opponent have 1 Digimon with [Sukamon] in its name that has this card as a digivolution card. When that Digimon is deleted, what will happen if both of us use the inherited effect of this card?

BT13-065.answer:
A: Your level 6 Digimon is selected as the target of "By deleting 1 of your Digimon". Then, if this card's inherited effect attempts to delete the [EX1-073 Machinedramon].However, if [EX1-073 Machinedramon] activates its effect in response, it will not be deleted by the effect of.Because it no longer gets deleted, this card's inherited effect cannot prevent the deletion, the level 6 Digimon gets deleted by the effect of [BT8-107 Pandemonium Flame].<br. />As such, because your Digimon was deleted, it can delete an opponent's unsuspended Digimon whose level is less than or equal to the deleted Digimon.
[1]
BT13-065.question: Q: If I have a level 6 Digimon that has this card as a digivolution card, and my opponent has [EX1-073 Machinedramon] whose name is treated as [Sukamon]. What happens if I use [BT8-107 Pandemonium Flame] to delete both Digimon?

BT13-069.question: Q: Can this card's inherited effect delete an opponent's [Sukamon] without deleting itself?

BT13-069.answer:
A: Each Digimon activates its inherited effect once, and only the Digimon that activates it later remains in the Battle Area. An interrupting "when you would" effect will trigger and activate only once during a series of effects derived from one effect activation, even if it is not a [Once Per Turn] effect. After the original effect has been activated, it can be triggered and activated again.
[1]
BT13-069.question: Q: You and your opponent have 1 Digimon with [Sukamon] in its name that has this card as a digivolution card. When that Digimon is deleted, what will happen if both of us use the inherited effect of this card?

BT13-069.answer:
A: Your level 6 Digimon is selected as the target of "By deleting 1 of your Digimon". Then, if this card's inherited effect attempts to delete the [EX1-073 Machinedramon].However, if [EX1-073 Machinedramon] activates its effect in response, it will not be deleted by the effect of.Because it no longer gets deleted, this card's inherited effect cannot prevent the deletion, the level 6 Digimon gets deleted by the effect of [BT8-107 Pandemonium Flame].<br. />As such, because your Digimon was deleted, it can delete an opponent's unsuspended Digimon whose level is less than or equal to the deleted Digimon.
[1]
BT13-069.question: Q: If I have a level 6 Digimon that has this card as a digivolution card, and my opponent has [EX1-073 Machinedramon] whose name is treated as [Sukamon]. What happens if I use [BT8-107 Pandemonium Flame] to delete both Digimon?

BT13-073.answer:
A: No, you cannot. This card's [All Turns] effect is triggered when your Digimon with [Chessmon] in its name is deleted, so if its deletion was prevented, it will not triggered.
[1]
BT13-073.question: Q: When this suspended Digimon would be deleted, can I activate this Digimon with this card's [All Turns] effect if the deletion was prevented such as by ＜Decoy＞  (When your other nocategory Digimon would be deleted by an opponent's effect, you may delete this Digimon to prevent you may delete this Digimon to prevent 1 of those Digimon's deletion)?

BT13-075.question: Q: For this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect, if during the next turn the opponent digivolves from a Digimon with a play cost of 9 or less into a Digimon with an appearance cost of 10 or more. Can that Digimon attack?

BT13-075.answer:
A: Since the attack has already been declared, the attack continues.
[1]
BT13-075.question: Q: While this opponent's card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect is active, if the opponent declares an attack with a Digimon with a play cost of 9 or less, and then uses a [When Attacking] to become a Digimon with a play cost of 10 or higher. What happens to the attack in this case?

BT13-076.question: Q: For this card's [All Turns] effect trigger if an opponent's Digimon with [Etemon]/[Sukamon] in its name is deleted?

BT13-077.answer:
A: Yes, it will be blocked. ＜Blocker＞ does not affect this Digimon, so it is not affected by "cannot be affected by opponent's Digimon" effects.
[1]
BT13-077.question: Q: When this Digimon is unaffected by the opponent's Digimon's effects due to this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving], if I attack with this Digimon can it be blocked by the opponent's Digimon?

BT13-077.answer:
A: Yes, you can choose not to choose a Digimon to attack. In that case, an attack will not occur.
[1]
BT13-077.question: Q: Can this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect not choose an opponent's Digimon to attack?

BT13-077.answer:
A: You can select an opponent's Digimon that has the effect of "cannot attack" or an opponent's suspended Digimon, but in that case the target cannot attack, so no attack will occur.
[1]
BT13-077.question: Q: Can I select my opponent's Digimon with the effect of "Cannot attack" or my opponent's suspended Digimon as targets for this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect, and have them attack?

BT13-077.answer:
A: Since they are triggered at the same time, the [End of Your Turn] effect of the opponent, who is the turn player, is activated first.
[1]
BT13-077.question: Q: Will the opponent's Digimon attack with this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect, or will the opponent's [End of Your Turn] effect be activated first?

BT13-077.answer:
A: No, you can't. After the opponent's Digimon declares an attack due to the effect of this first Digimon, and after the activating effects triggered by that effect, it becomes the second Digimon's turn to activate, but at that point an attack is still ongoing, so a new attack cannot be declared, and the effect fails. 
[1]
BT13-077.question: Q: When I have 2 of this Digimon, can this card's [End of Opponent's Turn] effect make 2 of my opponent's Digimon attack?

BT13-079.question: Q: Who chooses the card to be trashed from the opponent's hand with this card's inherited effect?

BT13-079.answer:
A: Yes, it's not a battle, it was deleted by the effect of ＜Retaliation＞.
[1]
BT13-079.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when the Digimon that has this card as its digivolution is deleted by ＜Retaliation＞?

BT13-080.answer:
A: Yes, it's possible because it's not an digivolving.
[1]
BT13-080.question: Q: It says that this card cannot digivolve, but is it possible to use a card's effect to make it a digivolution card for other Digimon?
Q: Does this card's [On Deletion] effect return itself from the trash to the bottom of the deck?

Q: If there are only 2 cards with "Gizmon" in their name, including this card, in the trash, this card's [On Deletion] effect return those cards to the bottom of the deck and removes [Gizmon: AT] from the trash. Can that prevent it from being played?

BT13-082.question: Q: Who chooses the card to be trashed from the opponent's hand with this card's inherited effect?

BT13-082.answer:
A: Yes, it's not a battle, it was deleted by the effect of ＜Retaliation＞.
[1]
BT13-082.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when the Digimon that has this card as its digivolution is deleted by ＜Retaliation＞?

BT13-083.answer:
A: Yes, it's possible because it's not an digivolving.
[1]
BT13-083.question: Q: It says that this card cannot digivolve, but is it possible to use a card's effect to make it a digivolution card for other Digimon?
Q: Does this card's [On Deletion] effect return itself from the trash to the bottom of the deck?

Q: If there are only 2 cards with "Gizmon" in their name, including this card, in the trash, this card's [On Deletion] effect return those cards to the bottom of the deck and removes [Gizmon: XT] from the trash. Can that prevent it from being played?

BT13-085.answer:
A: Yes, it's not a battle, it was deleted by the effect of ＜Retaliation＞.
[1]
BT13-085.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when the Digimon that has this card as its digivolution is deleted by ＜Retaliation＞?

BT13-087.answer:
A: No, put 2 cards in your hand that meet the conditions of [Lucemon] in its name or [Royal Knight] trait. You can also add 1 [Lucemon] in its name and 1 [Royal Knight] trait. But you must add as much as you can.
[1]
BT13-087.question: Q: If this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect reveals 2 cards with [Lucemon] in its name or 2 cards with [Royal Knight] trait from among the revealed cards. Can I choose to add less cards to hand?

BT13-089.answer:
A: Since it is triggered at the same time as the opponent's [End of Your Turn] effect, it will be after the opponent's (the turn player's) [End of Your Turn] effect has activated and effects derived from those activations.
[1]
BT13-089.question: Q: At what time does [Ravemon] get played at the end of the opponent's turn?

BT13-089.answer:
A: No, you can't. At the end of your turn, [BT13-092 Ravemon: Burst Mode] is still on top, so this card's [End of Your Turn] effect did not trigger.
[1]
BT13-089.question: Q: If after Burst Digivolving from this card into [BT13-092 Ravemon: Burst Mode]. At the end of my turn, after the [BT13-092 Ravemon: Burst Mode] from Burst Digivolution is trashed can I activate this card's [End of Your Turn] effect?

BT13-092.answer:
A: No, you can't. You can search your opponent's hand with this card's [When Digivolving] effect until you trash a cards from your opponent's hand.
[1]
BT13-092.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, can I check which card was added from the top of their security to their hand?

BT13-092.answer:
A: No, they will not. Since it is "the opponent's Digimon with the same name as the returned card", if you return [Greymon] to the deck, only the opponent's Digimon with the name [Greymon] will be deleted.
[1]
BT13-092.question: Q: If this card's [When Attacking] effect returns [Greymon] from the opponent's trash to the bottom of the deck, will the opponent's [MetalGreymon]/[WarGreymon] be deleted as well?

Q: If this card's [When Attacking] effect returns a card with "This card/Digimon is also treated as ○○" from the opponent's trash to the bottom of the deck. Is it possible to delete both  Digimon with the same name as that Digimon as well as Digimon with the name "○○"?

BT13-092.answer:
A: No, it was not checked, so the [Security] effect does not activate.
[1]
BT13-092.question: Q: When the card added to the hand with this card's [When Digivolving] effect has a [Security] effect, will that effect be activated?

BT13-093.answer:
A: No, you don't have to put the cards in your hand as a digivolution card as they are private information.
[1]
BT13-093.question: Q: If you have a Digimon card with [Royal Knight] trait in your hand. Is it mandatory to place the digivolution card of your [BT13-007 Yggdrasil_7D6] in the breeding area with this card's [On Deletion] effect?

BT13-095.question: Q: For the [All Turns] effect of this card, if there are no opponent Digimon and I have [Agumon]/[Greymon]. Is it possible to gain 1 memory without reducing an opponent's Digimon's DP?

BT13-096.question: Q: If I played a blue Digimon and its DP became 0 due to an opponent's effect instantly. Will this Tamer's [All Turns] effect trigger?

BT13-096.answer:
A: It must come from your hand
[2]
BT13-096.question: Q: For the digimon card placed by this card's [All Turns] effect, does it come from my hand or from the battle area?

BT13-097.answer:
A: Yes, draw a card from your deck whenever possible.
[1]
BT13-097.question: Q: When my opponent activates the [Your Turn] effect of this Tamer, do I have to draw 1 card from my deck?

BT13-098.answer:
A: It refers to the total number of security cards for both you and your opponent. For example, if you have 3 security cards and your opponent has 2 security cards, each player's security total is 5 cards.
[1]
BT13-098.question: Q: What dooes "total cards in both players' security stacks" for this card's inherited effect?

BT13-098.answer:
A: No, it is not considered to have been trashed from security.
[1]
BT13-098.question: Q: If this card is revealed from security by the effect of [BT10-086 Omnimon (X Antibody)] and trashed, will this card's "When this card is trashed from your security stack by an effect" be activated?

BT13-099.answer:
A: It refers to the total number of security cards for both you and your opponent. For example, if you have 3 security cards and your opponent has 2 security cards, each player's security total is 5 cards.
[1]
BT13-099.question: Q: What dooes "total cards in both players' security stacks" for this card's inherited effect?

BT13-101.answer:
A: Yes, the order of the colors doesn't matter, so you can use either yellow/black or black/yellow. 
[1]
BT13-101.question: Q: Can this card's [All Turns] effect be activated even when a yellow-black Digimon is played?
Q: When I made a Black/Yellow Digimon appear, the opponent's effects reduced the DP to 0 instantly and deleted it. In that case, will this Tamer's [All Turns] effect trigger?

BT13-102.answer:
A: The player who activated the effect of this card. It will be performed if the opponent player does not trash 1 Tamer or Option card from their hand.
[1]
BT13-102.question: Q: Which player will gain 1 memory and ＜Draw 1＞ with this card's [On Play] effect?
Q: Can this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect activate whether it was my Digimon or my opponent's Digimon that was played by an effect?

BT13-102.answer:
A: No, DigiXros itself is not an effect nor did it cause the Digimon to be played, so even if it was played as an action in the main phase, it will not activate. It can be activated if the Digimon that performed DigiXros was played due to an effect.
[1]
BT13-102.question: Q: Can this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect be activated if a Digimon is played and performed DigiXros?

BT13-105.answer:
A: The player who used this card gains memory.
[1]
BT13-105.question: Q: Which player gains memory with this card's effect?

BT13-106.answer:
A: The effect of this card is activated before the security check.
[1]
BT13-106.question: Q: If the opponent's Digimon attacks the player and this card is trashed from security by the [When Attacking] effect, does the security check by the attack or this card's "When this card is discarded from security by effect" activate first?

BT13-106.answer:
A: It refers to the total number of security cards for both you and your opponent. For example, if you have 3 security cards and your opponent has 2 security cards, each player's security total is 5 cards.
[1]
BT13-106.question: Q: What dooes "total cards in both players' security stacks" for this card's inherited effect?

BT13-106.answer:
A: No, if the number of security checks becomes 0, a security check will not be performed.
[1]
BT13-106.question: Q: If the opponent's Digimon attacks the player and this card is trashed from security by the [When Attacking] effect. If this card's [Main] effect gives ＜Security Attack -1＞ to all of the opponent's Digimon, and the security attack value of the attacking Digimon becomes 0, is a security check performed?

BT13-106.answer:
A: Yes, the effect of "When this card is discarded from Security by an effect" is not a [Security] effect, so it will activate.
[1]
BT13-106.question: Q: When this card is trashed from Security by an effect while the opponent is activating the effect "The opponent's [Security] effects do not activate", does this card's [Main] effect activate?

BT13-106.answer:
A: No, it is not considered to have been trashed from security.
[1]
BT13-106.question: Q: If this card is revealed from security by the effect of [BT10-086 Omnimon (X Antibody)] and trashed, will this card's "When this card is trashed from your security stack by an effect" be activated?

BT13-107.answer:
A: No, if there is no digivolution card it cannot be returned to the hand by this card's effect, and the effect of unsuspending all of your Digimon will not be performed.
[1]
BT13-107.question: Q: Can I return my [Leopardmon: Leopard Mode] that does not have a digivolution card to my hand, and unsuspend my Digimon?

BT13-107.answer:
A: Yes, you can. However, in that case, since Lv.2 Digimon does not have DP it will be trashed by Rules Processing after the effect has finished activating.
[1]
BT13-107.question: Q: Can I return my [Leopardmon: Leopard Mode] that only has a level 2 Digi-Egg cards as a digivolution card to my hand and unsuspend all my Digimon?

BT13-108.answer:
A: Yes, you will not be affected by the [Security] effect.
[1]
BT13-108.question: Q: When my Digimon receives the effect "This Digimon isn't affected by your opponent's Option cards" due to this card, is it also unaffected by the [Security] effects of the opponent's option cards?

BT13-108.answer:
A: No, it cannot. The "When this Digimon is suspended, delete all of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost less than or equal to this Digimon" obtained from this card becomes the effect of a Digimon and is not considered an option card effect.
[1]
BT13-108.question: Q: For the effect of "When this Digimon is suspended, delete all of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost less than or equal to this Digimon". Can the effect of "This Digimon isn't affected by your opponent's Option cards" prevent it?

BT13-109.answer:
A: No, the digivolution conditions cannot be ignored, so only Digimon that meet the digivolution conditions or special digivolution conditions of the [Belphemon: Sleep Mode] in the trash can be digivolve into it.
[1]
BT13-109.question: Q: For this card's [Main] effect, can I digivolve any of my Digimon into [Belphemon: Sleep Mode] from the trash without paying the cost?

BT13-111.answer:
A: No, it means that you add up the number of cards in your trash and the opponent's trash, and every 5 cards for that total number. For example, if your trash is 12 and your opponent's trash is 8, the total cards is 20, so the play is reduced by 8.
[1]
BT13-111.question: Q: Does "Every 5 cards in each player's trash" means every 5 cards in either your trash and then every 5 cards in your opponent's trash?

BT13-111.answer:
A: No, "Destroy 1 opponent's Digimon with a DP of 6000 or less" becomes `Destroy 1 of the opponent's Digimon with a DP of 7000 or less", but "Destroy 1 of the opponent's Digimon with a DP of 13000 or more." has a minimum DP of 13000 and is not the upper limit it will remain as "1 opponent's Digimon with DP of 13000 or higher".
[1]
BT13-111.question: Q: If this card's "[On Play] [When Digivolving] [When Attacking]" effect is activated while "Add 1000 to the maximum DP you can choose with DP-based delete effects." is active. Will it increase the DP deletion of "delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with the 13000 DP or more"?

BT13-112.answer:
A: No, it refers to the Digimon being played having different names from each other but all with the [Royal Knight] trait among them. For example, if the target Digimon has the following digivolution cards [Omnimon]/[Alphamon]/[Alphamon]/[Gallantmon]/[Gallantmon (X Antibody)]. It will leave only one [Alphamon] as a digivolution card. In addition, since the [Omnimon] that activated this effect was not the digivolution card, it is possible to play it with this effect.
[1]
BT13-112.question: Q: For this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect, does it mean that Digimon cards other than the name [Omnimon] and with the [Royal Knight] trait can be played?

BT13-112.answer:
A: No, you can't. You should either play as much as possible or play none at all.
[1]
BT13-112.question: Q: When using this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect to play Digimon, can I select only specific cards from among the digivolution cards to be played?

BT13-112.answer:
A: The digivolution cards are also trashed.
[1]
BT13-112.question: Q: When a Digimon appears with this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect, it says "Trash 1 of your Digimon in the breeding area." What happens to the digivolution cards?

BT14-006.answer:
A: No, it cannot. Digimon in the Breeding Area cannot be targeted by this effect.
[1]
BT14-006.question: Q: Can this card's inherited effect digivolve Digimon in the Breeding Area into Digimon cards that have the [Dark Animal]/[SoC] trait that have been trashed from the hand?

BT14-006.answer:
A: No, this card's effect cannot ignore digivolution conditions, so you can only digivolve into cards that meet the digivolution conditions.
[1]
BT14-006.question: Q: When a Digimon card with the [Dark Animal]/[SoC] trait is trashed from the hand, can this card's inherited effect cause a digivolution into that card regardless of digivolution conditions?

BT14-006.answer:
A: No, you still have to pay the digivolution cost.
[1]
BT14-006.question: Q: Can this card's inherited effect cause a digivolution without paying the digivolution cost?

BT14-007.answer:
A: No, this card's effect cannot ignore the digivolution conditions, so you can only digivolve into cards that meet digivolution conditions.
[1]
BT14-007.question: Q: When this card's effect digivolves into [Greymon] in my hand, can it digivolve regardless of digivolution conditions?

BT14-009.question: Q: With this card's effect active, if a Digimon is played other than by an effect, can effects reduce that Digimon's play cost?

BT14-013.answer:
A: This effect lasts until the end of the turn, so during that time, the evolution cost will be reduced by 1 each time you evolve meeting the conditions.
[1]
BT14-013.question: Q: For this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect, if I evolve into a Digimon that meets the conditions and then evolve into a Digimon that meets the conditions again in the same turn, will the second evolution cost be reduced by 1?

BT14-013.answer:
A: No, it cannot. This inherited effect does not allow to attack if they're in a state that doesn't allow attacking.
[1]
BT14-013.question: Q: For this card's inherited effect, can a Digimon with this card in its digivolution sources attack even if the Digimon is suspended?

BT14-013.answer:
A: No, it cannot. After "end of turn" was reached the first time, the once per turn restriction is still in effect because the turn didn't change. And even if you evolve, the [Once Per Turn] limit will not be reset. Therefore, a second attack from this inherited effect is not possible.
[1]
BT14-013.question: Q: At the end of my turn, after attacking with this card's inherited effect, my memory became 0 or more due to some effect, and my turn continues. After that, if the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution source evolves and becomes unsuspended again at the end of my turn, can it attack again with this inherited effect?

BT14-013.answer:
A: No, they cannot. At the end of your turn, both instances of this card's inherited effects are triggered at the same time. Determine the activation order, and attack with the first Digimon with this card in its sources. After any [When Attacking] or "When one of your Digimon attacks" effects triggered by the attack declaration are activated, before the Reaction/Counter timing starts, you must activate any pending triggered effects, including this card's inherited effect on the other Digimon. But since the first Digimon is still attacking, a new attack declaration can't be made, so the second one will fail to activate.
[1]
BT14-013.question: Q: If there are 2 Digimon with this card in digivolution sources, can each of them attack with this card's [End of Your Turn] effect?

BT14-017.answer:
A: Yes, it does. If your opponent has this Digimon, "while the memory is 1 or more on the opponent's side" refers to the time when the memory is 1 or more on your side.
[1]
BT14-017.question: Q: If my opponent has this Digimon and the memory is 1 or more on my side, does this card's [All Turns] effect mean that I can't play Digimon cards with 6000 DP or less?

BT14-017.answer:
A: Yes, it cannot be played.
[1]
BT14-017.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect prevent a Digimon card with a DP of 6000 or less from being played, even if it's an effect that would play it?

BT14-017.answer:
A: Yes, they cannot be played.
[1]
BT14-017.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect prevent tokens that are treated as Digimon with a DP of 6000 or less from being played?

BT14-017.answer:
A: No, it cannot be played.
[1]
BT14-017.question: Q: With this card's [All Turns] effect, even if it was originally a Digimon card with a DP of 6000 or less, if the DP becomes greater than 6000 when it's played in the Battle Area due to some effect, can that card be played?

BT14-017.answer:
A: No, you cannot. If the memory is 1 or more on your side when you would declare the playing of the Digimon, it cannot be played.
[1]
BT14-017.question: Q: If my opponent has this Digimon and the memory is 1 or more on my side, can I play a Digimon card with DP of 6000 or less if paying the play cost would cause memory to no longer be 1 or more on my side?

BT14-017.answer:
A: No, you cannot. The declaration itself of playing such a Digimon is not allowed.
[1]
BT14-017.question: Q: If my opponent has this Digimon and the memory is 1 or more on my side, is it possible for me to pay the Play Cost of a Digimon card with DP of 6000 or less even though the Digimon won't be played?

BT14-018.answer:
A: A special card that is treated as a Digimon or a Tamer that appears due to an effect. With this card's effect, you can play tokens that are treated as Digimon with the names "Amon the Crimson Flame" and "Umon the Blue Thunder". For detailed rules regarding tokens, please check the rule manual.
[1]
BT14-018.question: Q: What is a "token"?

BT14-018.answer:
A: No, they're not. The "Amon the Crimson Flame" and "Umon the Blue Thunder" tokens played by this card's effect do not have a play cost or level, so they cannot be targeted by effects that require them.
[1]
BT14-018.question: Q: Are the "Amon the Crimson Flame" and "Umon the Blue Thunder" tokens played by this card's effect subject to effects that target "Digimon with a play cost of X or lower" or "Digimon with a level of X or higher/lower"?

BT14-018.answer:
A: Yes, that is possible. If you have either "Amon the Crimson Flame" or "Umon the Blue Thunder", delete that token and activate ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞.
[1]
BT14-018.question: Q: For this card's [All Turns] effect, when you only have either "Amon the Crimson Flame" or "Umon the Blue Thunder", can you delete that 1 token and activate ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞?

BT14-018.answer:
A: No, it only works once. No matter how many "Amon the Crimson Flame" or "Umon the Blue Thunder" are deleted simultaneously with this effect, the ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞ will only occur once.
[1]
BT14-018.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect activate ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞ twice if I delete 2 of my "Amon the Crimson Flame" or "Umon the Blue Thunder"?

BT14-018.answer:
A: "When leaving the battle area" means "placed in the trash due to deletion", "returned to the hand/deck", "placed in security", "moved to an area other than the battle area", or "placed in digivolution sources of another Digimon or underneath a Tamer".
[1]
BT14-018.question: Q: What exactly does "when leaving the battle area" on this card mean?

BT14-020.question: Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect activate "This Digimon cannot be blocked" even if the evolution source of the opponent's Digimon cannot be trashed?

BT14-020.answer:
A: No, you cannot. Since this card's inherited effect is a "When this Digimon would be deleted" effect, it's activated by interrupting the deletion. Therefore, before the [On Deletion] effect is triggered, the [Gomamon] card with the [On Deletion] effect moves out of digivolution sources, so the [On Deletion] effect doesn't trigger.
[1]
BT14-020.question: Q: This card and another [Gomamon] with an [On Deletion] inherited effect are in the evolution sources of the same Digimon. When that Digimon is deleted, can I activate this card's inherited effect to play that other [Gomamon] from evolution sources, and then activate that card's inherited [On Deletion] effect?

BT14-056.answer:
A: No, you must place all cards at the top or all cards at the bottom.
[1]
BT14-056.question: Q: When I place 4-5 cards at the top or bottom of my deck for this card's [On Play] effect, can I place some cards at the top and some at the bottom?

BT14-065.answer:
A: No, you must place all cards at the top or all cards at the bottom.
[1]
BT14-065.question: Q: When I place 3 cards at the top or bottom of my deck for this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect, can I place some cards at the top and some at the bottom?

BT14-067.answer:
A: No, you must place all cards at the top or all cards at the bottom.
[1]
BT14-067.question: Q: When I place 3 cards at the top or bottom of my deck for this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect, can I place some cards at the top and some at the bottom?

BT2-002.answer: A: No. If an effect unsuspends a card that's already unsuspended, it doesn't count as unsuspending it.
BT2-002.question: Q: I have a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards. If that Digimon is already unsuspended, does an effect that reads "unsuspend 1 of your Digimon" activate this card's inherited effect?

BT2-002.answer: A: No. This card's Japanese name (チビモン) does not have "Vee" (ブイ) in its name.
BT2-002.question: Q: Does this card have [Vee] in its name?

BT2-004.answer: A: No. If an effect unsuspends a card that's already unsuspended, it doesn't count as unsuspending it.
BT2-004.question: Q: I have a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards. If that Digimon is already unsuspended, does this card's inherited effect activate during my unsuspend phase?

BT2-006.answer: A: No. This effect doesn't refer to [Tsumemon], but to the name of the Digimon on top with this card as its digivolution cards.
BT2-006.question: Q: What counts as "another Digimon in play with the same name as this Digimon"? Does this only count if I have another Digimon in play named [Tsumemon]?

BT2-012.answer: A: Yes. The effect was activated before your opponent blocked it. (See more in Attack Resolution)
BT2-012.question: Q: I attack my opponent with this Digimon. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this Digimon's effect activate?

BT2-015.answer: A: Yes. The effect was activated before your opponent blocked it. (See more in Attack Resolution)
BT2-015.question: Q: I attack my opponent with this Digimon. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this Digimon's effect activate?

BT2-019.answer: A: Yes. The effect was activated before your opponent blocked it. (See more in Attack Resolution)
BT2-019.question: Q: I attack my opponent with this Digimon. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this Digimon's effect activate?

BT2-020.answer: A: No. They weren't flipped over in a security check, so they don't activate.
BT2-020.question: Q: I use this card's [When Attacking] effect to trash my opponent's Security Cards. Do the [Security] effects on those cards activate?

Q: My opponent has 1 or more cards in their security stack. I attack my opponent with this Digimon and its [When Attacking] effect trashes the rest of their security cards, leaving them with zero cards in their security stack. If the attack isn't blocked and my attack is successful when they have zero cards in their security stack, do I win the game?

BT2-021.answer: A: No. If an effect unsuspends a card that's already unsuspended, it doesn't count as unsuspending it.
BT2-021.question: Q: I have a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards. If that Digimon is already unsuspended, does an effect that reads "unsuspend 1 of your Digimon" activate this card's inherited effect?

BT2-023.answer: A: No, play costs can't be reduced to less than zero. You can play the card for free, but you can't gain memory with effects that reduce play costs.
BT2-023.question: Q: My opponent has 5 or more Digimon with no digivolution cards in play, meaning this card's effect reduces its cost by 5, to -1. Can I play it by gaining a memory?

BT2-028.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to unsuspend this card if it digivolves while suspended?

BT2-028.answer: A: No. If an effect unsuspends a card that's already unsuspended, it doesn't count as unsuspending it.
BT2-028.question: Q: I have a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards. If that Digimon is already unsuspended, does an effect that reads "unsuspend 1 of your Digimon" activate this card's inherited effect?

BT2-029.answer:
A: If this Digimon attacks, Digimon with ＜Blocker＞ and no digivolution cards cannot redirect the attack.
[1]
BT2-029.question: Q: How does "This Digimon can't be blocked by your opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards" work?
Q: When my opponent's Digimon with this card's inherited effect attacks, even if I cannot block, can I still declare to activate my Digimon's ＜Blocker＞ to suspend it?

BT2-030.answer:
A: If this Digimon attacks, Digimon with ＜Blocker＞ and no digivolution cards cannot redirect the attack.
[1]
BT2-030.question: Q: How does "This Digimon can't be blocked by your opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards" work?
Q: When my opponent's Digimon with this card's inherited effect attacks, even if I cannot block, can I still declare to activate my Digimon's ＜Blocker＞ to suspend it?

BT2-032.answer: A: No, you can't use this Digimon's effect to suspend your blue Tamers. The effect only allows you to unsuspend this Digimon when another effect suspends one of your blue Tamers.
BT2-032.question: Q: Can I use this Digimon's effect to suspend one of my blue Tamers?

BT2-032.answer: A: No. If an effect unsuspends a card that's already unsuspended, it doesn't count as unsuspending it.
BT2-032.question: Q: If this Digimon is unsuspended during my main phase, does an effect that reads "unsuspend 1 of your Digimon" activate this card's "gain 1 memory" effect?

BT2-034.answer: A: No. Even if both Digimon are deleted simultaneously, the effects trigger one at a time. When the first Salamon's effect resolves, you add 1 cards to your security stack, bringing the total up to 4. This means the "3 cards or less" condition for the second Salamon's effect no longer applies. The second Salamon's effect doesn't activate, and your security stack remains at 4 cards.
BT2-034.question: Q: I have 3 cards in my security stack when 2 copies of this Digimon are deleted at the same time. Do the [On Deletion] effects on both cards activate, bringing my security stack up to 5 cards?

BT2-035.answer:
A: No battle occurs. After resolving all other When Attacking effects, the attack ends.
[1]
BT2-035.question: Q: I use this Digimon to attack an opponent's Digimon, then use this Digimon's inherited effect to reduce the opponent's Digimon to 0 DP and delete it. What happens to the attack?

BT2-039.answer: A: No, you can choose not to as it has "you may".
BT2-039.question: Q: Do I have to use this card's [When Attacking] effect every time I attack with it?
Q: If I use this card's [When Attacking] effect to play a Digimon card with an [On Play] effect, does that [On Play] effect activate when the Digimon enters play?

BT2-040.answer: A: Yes, it does. During checks, it will fight your opponent's attacking Digimon as a Security Digimon.
BT2-040.question: Q: When I place this card face down on top of my security stack because of its effect, does it become a security card?

BT2-040.answer: A: The player chooses which effect to use first between [BT3-109 Back for Revenge!] and [BT2-040 Ophanimon]. If Ophanimon is used first Back for Revenge cannot be used. If Back for Revenge is used for then Ophanimon can no longer be used.
BT2-040.question: Q: I use [BT3-109 Back for Revenge!] on [BT2-040 Ophanimon] and it gets deleted with [BT2-109 Heat Viper]. What happens?

BT2-041.answer: A: Yes, the [When Digivolving] effect activates separately for each yellow Tamer you suspend, and you get to choose the target for each effect.
BT2-041.question: Q: I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to suspend 2 or more yellow Tamers. Can I choose 2 or more of my opponent's Digimon and give all of them -4000 DP?

BT2-041.answer: A: No, they're treated as activating at the same timing. Previously, multiple activations of ShineGreymon's [When Digivolving] effect were treated as occurring at separate timings, but this was changed as of December 18, 2020.
BT2-041.question: Q: I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect two or more times. Are they treated as activating at separate timings?

BT2-041.answer: A: You resolve all of ShineGreymon's effects first and activate any new pending effects after these effects have resolved. In this case, [BT2-083 Millenniummon] will only be deleted after all 8 of ShineGreymon's effects have finished resolving.
BT2-041.question: Q: This card suspends 8 Tamers. During the first 4 instances, this effect kills [BT2-083 Millenniummon]. Would I be able to use the remaining 4 effects to destroy the revived [BT2-083 Millenniummon]? Or would [BT2-083 Millenniummon] revive after ShineGreymon's effects finish resolving?

BT2-041.answer: A: Yes, even though the Digimon has less than 4000 DP, you can continue to give it -4000 DP even though its DP is already 0. All Digimon that have 0 DP or less at the end of a ShineGreymon's effect will be moved to the trash at the same time.
BT2-041.question: Q: I have 2 Yellow Tamers and my opponent has 2 [ST1-03 Agumon]. Can I use both -4000 DP effects on the same Digimon?

BT2-041.answer: A: Use the effects consecutively one after the time to reduce DP. There is no period for effects to trigger between multiple effects having been activated.
BT2-041.question: Q: What does "activate the following effect" mean?

BT2-044.answer: A: Yes. If either a level 5 Digimon card or a green Tamer card are present in the 3 cards you reveal, you get to add it to your hand.
BT2-044.question: Q: If the 3 cards I reveal with this card's effect don't contain both a level 5 Digimon card and a green Tamer card, do I still get to add a card to my hand?

BT2-047.question: Q: If I use this card's inherited effect to play a Digimon card with an [On Play] effect, does that [On Play] effect activate when the Digimon enters play?

BT2-049.answer: A: No. The Digimon suspended by this effect -- along with all of your opponent's other suspended Digimon -- remain suspended during their unsuspend phase.
BT2-049.question: Q: I use this card's [On Play] effect to suspend an opponent's Digimon. Is that Digimon the only one that doesn't unsuspend during my opponent's next unsuspend phase?

BT2-049.answer: A: No. It only prevents suspended Digimon from unsuspending. Any unsuspended Digimon remain that way.
BT2-049.question: Q: Does this card's [On Play] effect cause my opponent's unsuspended Digimon to suspend themselves during their next unsuspend phase?

BT2-049.answer: A: No, the effect doesn't affect Tamers. They unsuspend as normal.
BT2-049.question: Q: Does this card's [On Play] effect prevent my opponent's suspended Tamers from unsuspending during their next unsuspend phase?

BT2-051.answer: A: No, it remains unsuspended during the battle
BT2-051.question: Q: I use this card's effect to attack an opponent's unsuspended Digimon. Does the opponent's Digimon suspend itself?

BT2-051.answer: A: Yes, this is because the effect of [BT2-051 RustTyrannomon] is activated before ＜Retaliation＞ because the RustTyrannomon's owner is the turn player.
BT2-051.question: Q: This Digimon attacks and deletes a Digimon with ＜Retaliation＞. Can this Digimon use its effect to suspend another Digimon?

BT2-053.answer: A: No. This effect doesn't refer to [Keramon], but to the name of the Digimon on top with this card as its digivolution cards.
BT2-053.question: Q: What counts as "another Digimon with the same name as this Digimon"? Does this only count if I have another Digimon in play named [Keramon]?

BT2-059.answer: A: No. This effect doesn't refer to [Kurisarimon], but to the name of the Digimon on top with this card as its digivolution cards.
BT2-059.question: Q: What counts as "another Digimon with the same name as this Digimon"? Does this only count if I have another Digimon in play named [Kurisarimon]?

BT2-062.answer: A: No, it doesn't activate from breeding areas.
BT2-062.question: Q: This Digimon is in my breeding area when I digivolve it into a [Diaboromon] from my hand. Does this card's effect activate?

BT2-073.answer: A: No. This inherited effect only allows you to gain 1 memory per turn, no matter how many Digimon are deleted.
BT2-073.question: Q: If 2 or more of my other Digimon are deleted at the same time, can I gain 2 memory?

BT2-077.answer: A: No, you may choose not to use it.
BT2-077.question: Q: Do I have to use this card's effect?
Q: Can I use this card's effect to delete a Digimon in my breeding area?

BT2-078.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to delete a Digimon in my breeding area?

BT2-079.answer: A: Since the effect of [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon] and [When Attacking] would be resolved at the same time, the opponent's effect will be resolved first, and then VenomMyotismon's effect will be resolved.
BT2-079.question: Q: [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon]'s effect is "[Opponent's Turn] When the opponent's Digimon suspends". The opponent's Digimon is rested to attack. Which comes first [When Attacking] or the [Opponent's Turn] effect of VenomMyotismon to increase memory by 1? Is it the same timing as [When Attacking]?

BT2-079.answer: A: No, it is triggered as soon as the opponent declares an attack suspending the Digimon. (See more in Attack Resolution)
BT2-079.question: Q: Is [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon]'s [Opponent's Turn] effect considered a [Reaction] effect?

BT2-079.answer: A: No, you cannot. The effect of this card was not triggered when the attack was declared (which caused the Digimon to suspend), so it cannot be activated. (See more in Effect Resolution)
BT2-079.question: Q: My opponent attacks and activates an effect that ＜De-Digivolve＞ on my Level 7 Digimon that becomes a [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon]. Can I use VenomMyotismon's effect?

BT2-079.answer: A: No, you cannot. Even though the effect of [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon] was triggered, the Digimon has lost the [Opponent's Turn] effect of VenomMyotismon so it cannot be activated. (See more in Effect Resolution)
BT2-079.question: Q: My opponent attacks and activates an effect that ＜De-Digivolve＞ on my [BT2-079 VenomMyotismon]. Can I use VenomMyotismon's effect?

BT2-082.answer: A: Tokens are special cards that some effects put into play to represent Digimon or Tamers. This card's effect, for example, plays a token that's treated as a Digimon named [Diaboromon]. For a more detailed explanation of how tokens work, check the official rule manual.
BT2-082.question: Q: What's a token?
Q: Can I activate this card's [All Turns] effect by deleting a [Diaboromon] token when this Digimon is about to be deleted?

BT2-082.answer: A: No. this card's [All Turns] effect only takes effect when this Digimon is about to be deleted. You can't use it when a [Diaboromon] token is deleted.
BT2-082.question: Q: Can I activate this card's [All Turns] effect when one of my [Diaboromon] tokens is about to be deleted?

BT2-082.answer: A: Yes. The token is considered a Digimon with the specified name, and is deleted.
BT2-082.question: Q: I have this Digimon and a [Diaboromon] token in play in my battle area when my opponent uses [BT1-084 Omnimon]'s [When Digivolving] effect to choose [Diaboromon]. Are this Digimon and my [Diaboromon] token both deleted due to having the same name?
Q: Can I activate this card's [All Turns] effect when this Digimon is about to be deleted in a battle with an opponent's Security Digimon?

BT2-083.answer: A: No, this card's [On Deletion] effect only returns this card to play. Any cards that were in its digivolution cards go to the trash.
BT2-083.question: Q: When playing this card from my trash using its [On Deletion] effect, do the cards it had as digivolution cards return to my Battle Area as well?

BT2-084.answer:
A: This Tamer's effect is triggered once you declare your attack against another player, and is activated before your opponent uses ＜Blocker＞. The +2000 DP bonus remains for the turn even if the target of attack changes.
[1]
BT2-084.question: Q: I attack my opponent with a Digimon, and suspend this Tamer. If my opponent uses ＜Blocker＞ to block the attack, what happens to the +2000 DP bonus from this Tamer's effect?

BT2-085.answer: A: No, you can't. "Trash all of the digivolution cards of those Digimon" is an explanation of what happens to the digivolution cards of the Digimon when it returns to their hand. It doesn't count as trashing digivolution for the purposes of this card's effect.
BT2-085.question: Q: You use an effect that reads "Return 1 of your opponent's Digimon to their hand. Trash all of the digivolution cards of that Digimon" to return an opponent's Digimon to their hand. When your opponent's digivolution cards are trashed as a result, can you activate this card's effect?

BT2-085.answer: A: No, you cannot activate the effect of [BT2-085 Joe Kido].
BT2-085.question: Q: I use ＜De-Digivolve＞ while I have this Tamer in play. Can I use the effect of [BT2-085 Joe Kido]?
Q: My opponent trashes a digivolution card with one of their effects like [BT5-111 Omnimon X] or ＜Digi-Burst＞. Can I use this card's effect?

BT2-088.answer: A: No, digivolving Digimon in your breeding area doesn't activate the effect that reduces digivolution cost by 1.
BT2-088.question: Q: I digivolve a Digimon in my breeding area into a Digimon card with [Tyrannomon] in its name. Can I use this Tamer's effect to reduce the digivolution cost by 1?

BT2-088.answer: A: Yes, each copy of this Tamer may be be suspended to reduce the digivolution cost by 1 each. However, you cannot reduce the cost to less than 0.  (From Card Rulings:ST1-12/Card Rulings:ST2-12/Card Rulings:ST3-12, and Card Rulings:BT1-109)
BT2-088.question: Q: If I have two [BT2-088 Taiga]. Can I use its second effect to reduce the digivolution cost of a Digimon by 2 if I rest both Tamers?

BT2-094.answer: A: Yes, as trashing 1 of your opponent's digivolution cards is not a requirement, you get +2000 DP when using this card even when your opponent has no digivoltion cards. From Card Rulings:BT1-090
BT2-094.question: Q: Can I use this card when my opponent has no digivolution cards to still get the +2000 DP?

BT2-096.answer: A: The digivolution cards get trashed at the same time the Digimon is returned to the hand. So it gets returned to hand before unsuspending a Digimon.
BT2-096.question: Q: When do the digivolution cards get trashed in the effect of [BT2-096 The Ray of Victory]? Does it get trashed before or after unsuspending a Digimon?

BT2-098.answer: A: No, this card's effect can only be activated against 1 of your opponent's Digimon. You can't use a single copy of this card to reduce the DP of multiple Digimon.
BT2-098.question: Q: If I have 2 or more cards in hand when I use this effect, can I give 2 or more different Digimon -1000 DP?

BT2-099.answer: A: Yes, you can. Hoewver, it cannot be taken from your trash by BeeleStarmon's [On Play] effect even if you have 2 Tamers.
BT2-099.question: Q: If this card is in my hand, and I have exactly 2 Yellow Tamers. Can I play this card with [BT6-112 BeelStarmon]'s [On Play] effect?

BT2-099.answer: A: No, in that case, since the usage cost of [BT2-099 Glorious Burst] has been changed to 1, it is not considered that an option card with a usage cost of 2 or more was used, so it will not be demonstrated.
BT2-099.question: Q: If I use this card while I have 8 or more of my own yellow tamers and a [EX2-003 Viximon] in my Digimon's digivolution cards, will that card's inherited effect be triggered?

BT2-109.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to delete a Digimon in my breeding area?

BT2-109.answer: A: Yes, you can play this card without using its effect.
BT2-109.question: Q: Can I play this Option and not use its effect because it has "you may"?

BT2-109.answer: A: No, the effect of [BT3-092 MaloMyotismon] was not triggered because it was deleted first.
BT2-109.question: Q: If I delete [BT3-092 MaloMyotismon] with [BT2-109 Heat Viper]. Can I use that MaloMyotismon's effect to gain 2 memory?

BT2-111.answer:
A: No, you can't use this card's effect to digivolve from an [Impmon] in your breeding area.
[1]
BT2-111.question: Q: I have 10 or more cards in my trash. Can I digivolve an [Impmon] in my breeding area into this card?
Q: If I use an effect to digivolve my Digimon in the Battle Area, can I use it to digivolve my [Impmon] into this card?

BT2-112.answer: A: It refers strictly to your opponent's Digimon with the highest DP they control. The effect doesn't check the DP of your Digimon.
BT2-112.question: Q: This card's [When Attacking] effect refers to "your opponent's Digimon with the highest DP." Does this strictly refer to my opponent's Digimon with the highest DP, or does it refer to when I attack an opponent's Digimon with the highest DP out of all Digimon in play, including my own?

BT2-112.answer: A: Yes. If your opponent has multiple Digimon tied for highest DP, attacking any of them allows you to unsuspend this Digimon.
BT2-112.question: Q: My opponent has multiple Digimon tied for highest DP. If I attack any one of them, does this card's [When Attacking] effect let me unsuspend this Digimon?

BT2-112.answer: A: No, this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect only lets you unsuspend this Digimon when attacking your opponent's Digimon with the highest DP, regardless of whether it's suspended or not.
BT2-112.question: Q: My opponent's Digimon with the highest DP is unsuspended. If I attack their suspended Digimon with the highest DP, can I unsuspend this Digimon?

BT2-112.answer: A: The Digimon was already unsuspended before the opponent could use ＜Blocker＞. (See more in Attack Resolution)
BT2-112.question: Q: If this card's [When Attacking] effect attacks the Digimon with the highest DP, but my opponent uses ＜Blocker＞, does this Digimon still unsuspend?

BT2-112.answer: A: No. Unless the target of the attack is the opponent's Digimon with the highest DP at the time the attack is declared, this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect does not trigger at all, so it won't be pending activation. This card's condition is treated as "when you attack your opponent's Digimon with the highest DP".
BT2-112.question: Q: I attack my opponent's Digimon that does not have the highest DP. While this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect is pending activation, another effect causes the target of the attack to become the opponent's Digimon with the highest DP. Does the [When Attacking] effect activate?

BT2-112.answer: A: Yes, its play cost has been reduced so you can play this card.
BT2-112.question: Q: I am at 0 memory but my opponent has a Digimon with 10,000 DP or more, can I play this card?

BT3-002.answer: A: No. This card's Japanese name (チビモン) does not have "Vee" (ブイ) in its name.
BT3-002.question: Q: Does this card have [Vee] in its name?

BT3-004.answer: A: No. The effect activates as soon as you target a Digimon and declare an attack
BT3-004.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate in battles against Security Digimon?

BT3-004.answer: A: If you attacked an opponent's Digimon, it will activate even if the attack is blocked. However, if you attacked the opposing player, it won't activate if blocked and a battle with the opposing player's Digimon occurs.
BT3-004.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate in battles when it is blocked by ＜Blocker＞?

BT3-004.answer: A: No, this card's effect did not fulfill its trigger condition. See more in Effect Resolution
BT3-004.question: Q: If this card attacks a player and then one of my effects redirects it to an opponent's Digimon. Does this card's effect activate?

BT3-008.answer: A: Yes, if you only reveal one or the other, you only get to add one card to your hand.
BT3-008.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck include only either [RagnaLoardmon] or cards with [Legend-Arms] in their types, can I only add 1 card to my hand?

BT3-008.answer: A: Yes, you may add them both to your hand.
BT3-008.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck include 2 [RagnaLoardmon] cards with [Legend-Arms] in their types, can I add both of those cards to my hand?

BT3-008.answer: A: No, this effect allows you to add both cards.
BT3-008.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck include both a [RagnaLoardmon] card and a card with the [Legend-Arms] trait, do I only get to add 1 to my hand and have to return the rest to the bottom of my deck?

BT3-008.answer: A: If [RagnaLoardmon] has the [Legend-Arms] trait, you can choose to add it for the [Legend Arms] so that there are no [RagnaLoardmon] cards you can add to hand. However, otherwise you must add as much as you can.
BT3-008.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck include both a [RagnaLoardmon] card and a card with the [Legend-Arms] trait, can I choose to add 1 of them to my hand?

BT3-011.answer: A: No, it's treated as a normal Digimon once it comes into play.
BT3-011.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to play a Digimon, is it treated as a Security Digimon even in my battle area?

BT3-011.answer: A: Yes, regardless of the battle's outcome, you get to play this Digimon at the end of the battle.
BT3-011.question: Q: Can I play this Digimon with its [Security] effect even if it loses the battle against the attacking Digimon?

BT3-011.answer: A: This Digimon is played after the battle with the attacking Digimon, and before the next check is performed.
BT3-011.question: Q: This card is flipped over during a security check, but the attacking Digimon still has security checks remaining. Is this card played off its [Security] effect first, or do I have to wait until my opponent finishes the rest of their security checks?

BT3-014.answer: A: Yes, since this Digimon is treated as both red and yellow during your turn, it can digivolve into a Digimon with a digivolution requirement of "Yellow, Level 5."
BT3-014.question: Q: Can this Digimon Digivolve into a Digimon which has a Digivolution requirement of "Yellow, Level 5?"

BT3-014.answer: A: No, you can't. [Your Turn] effects are not activate in the breeding area, so the card isn't treated as a yellow card. You can't digivolve it into a Digimon that requires a yellow Digimon.
BT3-014.question: Q: This card is in my breeding area. Can I digivolve it into a Digimon that requires a yellow Digimon?

BT3-014.answer: A: The DP value printed on a card is its original DP. This card's [When Digivolving] effect causes a target Digimon's DP, regardless of what's written on the card, to be temporarily treated as having 1000 DP.
BT3-014.question: Q: What does "Original DP" mean?

BT3-014.answer: A: Your opponent's Digimon's DP will be overwritten as 1000, and if a -1000 DP effect is being applied to it, its DP becomes 0, causing the Digimon to be deleted.
BT3-014.question: Q: If this card's [When Digivolving] effect is used on an opponent's Digimon whose DP has been reduced by 1000 by an effect, what happens to that Digimon?

BT3-014.answer: A: The effect that was used last takes precedence.
BT3-014.question: Q: If I set a Digimon's original DP with this card, and then use another card to set its original DP again. What happens?

BT3-014.answer: A: Yes, the effect prevents the reduction of DP. But it does not prevent its original DP from being set to another number.
BT3-014.question: Q: Can this card be used to set the DP of a Digimon with "DP cannot be reduced"?

BT3-014.answer: A: No, the Level 2 Digimon has no DP and so its DP can't be changed and it will still be trashed.

BT3-019.answer: A: No, you can choose whether or not to activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect.

BT3-019.answer: A: No, even if the memory counter moves to 1 or greater on your opponent's side temporarily, if by resolving that effect, the memory counter moves back to 0 or greater on your side, your turn may continue.
BT3-019.question: Q: Paying this Digimon's digivolution cost resulted in the memory counter being placed at 1 or above on my opponent's side. However, the [When Digivolving] effect allowed me to gain 3 memory, putting the memory counter at 0 or above on my side. When this happens, does the turn end?

BT3-024.answer: A: No, it's treated as a normal Digimon once it comes into play.
BT3-024.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to play a Digimon, is it treated as a Security Digimon even in my battle area?

BT3-024.answer: A: Yes, regardless of the battle's outcome, you get to play this Digimon at the end of the battle.

BT3-024.answer: A: This Digimon is played after the battle with the attacking Digimon, and before the next check is performed.

So, it was already used when the attack was declared and cannot put [BT3-111 Imperialdramon: Dragon Mode] to active as the effect was already used on the 1st attack. [BT3-111 Imperialdramon: Dragon Mode]'s effect is also compulsory, so both [BT3-027 Paildramon] and [BT3-111 Imperialdrmaon: Dragon Mode]'s effects cannot be used on the second attack.

BT3-031.question: Q: When digivolving this card onto a [Paildramon]/[Dinobeemon] in my breeding area, can I reduce the digivolution cost by 2?

BT3-034.answer: A: It's placed at the top of the security stack, face down.

BT3-034.answer: A: No, you can only ＜Draw 1＞ if you add a security card to your hand.

BT3-034.answer: A: Yes, the latter half of the effect, "Look at the top card of your security stack. You may add that card to your hand to trigger-" can still be activated even if you have 0 cards in your deck and ＜Draw 1＞ cannot be resolved.
BT3-034.question: Q: When I have 0 cards left in my deck, can I still look at one of my security cards and add it to my hand?

BT3-040.answer: A: No, you can't. [Your Turn] effects don't activate from breeding areas, so the card isn't treated as a yellow card. You can't digivolve it into a Digimon that requires a blue Digimon.

BT3-040.answer: A: Yes, [BT3-040 Shakkoumon]'s effect allows it to be played as a Blue Digimon.

BT3-041.answer: A: Yes, when moving a card from your trash to your security stack, you must show the card to your opponent so they can confirm it's a yellow Digimon card.

BT3-042.answer: A: No, even if you end up with 4 or more security cards, the Digimon will have -6000 DP for the duration of the turn in which the effect was activated.

BT3-046.answer: A: No, you don't gain any memory from it.

BT3-058.answer: A: Yes, you still get BanchoStingmon's effect. ＜Blocker＞ happens after all [When Attacking] effects and BanchoStingmon's effect keeps the changes for the turn. (See more in Attack Resolution)

BT3-058.answer: A: Yes, it does. This effect behaves the same way as an effect that reads "When this Digimon attacks one of your opponent's Digimon with 12000 DP or more". As such, the requirement for 12000 DP or more is checked at the time the attack is declared and determines whether or not the effect triggers. After the effect has triggered, this requirement does not impact the effect's activation.

A: Yes, [BT3-092 MaloMyotismon] is in play when this card is deleted, so you gain 1 memory.

A: No, you do not have to delete this card. (See more in Optional and Mandatory Effects

BT3-090.answer: A: No, just because there are no security cards to trash doesn't mean you win the game.
BT3-090.question: Q: If I activate this card's [When Digivolving] effect when my opponent has an empty security stack, do I win the game?

BT3-090.answer: A: Yes, you can. If one of the players have cards in their Security stack, that player would still trash a card from that Security stack.
BT3-090.question: Q: If one or both players have empty security stacks, can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to play a level 4 or lower purple or yellow Digimon card from my trash?

BT3-090.answer: A: Yes, you can. The card's Japanese text specifes "you may" (できる). This effect is similar to other effects that allow you to choose whether or not to play a Digimon, such as those written as "you may pay <...> without paying its energy cost."
BT3-090.question: Q: When using this card's [When Digivolving] effect to trash cards from both players' security stacks, can I choose not to play a purple or yellow Digimon card with a level of 4 or less from my trash?

BT3-091.question: Q: Do I gain +2 memory from  this card's [Your Turn] effect before or after resolving the Option card's effect?

BT3-091.question: Q: I activate [BT2-109 Heat Viper] to destroy Lilithmon and my opponent's Digimon. Does Lilithmon's effect activate?

BT3-091.answer: A: No, the effect was not active when the Option card was used.
BT3-091.question: Q: If I have a Digimon in play, and use [EX2-070 Digivolution Plug-In S] to digivolve a Digimon into this card. Does this card's [Your Turn] effect trigger?

BT3-092.answer: A: Yes, both you and your opponent's Digimon were deleted, so you gain two memory.
BT3-092.question: Q: I have this Digimon in play when one of my other Digimon attacks, deletes an opponent's Digimon, and is deleted in return. Do I gain two memory?

BT3-092.answer: A: No, Security Digimon aren't considered to be Digimon, so you don't gain any memory.
BT3-092.question: Q: Do I gain 1 memory from this Digimon's effect when a Security Digimon is deleted?

BT3-092.answer: A: Yes, the +1 memory effect activates twice, earning you two memory.
BT3-092.question: Q: I have 2 of this Digimon in play when one of my other Digimon is deleted. Do I gain two memory?

BT3-092.answer: A: The effects activate simultaneously, so the turn player gains a memory first, followed by the non-turn player gaining a memory, returning the memory gauge to its original position.
BT3-092.question: Q: My opponent and I both have this Digimon in play. If another Digimon is deleted, what happens?

BT3-092.answer: A: No, Digimon need to be in the Battle Area to activate their effects.
BT3-092.question: Q: If this Digimon attacks an opponent's Digimon and both Digimon end up being deleted, can I gain a memory off this card's effect?

BT3-092.answer: A: If your opponent deletes a Digimon with [BT2-013 Growlmon] first and then ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ on the level 7 Digimon. MaloMyotismon's effect does not trigger because it did not see the effect. If your opponent uses [BT3-064 TiaLudomon] first then MaloMyotismon's effect triggers and activates. BT3-093.answer:
A: Yes, if you only reveal one or the other, you only get to add one card to your hand.
[1]

BT3-093.answer:
A: Yes, you may add them both to your hand.
[1]

BT3-093.answer:
A: Yes, you can choose to add the Blue-Green Digimon as a Blue Digimon so that there are no other Green Digimon to add.
[1]

BT3-093.answer:
A: Yes, you can choose to add the Blue-Green Digimon as a Green Digimon so that there are no other Blue Digimon to add.
[1]

BT3-094.answer: A: No, Security Digimon aren't considered to be Digimon, so this Tamer's effect doesn't activate.

BT4-048.answer: A: No, if you are unable to add your Security to hand, you cannot use this effect.
BT4-048.question: Q: When I have 0 cards in your Security Stack, can I use this card's [When Attacking] effect?

BT4-048.answer: A: No, the [Once Per Turn] restriction stops this effect from activating at all in the 2nd attack, including the part where 1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -6000 DP.
BT4-048.question: Q: When I use this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect to give 1 of my opponent's Digimon -6000 DP, then put this Digimon to Active, then attack again in the same turn, can I give my opponent's Digimon -6000 DP again?

BT4-049.answer: A: Yes, Digimon played after the effect's activation also lose DP.
BT4-049.question: Q: Does [BT4-049 Varodurumon]'s ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect also decrease the DP of Digimon that were played after the activation of its effect?

BT4-052.answer: A: After ＜Digi-Burst＞ activates. It is triggered after the whole ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect is resolved.
BT4-052.question: Q: If this card is a digivolution card and is trashed by ＜Digi-Burst＞, when does this card return to hand: before or after the additional effect activates?

BT4-054.answer: A: No you cannot, as this effect specifies to target "1 of your opponent's Suspended digimon".
BT4-054.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect on my opponent's Unsuspended digimon?

BT4-058.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect on [Orochimon] itself?

BT4-059.answer: A: Yes, as no colour is specified by the effect, it activates regardless of the colour of Tamer.
BT4-059.question: Q: Does this card’s inherited effect activate regardless of the colour of Tamer I have?

BT4-060.answer: A: Yes, as long as the Digimon is LV4 or below, it is suspended regardless of being Played by you or your opponent.
BT4-060.question: Q: Does this card's effect also suspend my digimon?

BT4-060.answer: A: No, as digivolving is not Playing, they are not suspended.
BT4-060.question: Q: Does this card's effect suspend Digimon that digivolve into a level 4 Digimon?

BT4-060.answer: A: No, as moving from Breeding Area is not Playing, it is not suspended.
BT4-060.question: Q: Does this card's effect suspend level 4 or below Digimon moved from Breeding Area to Battle Area?

BT4-062.question: Q: Does this card's effect also send digimon already suspended prior to this effect to the bottom of my opponent's Deck as well?

BT4-064.answer: A: After ＜Digi-Burst＞ activates. It is triggered after the whole ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect is resolved.
BT4-064.question: Q: If this card is a digivolution card and is trashed by ＜Digi-Burst＞, when does this card return to hand: before or after the additional effect activates?

BT4-066.question: Q: Does this card's effect apply to [Golemon] itself as well?

BT4-071.answer: A: No. The effects for both copies are triggered, but since the cards themselves have been deleted and sent to the trash, they're no longer in the battle area, which means their effects can't be activated.
BT4-071.question: Q: I have 2 copies of this Digimon in my battle area, and both are deleted at the same time by an opponent's skill. Do both copies activate their [Your Turn] skills?

BT4-072.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Main] effect on [Gogmamon] itself?

BT4-074.answer: A: Yes. The order you return cards in is public information.
BT4-074.question: Q: When I use this card's effect to return multiple cards to my deck, do I need to tell my opponent the order I return the cards in?

BT4-075.answer: A: When this Digimon attacks, regardless of what the attack target is, your opponent player can choose to change the target of that attack to 1 of their Unsuspended digimon.
BT4-075.question: Q: What does this card's [When Attacking] effect mean?
Q: When attacking with this card, am I required to announce the target of attack?

BT4-075.answer: A: It is not an effect that lets you attack your opponent's Unsuspended digimon. You only attack your opponent’s Unsuspended digimon when your opponent chooses to change the target of that attack to 1 of their Unsuspended digimon.
BT4-075.question: Q: Can I attack my opponent's Unsuspended digimon with this card's [When Attacking] effect?

BT4-075.answer: A: No, the player who is currently being attacked gets to decide whether or not to switch the target because it says "your opponent may" (相手は...を選べる). If they choose not to, the attack proceeds as it was originally declared.
BT4-075.question: Q: Your opponent attacks with [Blastmon]. If you have an unsuspended Digimon in play, are you forced to switch the target of attack to it?

BT4-077.answer: A: After ＜Digi-Burst＞ activates. It is triggered after the whole ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect is resolved.
BT4-077.question: Q: If this card is a digivolution card and is trashed by ＜Digi-Burst＞, when does this card return to hand: before or after the additional effect activates?

BT4-078.answer: A: No, you can only trash 1 Option card to get Memory +1 in 1 attack.
BT4-078.question: Q: For this card's effect, can I trash 2 Option cards from hand to get Memory +2?

BT4-084.answer: A: No, even if multiple Tamers are suspended at the same time, as there is only 1 effect timing where Tamers are suspended, you only get Memory +1.
BT4-084.question: Q: For this card's effect, when my opponent suspends multiple of their Tamers by using the effect of [BT2-041 ShineGreymon], do I get Memory +1 for each Tamer suspended?

BT4-084.answer: A: No, even though the effect was triggered it cannot be activated because the Digimon no longer has the effect. (See more in Effect Resolution)
BT4-084.question: Q: I have a [BT1-086 Matt Ishida] in play. My opponent has a Digimon with [BT4-084 NeoDevimon] in its digivolution cards. I play a Blue Digimon and then use Matt's effect to remove NeoDevimon from its sources. Can the effect of NeoDevimon be used?

BT4-086.answer: A: No, as this card's [On Play] effect specified to target [Cerberusmon] this effect.
BT4-086.question: Q: Can I destroy this card itself with its [On Play] effect to get Memory +9?

BT4-086.answer: A: No, as this card's [On Play] effect specified to target [Cerberusmon], you cannot choose [Cerberusmon: Werewolf Mode] as the target of this effect.
BT4-086.question: Q: Can I destroy another 1 of my [Cerberusmon: Werewolf Mode] to get Memory +9?

BT4-087.question: Q: Does the Digimon Played by this card's [When Digivolving] effect also get ＜Rush＞ from this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT4-087.answer: A: Yes, it does. Digimon that gain ＜Rush＞ from this card's effect keep it after Digivolving, and can attack the turn they come into play.
BT4-087.question: Q: If the Digimon Played from Trash by this card's effect digivolves, can that Digimon still attack with the effect of ＜Rush＞?

BT4-087.answer: A: Yes, Anubismon gets ＜Rush＞ from its own effect when played from the trash.
BT4-087.question: Q: If [BT4-087 Anubismon] is played from the trash by the effect of [BT3-109 Back for Revenge!], does it get ＜Rush＞?

BT4-087.answer: A: No, Anubismon was not on the field at the time the Digimon was played.
BT4-087.question: Q: If I use [BT5-107 Revive from the Darkness!!] to delete [BT4-087 Anubismon] and play a Digimon. Does that Digimon gain ＜Rush＞?

BT4-087.answer: A: No, all Digimon played gain ＜Rush＞.
BT4-087.question: Q: If I use [ST6-16 Nail Bone] to play multiple Digimon at the same time. Does only 1 Digimon gain ＜Rush＞ like [EX2-037 Reapermon]?

BT4-087.answer: A: Yes, they both trigger at the same time. So you can choose which effect to activate first.
BT4-087.question: Q: If I digivolve my Level 5 Purple Digimon into this card while under the effects of [EX1-071 Win Rate 60%], and trash [BT6-078 SkullGreymon]. Can I use the [When Digivolving] effect of this card before the "when this card is trashed from your hand" effect of SkullGreymon?

BT4-088.question: Q: Do the cards trashed by this cards' [Opponent's Turn] effect activate their [Security] effects?

BT4-088.answer: A: Yes, the player who is trashing chooses 2 cards from their hand to trash.
BT4-088.question: Q: For this card's [On Deletion] effect, does the player whose cards in hand are to be trashed choose what to trash?

BT4-088.answer: A: Yes, as your Security was reduced once, it activates.
BT4-088.question: Q: When I have this Digimon in my Battle Area, my opponent's Digimon checks [BT1-107 Holy Wave] from my Security, and I gain 1 card in your Security Stack from the [Security] effect. Although the number of Security I end up with is the same, does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect activate?

BT4-088.answer: A: Yes, as both Digimon's effect activates, you trash 2 of your opponent's Security cards.
BT4-088.question: Q: When I have 2 of this Digimon in my Battle Area, my opponent’s Digimon performs a Check and reduced 1 of my Security. Do both Digimon's [Opponent's Turn] activate, trashing 2 of my opponent's Security?
Q: When my Security Stack is reduced by being trashed from effects such as [BT2-020 Gallantmon] etc. instead of from Security Check, does this card's effect still activate?

BT4-088.answer: A: No, you cannot. The [Security] effect must be activated before [Opponent's Turn]'s effect.
BT4-088.question: Q: I check a card with a [Security] effect. Can I choose to use this card's effect first before the [Security] effect?

BT4-090.answer: A: Yes, you can. The turn can only be passed after the attack, or if you declared not to attack.
BT4-090.question: Q: Can I attack with this card's [When Digivolving] effect even if the Memory is moved to 1 or more on my opponent's side after digivolving?

BT4-090.answer: A: No, as the restriction of "Digimon cannot attack on the turn it's Played" cannot be nullified by this effect, it cannot attack.
BT4-090.question: Q: Can this card attack when digivolving from a Digimon that was played on the same turn?

BT4-090.answer: A: No, although you declare an attack from this card's effect first, the attack itself is only resolved after all effects activated from digivolving Digimon are resolved. (See more in Attack Resolution)
BT4-090.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, If there are other effects that activate from digivolving Digimon, can I finish the attack before resolving those effects first?
Q: When this Digimon attacks not by the effect of its [When Digivolving] effect, can I target my opponent's Unsuspended digimon?

BT4-091.question: Q: Can I pick the same 1 of my opponent's Digimon twice for this card's [When Digivolving] effect?
Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, after using it once for the 1st time, can I take some other actions first, then use the 2nd time?
