BT4-092.answer: A: This Tamer will be able to attack in the same way as a Digimon, and will also receive effects that target Digimon. It will also be deleted in battles with Digimon or Security Digimon.
BT4-092.question: Q: How does this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effect treat this Tamer as a Digimon?

BT4-092.answer: A: Yes, it will be deleted.
BT4-092.question: Q: If the DP of this card, which is treated as a Digimon due to the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect, is reduced to 0 by an opponent's effect, will it be deleted?

BT4-092.answer: A: Yes, When this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] activates, this card is treated as both a Digimon and a Tamer, so when it is suspended, it is considered to meet the conditions "When this Tamer is suspended".
BT4-092.question: Q: When this card, treated as a Digimon due to the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect, is suspended, this card's [Your Turn] effect of "When this tamer is suspended" activate because it's currently a Digimon?

BT4-092.answer: A: No, it does not. The effect of this card is only treated as a "Digimon", and when it is placed in the evolution source of another Digimon, it is treated as a Tamer card and the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect that was activated is lost.
BT4-092.question: Q: If this card, which is treated as a Digimon due to the [Start of Your Main Phase] effect, is chosen for the effect of "Place 1 Digimon as a digivolution card of another Digimon". Does that count as "digivolving from this Digimon"?

BT4-094.answer: A: Yes, as no colour is specified, Digimon of any colour gets +1000 DP.
BT4-094.question: Q: When I have 3 or less cards in your Security Stack, do my Digimon of any colour get +1000 DP from this card's effect?

BT4-095.answer: A: You can use it when digivolving into Digimon with ＜Digi-Burst＞ with any trigger timing.
BT4-095.question: Q: Can I only use this card's [Your Turn] effect when digivolving into a Digimon with a ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect with the [When Digivolving] timing?

BT4-096.answer: A: Yes. The order you return cards in is public information.
BT4-096.question: Q: When I use this card's effect to return multiple cards to my deck, do I need to tell my opponent the order I return the cards in?

BT4-097.answer: A: No, all attacks and effects are to be resolved before the turn can be passed, the attack is not stopped.
BT4-097.question: Q: When my opponent's Digimon performs a Security Check from attacking, and I use this card's effect to get Memory +1, putting the Memory to 1 or more on my side. If that attacking Digimon still has Security not Checked yet from ＜Security Attack +1＞, does that attack get stopped?

BT4-097.answer: A: Yes, as your Security Stack was reduced once, you can.
BT4-097.question: Q: When I have this Tamer in my Battle Area, my opponent's Digimon checks [BT1-107 Holy Wave] from my Security, and I gain 1 card from my Security Stack from the [Security] effect. Although the number of Security cards I end up with is the same, can I suspend this card to get Memory +1?

BT4-097.answer: A: Yes, as your Security was reduced once, you can.
BT4-097.question: Q: When I have this Tamer in my Battle Area, and I Play [BT1-087 T.K. Takaishi] and activate its [On Play] effect to add a Yellow Card from my Security to Hand, then activate ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞ . Although the number of Security cards I end up with is the same, can I suspend this card to get Memory +1?
Q: When my Security is reduced by being trashed from effects, like of Digimon like [BT2-020 Gallantmon] etc. instead of from Security Check, does this card's effect still activate?
Q: Can I use this card's effect when I reduce my Security Stack by my own card's effects like [BT4-104 Blinding Ray] etc?

BT4-097.answer: A: No, you cannot. The [Security] effect must be activated before [All Turns]'s effect.
BT4-097.question: Q: I check a card with a [Security] effect. Can I choose to use this card's effect first before the [Security] effect?

BT4-098.answer: A: No, if your opponent does not declare to use their ＜Blocker＞ effect to block that attack, you do not get Memory +3.
BT4-098.question: Q: When my Digimon under the effect of this card attacks my opponent's Digimon, do I get Memory +3?

BT4-098.answer: A: Yes, as the target of this effect is all of your Digimon, even Digimon that are put to your Battle Area afterwards also receive the effect.
BT4-098.question: Q: Does my Digimon moved from Breeding Area to Battle Area on my next turn also get ＜Security Attack +1＞ from this card's [Security] effect on my next turn after it was activated?

BT4-100.question: Q: Can I use this card when my opponent does not have any Digimon that are 6000 DP or less to Play a 4 Cost or less Tamer card from my hand without paying its cost?

BT4-101.answer:
A: No, they are deleted by effects and not by battle.
[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: When my Digimon under the effect of this card attacks my opponent's Digimon without digivolution cards, do those of my opponent's Digimon count as being "deleted by battle"?

BT4-101.answer:
A: No, you cannot. This card's obtained effect is resolved before the declaration of Blocking. (See more in Attack Resolution)
[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: On my opponent's turn, my opponent uses this card, and attacks my Digimon without digivolution cards. Can I use my other Digimon's ＜Blocker＞ to prevent my attacked Digimon from being deleted?

BT4-101.answer:
A: Yes, you can. (See more in Attack Resolution)
[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: On my opponent's turn, my opponent uses this card, and attacks my Digimon without digivolution cards. Can I use my other Digimon's ＜Blocker＞ to start a battle?

BT4-101.answer:
A: No, as this card's effect must be resolved before declaration of ＜Blocker＞, even if you Block with a Digimon with no digivolution cards, the effect does not happen, and your Blocking Digimon enters battle.
[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: On my opponent's turn, my opponent uses this card, and attacks my Digimon. I then activate ＜Blocker＞ of my other Digimon that has no digivolution cards. Does my Digimon that Blocked get deleted?

BT4-101.answer:
A: No, as that Digimon with higher DP was deleted before battle happens, the attacking Digimon is not deleted. So the battle ends.
[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: My Digimon under the effect of this card attacks a Digimon without digivolution cards that has higher DP than my Digimon. Does my attacking Digimon lose the battle and get deleted?

BT4-101.answer:
A: No, as ＜Piercing＞ requires your Digimon to destroy your opponent's Digimon in battle and survive, if your opponent's Digimon was deleted by this card's effect instead, ＜Piercing＞ does not activate.
[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: My Digimon with ＜Piercing＞ under the effect of this card attacks my opponent's Digimon without digivolution cards, does its ＜Piercing＞ effect activate?

BT4-101.answer:
A: No, as that Digimon was deleted by effects and not battle, your Digimon is not unsuspended.
[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: My Digimon with effects that requires my Digimon to destroy my opponent's Digimon in battle to put itself to Active, like [BT1-112 Dimension Scissor] etc, attacks my opponent's Digimon without digivolution cards and destroys it by this card's effect, do I put my Digimon to Active?

BT4-101.answer:
A: The Digimon is not deleted, as its trigger condition of "declaring an attack on a Digimon with no digivolution cards" was not fulfilled. The effect cannot be used to delete the Digimon. (See more in Effect Resolution)
[1]
BT4-101.question: Q: My Digimon under this card's effect attacks my opponent's Digimon with 1 digivolution card, then my Digimon's other [When Attacking] effect trash that 1 digivolution card, what happens to my opponent's Digimon?

BT4-102.answer: A: No, you cannot. Mother D-Reaper was returned to the bottom of your Digi-Egg Deck instead so the condition of "return 1 Digimon to your hand" was not fulfilled.
BT4-102.question: Q: If this card returns my [EX2-007 Mother D-Reaper] to my hand, can I return my opponent's Digimon to the hand?

BT4-102.answer: A: No, you cannot. The Token was removed from play instead so the condition of "return 1 Digimon to your hand" was not fulfilled.
BT4-102.question: Q: If this card returns a Token to my hand, can I return my opponent's Digimon to the hand?

BT4-103.answer: A: No, as that Digimon was already returned to your opponent's hand by this card's effect, you cannot activate this effect again to return that Digimon to the bottom of the deck instead.
BT4-103.question: Q: My opponent has 7 cards in hand when I used this card, resulting in my opponent having 8 cards in hand. Does the targeted Digimon that was returned to my opponent's hand, now return to the bottom of the deck instead?

BT4-104.answer: A: Yes, as trashing the top 1 card of your Security Stack is not a requirement, you get Memory +2 when using this card even with 0 cards in your Security Stack.
BT4-104.question: Q: Can I use this card when I have 0 cards in my Security Stack to get Memory +2?

BT4-105.answer: A: No, as it was not deleted, the effect does not activate.
BT4-105.question: Q: Does the Digimon added to the Security Stack by this card's effect activate its [On Deletion] effect?

BT4-108.answer: A: Yes, you can do either.
BT4-108.question: Q: Can I use this card when I don't have any Digimon, to suspend 1 of my opponent's Digimon, or when my opponent doesn't have any Digimon, to unsuspend 1 of my Digimon?

BT4-109.answer: A: Yes, that's right. Even if your Digimon's original DP is not 16000, and only becomes 16000 or more after receving this effect's +3000DP, it gets ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, ＜Security Attack +1＞.
BT4-109.question: Q: If my Digimon becomes 16000DP or more after receiving this card's +3000DP effect, does it then get ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, ＜Security Attack +1＞?

BT4-109.answer: A: No, as the Digimon was selected for it to get ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, ＜Security Attack +1＞ from this card's effect, those effects will not be lost until the end of you opponent's next turn even if its DP is reduced to 15000 or less.
BT4-109.question: Q: When my Digimon that gained ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, ＜Security Attack +1＞ from this card's effect has its DP reduced to 15000 or less by other effects, does it then lose its ＜Blocker＞,＜Reboot＞,＜Security Attack +1＞?

BT4-109.answer: A: No, if your Digimon's DP is not at 16000 or more from resolving this card's effect, it does not get ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, ＜Security Attack +1＞.
BT4-109.question: Q: My Digimon's DP is 15000 or less after receiving the effects of this card. Its DP is then raised to 16000 or more by other effects. Does it get ＜Blocker＞, ＜Reboot＞, ＜Security Attack +1＞ at this point of time?

BT4-110.answer: A: If you have 1 Digimon with [D-Brigade] type, you can target your opponent's Digimon with Play Cost of 4 or less for this card's effect.If you have 2 Digimon with [D-Brigade] type, you can target your opponent's Digimon with Play Cost of 5 or less for this card's effect.In this manner, you add 1 to the selectable range of Play Cost of your opponent's Digimon you can target for this card's effect for each [D-Brigade] type Digimon you have.
BT4-110.question: Q: What does this card's "For each [D-Brigade] type Digimon you have, +1 to the Play Cost you can choose for this effect." mean?

BT4-111.answer: A: No, as Option cards are only put to Trash after resolving their effects, this card itself is not counted.
BT4-111.question: Q: I have 9 cards in Trash when I use this card, then this card becomes the 10th card in my Trash. Do I get Memory +1?

BT4-114.question: Q: Can I unsuspend [AncientGarurumon] this card's [When Attacking] effect?

BT4-114.answer: A: Yes, AncientGarurumon's Japanese text does not specify "you may" (できる). Effects that specify "up to" must also choose at least 1 card.
BT4-114.question: Q: If I have suspended Digimon that can be targeted with this card's effect, am I required to unsuspend 1 or more of them?

BT4-114.answer: A: No, as the effect must be activated on the first time you declare an attack with this card. You must also suspend at least 1 Digimon. If you don't have anything to unsuspend the effect was activated and the [Once Per Turn] effect cannot be activated again.
BT4-114.question: Q: If this Digimon attacks and is unsuspended by another effect first. Then I declare this card's [When Attacking] effect but don't unsuspend anything. Can I use its [When Attacking] effect on the second attack?

BT5-003.answer: A: Yes, the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards is also included.
BT5-003.question: Q: Does this card's interited effect also include the Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards itself as well?

BT5-006.answer: A: No, both Digimon are deleted at the same time, and that Digimon is already to be deleted from having 0 DP, so you cannot do that.
BT5-006.question: Q: My Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards and another of my Digimon is reduced to 0 DP at the same time by 1 of my opponent's effects. At this point of time, does this card's inherited effect give itself +2000 DP and stop itself from being deleted due to having 0 DP?

BT5-007.answer: A: No, if you only revealed either a Digimon card with [Greymon] in its name or a Digimon card with [Omnimon] in its name, you still add either of them to your hand.
BT5-007.question: Q: For this card's effect, if I do not reveal both a card with [Greymon] in its name and a card with [Omnimon] in its name, does that mean I don't get to add them to my hand?

BT5-008.answer: A: It is an effect that nullifies the effects that reduces the cost to digivolve such as ＜Digisorption＞, or [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!], etc. Even if your opponent activates those effects, they are unable to reduce the cost to digivolve, and must pay the digivolution cost as written on the cards to digivolve.
BT5-008.question: Q: What does this card's effect of [cannot reduce digivolution costs] mean exactly?
Q: When my opponent has this card in play, can I use ＜Digisorption＞ of a card in my hand to reduce the digivolution cost?

BT5-008.answer: A: Yes you can, as the effects of cards like [BT2-111 Beelzemon] do not reduce the digivolution cost, but allows you to digivolve by paying a specified cost while ignoring digivolution requirements.
BT5-008.question: Q: When my opponent has this card in play, can I use effects of [Digivolve for X cost while ignoring the Digivolution requirements] like [BT2-111 Beelzemon] etc?

BT5-008.answer: A: Yes, you can still suspend a Digimon with ＜Digisorption＞ even though you can't reduce the digivolution cost.
BT5-008.question: Q: My opponent has [BT5-008 Gaossmon], can I use ＜Digisorption＞ to suspend a Digimon even though the cost is not reduced?

BT5-008.answer: A: Yes, that card's effect does not "reduce" it "sets" the digivolution cost.
BT5-008.question: Q: Can my opponent digivolve into [BT7-040 Rasenmon] for a lower digivolution cost if I have this card?

BT5-009.answer: A: No, if you only revealed either a Digimon card with [Shoutmon] in its name or a Digimon card with ＜Blitz＞, you still add either of them to your hand.
BT5-009.question: Q: For this card's effect, if I do not reveal both a card with [Shoutmon] in its name and a card with ＜Blitz＞, does that mean I don't get to add them to my hand?

BT5-009.answer: A: Yes, as [BT5-019 Shoutmon DX] can meet either condition of "Digimon card with [Shoutmon] in its name" and "Digimon card with ＜Blitz＞, you can add them both to your hand.
BT5-009.question: Q: For this card's effect, if I revealed 2 [BT5-019 Shoutmon DX] from among the 5 revealed cards, can I add them both to my hand?

BT5-014.answer:
A: No,you cannot Digivolve your [Shoutmon] in Breeding Area into this card with this card's effect.
[1]
BT5-014.question: Q: Can I digivolve my [Shoutmon] in Breeding Area into this card?

BT5-014.answer:
A: No, as long as the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards has the ＜Blitz＞ effect, it gains ＜Security Attack +1＞ even if not attacking using ＜Blitz＞.
[1]
BT5-014.question: Q: For this card's inherited effect, does that Digimon not gain ＜Security Attack +1＞ if it's not attacking by using ＜Blitz＞?
Q: If I use an effect to digivolve my Digimon in the Battle Area, can I use it to digivolve my [Shoutmon] into this card?

BT5-017.answer: A: No, the effect requires you to be currently attacking with ＜Blitz＞.
BT5-017.question: Q: If my Digimon has an effect "[When Digivolving] ＜Blitz＞." but is not currently activating the effect of ＜Blitz＞. Is it possible to attack my opponent's unsuspended Digimon?

BT5-018.answer: A: As the effect lasts the turn, you get +4000 DP in total.
BT5-018.question: Q: When this Digimon attacks, I use its [When Attacking] effect to trash a 3000 DP Red Digimon card from my hand to give this Digmon +3000 DP. On the same turn, this Digimon is able to make a 2nd attack due to other effects. I use the effect a 2nd time to Discard a Red 1000 DP Digimon card from my hand. Does this Digimon now get +4000 DP in total, or only +1000 DP from the last card trashed?

BT5-019.question: Q: When I digivolve a Level 5 Digimon into this Digimon, can I put a Red Level 4 or below, or a Level 7 Digimon card from my hand to the top most digivolution cards card?

BT5-019.answer:
A: It becomes a Level 3 Digimon. The digivolution cards under this Digimon remain as they are, and their inherited effects can still activate.
[1]
BT5-019.question: Q: I use this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect to put a Level 3 Digimon card on the top of its digivolution cards. This Digimon then receives the effect of ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ and is trashed. What happens to this Digimon?

BT5-019.answer:
A: This card itself is trashed due to ＜De-Digivolve＞, then this Digimon becomes a Level 3 Digimon. As ＜De-Digivolve＞ is unable to trash any further when the Digimon becomes Level 3, the ＜De-Digivolve＞ effect ends. The digivolution cards under this Digimon remain as they are, and their inherited effects can still activate.
[1]
BT5-019.question: Q: I use this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect to put a Level 3 Digimon card on the top of its digivolution cards. This Digimon then receives the effect of ＜De-Digivolve  2＞. How do I resolve this?

BT5-019.answer:
A: No, if you chose to resolve ＜Blitz＞ first, you will suspend this Digimon, and declare attack. The actual attack will only happen after all other [When Digivolving] effects have finished resolving. It will activate after your [When Attacking] effects but before your opponent's [Reaction]/[Counter] Timing effects. (See more in Attack Resolution)
[1]
BT5-019.question: Q: Since this card has 2 [When Digivolving] effects, if I choose to resolve ＜Blitz＞ first, does that mean I resolve the other [When Digivolving] effect after the attack from ＜Blitz＞ ends?

BT5-019.answer:
A: Yes, you can attack your opponent's unsuspended Digimon due to [ZeigGreymon]'s inherited effect.
[1]
BT5-019.question: Q: I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to put [BT5-017 ZeigGreymon] from my hand to the top of this Digimon's digivolution cards. I then activate ＜Blitz＞ to attack. Does [ZeigGreymon]'s inherited effect then allow me to attack my opponent's unsuspended Digimon?

BT5-019.answer:
A: Yes, you can still delete Digimon without doing the first part of the [When Digivolving].
[2]
BT5-019.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to delete Digimon even if I don't place a card on its digivolution cards?

BT5-019.answer:
A: No, if there is a valid target and you have not deleted equal to the number of [ZeigGreymon]/[OmniShoutmon] in its digivolution cards you must delete that target.
[3]
BT5-019.question: Q: Can I attempt to delete less Digimon than the number of [ZeigGreymon]/[OmniShoutmon] in this Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT5-020.answer: A: No, if you only revealed either a Digimon card with [Garurumon] in its name or a Digimon card with [Omnimon] in its name, you still add either of them to your hand.
BT5-020.question: Q: For this card's effect, if I do not reveal both a card with [Garurumon] in its name and a card with [Omnimon] in its name, does that mean I don't get to add them to my hand?

BT5-021.answer: A: It is an effect that nullifies the effects that reduces the cost to digivolve such as ＜Digisorption＞, or [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!], etc. Even if your opponent activates those effects, they are unable to reduce the cost to digivolve, and must pay the digivolution cost as written on the cards to digivolve.
BT5-021.question: Q: What does this card's effect of [cannot reduce digivolution costs] mean exactly?
Q: When my opponent has this card in play, can I use ＜Digisorption＞ of a card in my hand to reduce the digivolution cost?

BT5-021.answer: A: Yes you can, as the effects of cards like [BT2-111 Beelzemon] do not reduce the digivolution cost, but allows you to digivolve by paying a specified cost while ignoring digivolution requirements.
BT5-021.question: Q: When my opponent has this card in play, can I use effects of [Digivolve for X cost while ignoring the Digivolution requirements] like [BT2-111 Beelzemon] etc?

BT5-021.answer: A: Yes, you can still suspend a Digimon with ＜Digisorption＞ even though you can't reduce the digivolution cost.
BT5-021.question: Q: My opponent has [BT5-021 Syakomon], can I use ＜Digisorption＞ to suspend a Digimon even though the cost is not reduced?

BT5-021.answer: A: Yes, that card's effect does not "reduce" it "sets" the digivolution cost.
BT5-021.question: Q: Can my opponent digivolve into [BT7-040 Rasenmon] for a lower digivolution cost if I have this card?

BT5-022.answer: A: No, effects that return Digimon to hand are not treated as trashing digivolution cards, you do not get Memory +1.
BT5-022.question: Q: When my opponent's Digimon are returned to hand, do I get Memory +1 from this card's inherited effect?

BT5-022.answer: A: No, even if you trash multiple Digimon's digivolution cards at the same time, you only get Memory +1.
BT5-022.question: Q: When I trash 2 of my opponent's Digimon's digivolution cards at the same time, do I get Memory +2?
Q: My opponent trashes a digivolution card with one of their effects like [BT5-111 Omnimon X] or ＜Digi-Burst＞. Can I use this card's effect?

BT5-030.answer:
A: The target of that attack is changed to this Digimon and battle happens as per normal. This card's effect stops your opponent from choosing this card as an attack target, so as the user of this card, you are able to change the attack target to this Digimon with ＜Blocker＞.
[1]
BT5-030.question: Q: This Digimon gained ＜Blocker＞ from other effects. I then activate this Digimon's ＜Blocker＞ against an opponent's Digimon's attack. What happens?
Q: Can I use [BT4-090 Chaosmon]'s [When Digivolving] effect to choose this Digimon as the target of attack?

BT5-030.answer:
A: Yes, you can. The attack target will be changed to This Digimon and the battle will happen.
[1]
BT5-030.question: Q: I have this Digimon unsuspended, and my opponent's [BT4-075 Blastmon] attacks. Can I change the attack target to this Digimon due to [Blastmon]'s effect?

BT5-031.answer: A: No, that Digimon does not have [On Deletion].
BT5-031.question: Q: If a Digimon has [On Deletion] has an inherited effect, can this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect target it?

BT5-031.answer: A: Yes, that Digimon was given [On Deletion] while in the battle area.
BT5-031.question: Q: If a Digimon was given [On Deletion] from its digivolution card's inherited effect, can this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect target it?

BT5-031.answer: A: Yes, that Digimon was given [On Deletion] while in the battle area.
BT5-031.question: Q: If a Digimon was given [On Deletion] from an Option card's effect, can this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect target it?

BT5-032.answer: A: Yes, even if your opponent only have a Digimon with no digivolution cards because of this card's [When Attacking] effect, it gets ＜Jamming＞.
BT5-032.question: Q: My opponent has no Digimon with no digivolution cards, but when I attack with this Digimon and its [When Attacking] effect trashes my opponent's Digimon's digivolution cards, resulting in my opponent now having a Digimon with no digivolution cards. Does that attack get ＜Jamming＞?

BT5-032.answer: A: No, as the digivolution cards are lost after the declaration of attack, this card's effect does not interrupt and stop the attack from continuing.
BT5-032.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play, my Digimon with ＜Security Attack +1＞ attacks my opponent Player, and the Security Check reveals a [BT1-101 Howling Crusher], and its [Security] effect removed all of my attacking Digimon's digivolution cards. Is that attack now interrupted and ends?

BT5-032.answer: A: No, as this card's [When Attacking] effects has already finished resolving before this, that attack does not gain ＜Jamming＞. (See more in Attack Resolution)
BT5-032.question: Q: This Digimon with ＜Security Attack +1＞ attacks my opponent Player, and a Digimon is Played via its [Security] effect. Since there is now a Digimon with no digivolution cards in my opponent's Battle Area, does my 2nd Check gain ＜Jamming＞?

BT5-032.answer: A: Yes, the Digimon can still be suspended but the attack will not be redirected.
BT5-032.question: Q: Can my opponent still suspend their Digimon with ＜Blocker＞ if they have no digivolution cards?

BT5-033.answer: A: It is an effect that nullifies the effects that reduces the cost to digivolve such as ＜Digisorption＞, or [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!], etc. Even if your opponent activates those effects, they are unable to reduce the cost to digivolve, and must pay the digivolution cost as written on the cards to digivolve.
BT5-033.question: Q: What does this card's effect of [cannot reduce digivolution costs] mean exactly?
Q: When my opponent has this card in play, can I use ＜Digisorption＞ of a card in my hand to reduce the digivolution cost?

BT5-033.answer: A: Yes you can, as the effects of cards like [BT2-111 Beelzemon] do not reduce the digivolution cost, but allows you to digivolve by paying a specified cost while ignoring digivolution requirements.
BT5-033.question: Q: When my opponent has this card in play, can I use effects of [Digivolve for X cost while ignoring the Digivolution requirements] like [BT2-111 Beelzemon] etc?

BT5-033.answer: A: Yes, you can still suspend a Digimon with ＜Digisorption＞ even though you can't reduce the digivolution cost.
BT5-033.question: Q: My opponent has [BT5-033 Cutemon], can I use ＜Digisorption＞ to suspend a Digimon even though the cost is not reduced?

BT5-033.answer: A: Yes, that card's effect does not "reduce" it "sets" the digivolution cost.
BT5-033.question: Q: Can my opponent digivolve into [BT7-040 Rasenmon] for a lower digivolution cost if I have this card?

BT5-035.answer: A: Yes, this Digimon itself is included.
BT5-035.question: Q: Does this card's effect include this Digimon itself?

BT5-035.answer: A: No, you cannot. Only 1 Digimon can be targetted.
BT5-035.question: Q: If I have 2 Digimon, can I choose 2 of my opponent's Digimon to get -1000 DP each?

BT5-035.answer: A: No, you cannot, as its [On Play] effect has already activated.
BT5-035.question: Q: After Playing this Digimon, I Play another Digimon on the same turn. Do I get to -1000 DP to 1 of my opponent's Digimon one more time?

BT5-037.answer: A: Without showing your opponent, you look at all the cards in your Security Stack. Choose 1 card you want to add to your hand, reveal only that card to your opponent before adding it to your hand.
BT5-037.question: Q: What does [look at your Security stack...reveal it, and add it to your hand..etc] of this card's effect mean exactly?

BT5-037.answer: A: Without performing ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞, shuffle your Security Stack.
BT5-037.question: Q: What happens when there are no cards in my Security Stack that I can add to my hand with this card's effect?

BT5-037.answer: A: No, you do not have to add it to your hand.
BT5-037.question: Q: If you have a [Holy Warrior]/[Warrior] trait in Security, do you have to add it to your handif you checked security?

BT5-037.answer: A: No, you can choose not to look at your security. If you do not look at security you must still shuffle the security.
BT5-037.question: Q: Do I have to check the security?

BT5-038.answer: A: No, even if the Security Digimon has 0 DP, a battle still happens.
BT5-038.question: Q: If my opponent's Security Digimon revealed during Security Checks becomes 0 DP from this card's inherited effect, is that Security Digimon trashed without battling?

BT5-038.answer: A: The [Security] effect is activated as per normal.
BT5-038.question: Q: If my opponent's Security Digimon revealed during Security Checks that has a [Security] effect becomes 0 DP from this card's inherited effect, what happens?

BT5-038.answer: A: No, as that card is no longer a Security Digimon the moment it is Played, it does not receive the effects of DP reduction anymore.
BT5-038.question: Q: My opponent's Security Digimon that has its DP reduced by this card's inherited effect is Played via its [Security] effect. Does that Digimon still has its DP reduced?

BT5-041.answer: A: No, even if the Security Digimon has 0 DP, a battle still happens.
BT5-041.question: Q: If my opponent's Security Digimon revealed during Security Checks becomes 0 DP from this card's interited effect, is that Security Digimon trashed without battling?

BT5-041.answer: A: The [Security] effect is activated as per normal.
BT5-041.question: Q: If my opponent's Security Digimon revealed during Security Checks that has a [Security] effect becomes 0 DP from this card's interited effect, what happens?

BT5-041.answer: A: No, as that card is no longer a Security Digimon the moment it is Played, it does not receive the effects of DP Minus anymore.
BT5-041.question: Q: My opponent's Security Digimon that has its DP reduced by this card's interited effect is Played via its [Security] effect. Does that Digimon still has its DP reduced?

BT5-044.answer: A: Yes, it activates even in Breeding Phase.
BT5-044.question: Q: Does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect activate even if my opponent moves their Digimon from Breeding Area to Battle Area in their Breeding Phase?

BT5-044.answer: A: No, even if the Security Digimon has 0 DP, a battle still happens.
BT5-044.question: Q: If my opponent's Security Digimon revealed during Security Checks becomes 0 DP from this card's interited effect, is that Security Digimon trashed without battling?

BT5-044.answer: A: The [Security] effect is activated as per normal.
BT5-044.question: Q: If my opponent's Security Digimon revealed during Security Checks that has a [Security] effect becomes 0 DP from this card's interited effect, what happens?

BT5-044.answer: A: No, as that card is no longer a Security Digimon the moment it is Played, it does not receive the effects of DP Minus anymore.
BT5-044.question: Q: My opponent's Security Digimon that has its DP reduced by this card's interited effect is Played via its [Security] effect. Does that Digimon still has its DP reduced?

BT5-047.answer:
A: Yes, this card's effect can choose itself.
[1]
BT5-047.question: Q: For this card's effect, can I choose to put itself on the bottom of 1 of my Green Digimon?

BT5-047.answer:
A: Yes, you can. The [On Deletion] effect is activated as [Palmon], but since the effect of changing the name is lost when the card is placed in teh trash due to the deletion, this card becomes [Palmon].
[2]
BT5-047.question: Q: If this card is affected by the effect of [BT11-043 KingSukamon], and this card was renamed to [Sukamon] and then deleted. If there are no other [Palmon] cards in the trash, can this card's [On Deletion] effect be used to place this card under a Green Digimon as a digivolution card?

BT5-056.question: Q: If I digivolve [BT5-056 Rafflesimon] on top of another [BT5-056 Rafflesimon]. Can I use the [Once Per Turn] effect of the new Rafflesimon if the old Rafflesimon used it before?

BT5-057.answer: A: Yes, this effect is applied as a Global Effect. If it satisfies the condition afterwards, it gains ＜Security Attack +1＞.
BT5-057.question: Q: If after using this card's ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect, one of my Digimon without ＜Digi-Burst＞ becomes a Digimon with ＜Digi-Burst＞, does that Digimon gain ＜Security Attack +1＞?

BT5-057.answer: A: No, this effect is applied as a Global Effect. So if it no longer satisfies the condition then it no longer has the ＜Security Attack +1＞.
BT5-057.question: Q: If after using this card's ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect, one of my Digimon with ＜Digi-Burst＞ becomes a Digimon without ＜Digi-Burst＞, does that Digimon keep the ＜Security Attack +1＞?

BT5-057.answer: A: Yes, as it has already resolved and applied a Global effect, the Global effect continues applying even after Rosemon leaves the battle area.
BT5-057.question: Q: If after using this card's ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect, this card leaves the battle area does the ＜Security Attack +1＞ continue being applied?

BT5-059.answer: A: No, if you only revealed either an [Unidentified] Type Digimon card or a [Arata Sanada], you still add them to your hand.
BT5-059.question: Q: For this card's effect, if I do not reveal an [Unidentified] Type Digimon card and a [Arata Sanada], does that mean I don't get to add them to my hand?

BT5-060.answer: A: Return that card face down back to the top of your deck.
BT5-060.question: Q: For this card's [On Play] effect, what do I do with the top 1 card of my deck after confirming it?

BT5-063.answer: A: Yes, since that Digimon is now a different name, it has lost ＜Rush＞ and cannot attack anymore.
BT5-063.question: Q: If a Digimon that has ＜Rush＞ from this card's effect is digivolved into a Digimon with a different name, does that mean that Digimon cannot attack anymore on the turn it was played?

BT5-063.answer: A: No, it does not. It is only other Digimon that share a name that gain ＜Rush＞.
BT5-063.question: Q: If I play [BT5-063 Kurisarimon] this turn, and then digivolve it into a new Digimon. Does the Digimon on top of Kurisarimon gain ＜Rush＞?

BT5-065.answer: A: No, from the point of time when it's Played, it is treated as a normal Digimon.
BT5-065.question: Q: Is a Digimon Played by this card's effect also treated as a Security Digimon in the Battle Area?

BT5-065.answer: A: Yes, regardless of the outcome of the battle, it is played after the battle ends.
BT5-065.question: Q: For this card's effect, can the Digimon be Played even if it lost the battle against the attacking Digimon as a Security Digimon?

BT5-065.answer: A: The timing to Play this Digimon is after its battle with the attacking Digimon. So it is played before the remaining checks happen.
BT5-065.question: Q: For this card's effect, if this was revealed from a Check, but the attacking Digimon still has remaining checks left, is this Digimon Played first, or do the remaining checks finish first?

BT5-067.answer:
A: No, your [Keramon] in your Breeding Area cannot digivolve into this card with this card's effect.
[1]
BT5-067.question: Q: Can I digivolve my [Keramon] in my Breeding Area into this card?

BT5-067.answer:
A: Played by an effect, it is a special card that is treated like any other Digimon or Tamer With this card's effect, a Token that is treated a s Digimon named [Diaboromon] is played. For more rule details on Tokens, please check the Rule Manual.
[1]
BT5-067.question: Q: What is a [Token]?
Q: If I use an effect to digivolve my Digimon in the Battle Area, can I use it to digivolve my [Shoutmon] into this card?

BT5-070.answer: A: At the point of time when you use this ＜Digi-Burst＞,  your opponent does not have any Digimon that are 6 cost or Below, or if there are no Digimon that can be deleted by this effect, It refers to a situation where your opponent does not have a Digimon that can be deleted by this effect.
BT5-070.question: Q: What does this card's ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect of "Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less. If no Digimon was deleted by this effect..." mean exactly?

BT5-070.answer: A: No, when you use this card's ＜Digi-Burst＞, if there is a valid target of [opponen'ts Digimon with 6 Play cost or below], you must delete it. You cannot choose not to activate an effect if there is a valid target.
BT5-070.question: Q: When I use this card's ＜Digi-Burst＞, and my opponent has a 6 cost or below Digimon, can I choose not to delete that Digimon to trash the top 1 card of my oppponent's Security?

BT5-070.answer: A: Yes, as it was a valid target of 6 cost or below Digimon, you can target it with this effect, then fail to delete it because of its effect of [cannot be deleted by opponent's effects].
BT5-070.question: Q: If my opponent has a 6 cost or below Digimon with the effect [This Digimon cannot be deleted by opponent's effects], and another Digimon without that effect, when I use this card's ＜Digi-Burst＞, can I purposely choose the Digimon that has the effect of [This Digimon cannot be deleted by opponent's effect] to trash the top 1 card of my opponent's Security?

BT5-070.answer: A: Yes, no Digimon was deleted by this effect so you will trash the top card of your opponent's Security.
BT5-070.question: Q: If I target my opponent's Digimon for deletion, but it activates an effect that prevents it. Do I still get to trash a card from security?

BT5-071.answer: A: No, as this card's condition is "has been deleted by an effect" and a Digimon being deleted by having 0 DP is a game rule, and not an effect, it does not activate.
BT5-071.question: Q: This Digimon is deleted by being put to 0 DP by my opponent's effects and is deleted. Does this card's [On Deletion] effect activate?

BT5-071.answer: A: No, the effect does not trigger. This effect behaves the same way as an effect that reads "When this Digimon is deleted by an effect".
BT5-071.question: Q: This Digimon is deleted, but not by an effect. Does its [On Deletion] effect trigger?

BT5-072.question: Q: For this card's effect, can I return a Level 3 Digimon card that has a [On Deletion] inherited effect to my hand?

BT5-072.answer: A: No, even though the Digimon has [On Deletion], the Digimon card does not have [On Deletion], so it cannot be returned.
BT5-072.question: Q: If this Digimon is deleted at the same time as another Digimon that gained an [On Deletion] effect from its digivolution cards. Can I add that Digimon card to hand?

BT5-082.question: Q: For this card's effect, when I have another Digimon, can I choose which of the 3 effects to activate?

BT5-082.answer: A: The player can choose which order to activate them in.
BT5-082.question: Q: When I have no other Digimon, in which order do I activate the 3 effects?

BT5-084.answer: A:  ◼ Played by an effect, it is a special card that is treated like any other Digimon or Tamer. ◼ With this card's effect, a Token that is treated a s Digimon named [Diaboromon] is played. ◼ For more rule details on Tokens, please check the Rule Manual.
BT5-084.question: Q: What is a [Token]?

BT5-085.question: Q: When I play this card, can I delete a [Diaboromon Token to reduce this card's Play cost by 12 with this card's effect?

BT5-085.answer: A: The effect does not stop the effect from triggering, it only prevents the player from activating the triggered effect. (See more in Effect Resolution)
BT5-085.question: Q: Does this card's effect prevent the effect from triggering or activating?

BT5-085.answer: A: Yes, this effect only prevents effects that triggered from a [When Digivolving] timing from activating.
BT5-085.question: Q: My opponent has an effect with double conditions such as [When Attacking][When Digivolving]. Can the effect still activate if it attacks?

BT5-086.answer: A: Yes, if you choose to resolve the effects of ＜Blitz＞ first, you will suspend this Digimon and declare attack, then unsuspend this Digimon. The attack itself only happens after any other effects of the same timing are resolved
BT5-086.question: Q: When digivolving into this card, can I choose to resolve ＜Blitz＞ first to attack, then unsuspend this Digimon?

BT5-086.answer: A: No, as this card's [All Turns] effects nullifies the effect of it being deleted or returned to hand or deck, it is not treated to have been deleted.
BT5-086.question: Q: When I use this Digimon's [All Turns] effect, can I use my other Digimon's [When a Digimon is deleted] effects?

BT5-086.answer: A: Yes, ＜Piercing＞ was resolved and as the Digimon is still in play, it can perform security checks.
BT5-086.question: Q: This Digimon deletes a Digimon with ＜Retaliation＞ in battle while it has [BT3-016 Durandamon] in its digivolution cards. Does the Digimon's security check from ＜Piercing＞ still happen?
Q: If my opponent uses this card's effect to trash a digivolution card. Can I use [BT2-085 Joe Kido]'s effect?

BT5-086.answer: A: Yes, after Omnimon prevents the first Retaliation effect. The second Retaliation effect can be activated by the opponent to try and delete it again.
BT5-086.question: Q: This Digimon deletes a Digimon in battle that has 2 copies of the ＜Retaliation＞ effect from different sources. If this Digimon prevents one of the effects by trashing a level 6, can the other still delete it?

BT5-087.answer: A: Yes, you can Play any Purple or Black Digimon card with Play cost of 8 or less that were originally already in your Trash.
BT5-087.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, can I choose any 2 Purple or Black Digimon card with Play cost of 8 or less in my Trash even if they were not trashed by this effect?

BT5-087.answer: A: Yes, you can choose 1 Black Digimon and 1 Purple Digimon to play with this effect.
BT5-087.question: Q: Can I use this card's [When Digivolving] effect to play 1 Black Digimon and 1 Purple Digimon?

BT5-088.question: Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect apply even if my opponent only has 1 Digimon with no digivolution cards and the rest of their Digimon have digivolution cards?

BT5-088.answer: A: No, it doesn't check Digimon in the breeding area.
BT5-088.question: Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect apply if my opponent has a Digimon with no digivolution cards in their breeding area?

BT5-088.answer: A: No, it doesn't. Your opponent has to have a Digimon in their battle area for it to activate.
BT5-088.question: Q: Does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect apply when my opponent doesn't have any Digimon in their battle area?

BT5-088.answer: A: Yes, it is a "Do <X> to <Y> effect. As such, it follows the rules detailed in the Detailed Rules. (Found in Effect Resolution/Related Information#Costs)
BT5-088.question: Q: When my blue Digimon attacks, can I suspend this Tamer even if my opponent has no Digimon in the battle area?

BT5-089.answer: A: Yes, it does. [Start of Your Turn] effects are activated before Digimon are unsuspended in the Unsuspend Phase.
BT5-089.question: Q: If my opponent has a suspended Digimon with ＜Reboot＞, and becomes Active in my Unsuspend Phase, does this card's [Start of Your Turn] effect activate?

BT5-089.answer: A: No, as the effect says "you may", you can choose not to digivolve it.
BT5-089.question: Q: For this card's [Your Turn] effect, if my Green Level 5 Digimon attacks and reveals a Green Level 6 Digimon, must I digivolve into that Digimon?
Q: For this card's [Your Turn] effect, if 2 or more Green Level 6 Digimon are revealed, can I choose which card to digivolve into?
Q: When my Digimon attacks and digivolves usinig this card's [Your Turn] effect, do I Draw 1 from the Digivolution Bonus?
Q: For this card's [Your Turn] effect, if I revealed a non-Green Level 6 Digimon, can I digivolve into them?

BT5-089.answer: A: Although you can activate both Tamer's effect in 1 attack, you are to resolve the 2 Tamer's effect 1 by 1  and not at the same time. First you suspend the 1st Tamer, reveal the top 3 cards of your deck, and choose a card to digivolve into. After that, you can choose to activate the 2nd Tamer's effect or not. If you digivolved into a Green Level 6 Digimon from the 1st Tamer's effect, even if the 2nd Tamer's effect reveals a Green Level 6 Digimon, you cannot digivolve your now Level 6 Digimon into the revealed Green Level 6 Digimon unless it fulfills the digivolution requirement (Like [BT5-056 Rafflesimon] etc).
BT5-089.question: Q: If I have 2 of this Tamer, and my Green Level 5 Digimon attacks, can I suspended both Tamers and reveal the top 6 cards of my deck to choose a card to digivolve into?

BT5-089.answer: A: It activates immediately after you draw the bonus card for digivolving. Even if there are other [When Attacking] or "When one of your Digimon attacks" effects, the [When Digivolving] effect activates first as a newly triggered effect. (See more in Effect Resolution)
BT5-089.question: Q: If the Level 6 Digimon I digivolve into with this card's [Your Turn] effect has a [When Digivolving] effect, at what timing do they activate>?

BT5-089.answer: A: No, as it is already passed timing for [When Attacking] effects to activate, they do not activate,.
BT5-089.question: Q: If the Level 6 Digimon I digivolve into with this card's [Your Turn] effect has a [When Attacking] effect, does that effect activate?

BT5-090.answer: A:  ◼ Played by an effect, it is a special card that is treated like any other Digimon or Tamer. ◼ With this card's effect, a Token that is treated a s Digimon named [Diaboromon] is played. ◼ For more rule details on Tokens, please check the Rule Manual.
BT5-090.question: Q: What is a [Token]?

BT5-091.answer: A: Yes, it gives your own Digimon the effect as well.
BT5-091.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect also give my own Level 3 Digimon the effect of "[When Attacking] Memory -1"?

BT5-091.answer: A: Yes, as both effects are activated separately, there will be a total of Memory -2.
BT5-091.question: Q: If there are 2 of this Tamer in play, when a Level 3 Digimon attacks, does it become Memory -2?

BT5-091.answer: A: No, digivolving Digimon in your breeding area doesn't trigger the effect to ＜Draw 1＞.
BT5-091.question: Q: I digivolve a Digimon in my breeding area. Can I use this Tamer's effect to ＜Draw 1＞?
Q: I digivolve my Red Tamer into a Digimon with the effect of [BT4-011 Agunimon]. Can I suspend this card to ＜Draw 1＞?

BT5-092.answer:
A: No, digivolving Digimon in your breeding area doesn't trigger the effect that reduces digivolution cost by 1.
[1]
BT5-092.question: Q: I digivolve a Digimon in my breeding area into a Digimon card with [Greymon]/[Garurumon]/[Omnimon] in its name. Can I use this Tamer's effect to reduce the digivolution cost by 1?

BT5-092.answer:
A: Yes, each copy of this Tamer may be be suspended to reduce the digivolution cost by 1 each.
[1]
BT5-092.question: Q: Does the second effect of this Tamer stack if there are multiple copies in play in my battle area?

BT5-092.answer:
A: No, [ST5-04 ToyAgumon] is not named [Agumon]/[Gabumon]. The effect to play a Digimon does not have "in its name" in the card text.
[2]
BT5-092.question: Q: Can I play [ToyAgumon]/[Agumon Expert] with this card's [On Play] effect?

BT5-092.answer:
A: This card is meant to have a [Your Turn] effect.
[3]
BT5-092.question: Q: This card's printing in BT-05: Booster Battle Of Omni has [Main] as its effect and its RB-01: Reboot Booster Rising Wind printing uses [Your Turn]. Which version is correct?

BT5-094.question: Q: Can I put a Red Level 4 or less Digimon card from my hand under the digivolution cards of a Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer?

BT5-094.answer:
A: They remain in the digivolution cards. However as it is not a Digimon anymore, the inherited effects do not activate. If that Tamer digivolves into a Digimon again, the inherited effects will activate as per normal.
[1]
BT5-094.question: Q: I put a Digimon card under a Digimon that digivolved from a Tamer. That Digimon then receive the effect of ＜De-Digivolve＞ and becomes a Tamer card. What happens to the digivolution cards below the Tamer?
Q: Can I use this card to place a digivolution card underneath a Token?

BT5-094.answer:
A: Yes, but a card will not be placed as a digivolution cards under the Token.
[2]
BT5-094.question: Q: Can I choose to target a Token with this effect?

BT5-097.question: Q: For this card's effect, can I choose a different Digimon to Return to Hand instead of the Digimon I chose to trash a digivolution card from?

BT5-099.question: Q: When I have 2 Digimon, can I use this card's effect of "1 of your opponent's Digimon gets -3000 DP" twice on the same Digimon to give it -6000 DP?

BT5-101.answer: A: No, in this case you just become unable to trash your opponent's Security Cards and you do not win the game.
BT5-101.question: Q: My opponent has a Level 7 Digimon, and has 0 Security cards. Do I win the game if I use this card?

BT5-103.answer: A: Yes, you can still attack Digimon, and Security Checks from ＜Piercing＞ still happen.
BT5-103.question: Q: After my opponent activate this card's [Security] effect, my Digimon with ＜Piercing＞ attacks and deletes my opponent's Digimon in battle. Does a Security Check happen?

BT5-104.question: Q: My opponent has no Digimon I can target with ＜De-Digivolve  2＞, can I still use this option to play a [Diaboromon Token]?
Q: If I only have a [Diaboromon Token] in my Battle Area, can I use this option to play a new [Diaboromon Token]?

BT5-105.question: Q: My opponent has no Digimon that will be affected ＜De-Digivolve  3＞, can I still use this option to delete all of my opponent's Digimon with Play cost of 3 or less?

BT5-107.answer: A: No, as that Digimon is Played after the you already deleted your Digimon from this card's effect.
BT5-107.question: Q: Using this card's effect, I played a Digimon with effects that says [When your other Digimon are deleted], does that effect activate since I deleted my 1 of my Digimon with this card?

BT5-107.answer: A: Yes, you can. "Then," effects are independent of each other.
BT5-107.question: Q: If I don't have a Digimon to delete can I still play a level 5 or lower Purple Digimon from my trash?

BT5-108.answer: A: Yes, even if your opponent does not have either a Level 4 or Level 5 unsuspended Digimon, the effect still activates. If your opponent has one or the other, you would do as much as you can and delete the Level 4 or Level 5 unsuspended Digimon level that your opponent does have.
BT5-108.question: Q: Does this card's effect activate if my opponent does not have both a Level 4 and a Level 5 unsuspended Digimon?

BT5-109.question: Q: During the turn I used this card, I activate an effect that involves digivolving for a cost. Can I use this card's effect to suspend a Digimon and reduce the digivolution cost?

BT5-109.answer:
A: No, it does not return to the bottom of the deck because Breath of the Gods prevent it from happening.
[2]
BT5-109.question: Q: I activate [BT5-109 Mega Digimon Fusion!] and [BT3-105 Breath of the Gods] on a Digimon with ＜Reboot＞ then digivolve the Digimon with ＜Reboot＞ into a level 7 Digimon, does the level 7 Digimon return to the bottom of the deck at the end of the turn?
Q: If I digivolve on top of a tamer using the effect of [BT7-112 Susanoomon], can I use this card's effect to reduce the memory cost?

BT5-110.question: Q: Does this card's effect also delete all of my Digimon and Tamers?

BT5-111.answer:
A: No, you cannot digivolve your Digimon with [Omnimon] in its name that's in your Breeding Area into this card with its effect.
[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: Can I digivolve my Digimon with [Omnimon] in its name that's in my Breeding Area into this card?

BT5-111.answer:
A: As the attack target is lost, the attack ends without battle.
[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: When I attack an opponent's Digimon, then uses this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect to delete the target of attack, what happens?

BT5-111.answer:
A: No, as you did not delete your opponent's Digimon in battle, the condition for ＜Piercing＞ is not fulfilled.
[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: When this Digimon has ＜Piercing＞ and attacks an opponent's Digimon, then uses this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect to delete the target of attack, does a Securitiy Check from ＜Piercing＞ happen?

BT5-111.answer:
A: Yes, you can. In that scenario, a battle between this Digimon and the blocking Digimon will happen.
[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: My opponent attacks my Digimon with this Digimon, and uses its [When Attacking] effect to delete the target of attack. Can I still activate my other Digimon's ＜Blocker＞ to block that attack?

BT5-111.answer:
A: No, this effect is a [Reaction]/[Counter] effect. So the opponent's [When Attacking] effects will be activated first. (See more in Attack Resolution and Attack Resolution/Old)
[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to end my opponent's Digimon's attack before their [When Attacking] effects activate?

BT5-111.answer:
A: Yes, the [On Deletion] effect activates immediately and before the [Reaction]/[Counter] step. (See more in Attack Resolution and Attack Resolution/Old)
[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: My opponent Digimon activates their [When Attacking] effect to delete another of their Digimon that has [On Deletion] effects, I then use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to end that attack. Do those [On Deletion] effects activate?
Q: When my opponent's Digimon attack, can I activate my [BT1-082 Rosemon]'s effect before activating this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to end that attack?

BT5-111.answer:
A: No, as it is already passed the timing of [When your opponent's Digimon attacks] at this point of time after battle, you cannot activate this effect. (See more in Attack Resolution)
[1]
BT5-111.question: Q: Can I use this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect to end my opponent's Digimon's attack after the DP comparison from battling?

BT5-111.answer: A: No, the attack happens, and any [When Attacking] and [End of Attack] effects still activate.
BT5-111.question: Q: After using this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect. Is it treated as that attack never happened?
Q: If I use this card's effect to trash 2 of this card's Digivolution cards. Can I use [BT2-085 Joe Kido]'s effect?

BT5-111.answer: A: You can still trash the digivolution cards but there is no attack to negate anymore.
BT5-111.question: Q: My opponent attacks with a Digimon and then uses an effect to delete the attacking Digimon before I use the [Opponent's Turn] effect. Can I still use the effect of [BT5-111 Omnimon X-Anti-body] to negate the attack?

BT5-111.answer:
A: You can trash the digivolution cards of the second Omnimon X-Anti-body, but there is no longer an attack to end for the second one.
[3]
BT5-111.question: Q: My opponent attacks with a Digimon. I have 2 [BT5-111 Omnimon X-Anti-body]. Can I use both of their effects to end the attack?

BT5-111.answer:
A: You can suspend your ＜Blocker＞ Digimon but the attack will not be redirected.
[4]
BT5-111.question: Q: My opponent attacks with a Digimon. I have this card and a ＜Blocker＞. Can I use this card's effect first and then suspend the ＜Blocker＞ Digimon?

BT5-111.answer:
A: The [End of Attack] effect will happen first.
[5]
BT5-111.question: Q: If my opponent has a [End of Attack] effect, and I have a ＜Blocker＞ Digimon with this Digimon. If I activate this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect first. What happens first between the [End of Attack] effect and my ＜Blocker＞?

BT5-112.answer: A: When this card is revealed from a Security Check, a battle between this card and the attacking Digimon does not happen, and this card is Played into the Battle Area by this effect. As a battle did not happen, the attacking Digimon is not deleted even if it has lower DP than this card.
BT5-112.question: Q: What does this card's [Security] effect of [Without battling] mean exactly?

BT5-112.answer: A: After this Digimon is played, continue with the remaining checks.
BT5-112.question: Q: What happens when this card is revealed from a Security Check while my opponent's Digimon still has remaining checks from ＜Security Attack +X＞ effect?
Q: Can I delete my opponent's Digimon that digivolved from Tamer with this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

BT5-112.answer: A: No, it will be sent to the trashed.
BT5-112.question: Q: If I am affected by "cannot be played by effects", and this card's [Security] effect does not play it. Does the battle still occur?

BT6-001.answer: A:  Yes, even if the attack is blocked, as long as the attack target was declared to be the player, the effect activates.
BT6-001.question: Q: A Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards attacks the player, and is blocked by the opponent's Digimon. Does this Digimon's effect activate in this case?

BT6-002.answer: A:  No, you cannot. "That Digimon's digivolution cards are trashed" is just an explanation of what happens to the digivolution cards of the Digimon that was returned to hand. It does not count as an effect that trashes digivolution cards.
BT6-002.question: Q: When my opponent's Digimon's digivolution card is trashed due to my effect of "Return 1 of your opponent's Digimon to hand. That Digimon's digivolution cards are trashed", can I use this card's effect?

BT6-002.answer: A: No, you cannot activate the effect of [BT2-085 Joe Kido].
BT6-002.question: Q: I use ＜De-Digivolve＞ while I have this Tamer in play. Can I use the [Your Turn] effect of this card?
Q: My opponent trashes a digivolution card with one of their effects like [BT5-111 Omnimon X] or ＜Digi-Burst＞. Can I use this card's effect?

BT6-004.answer: A:  No, even if the attack is blocked by a Digimon, as long as the attack target was declared to be the player, the effect does not activate.
BT6-004.question: Q: A Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards attacks the player, and is blocked by the opponent's Digimon. Does this Digimon's effect activate in this case?

BT6-004.answer: A: No, this card's effect did not fulfill its trigger condition. See more in Effect Resolution
BT6-004.question: Q: If this card attacks a player and then one of my effects redirects it to an opponent's Digimon. Does this card's effect activate?

BT6-006.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when I activate an effect like "＜Draw 1＞, then trash 1 card from my hand" ?

BT6-007.answer: A:  Yes, both Digimon's effects are activated so you get a total of gain 2 memory.
BT6-007.question: Q: If I have 2 of this Digimon in my Battle Area when I play a [Tai Kamiya], does that mean I get a total of gain 2 memory after activating each of their effects?

BT6-007.answer: A:  No, the turn is only passed after that attack fully resolves.
BT6-007.question: Q: When my Tamer with [Tai Kamiya] in its name, is played by a [Security] effect, this Digimon's effect gives me Gain 1 memory and puts the Memory to 1 on my side, does it become my turn immediately?

BT6-008.answer: A:  No, as long as the Digimon has this card in its digivolution cards, ＜Draw 1＞ activates even if the attack is not via the effect of ＜Blitz＞.
BT6-008.question: Q: For this card's inherited effect, must the attack be via the effect of ＜Blitz＞ in order to ＜Draw 1＞?

BT6-009.question: Q: For this cards' effect, if I reveal 2 of the same card with [Huckmon]/[Jesmon]/[Sistermon] in their name, can I add both of them to my hand?

BT6-011.answer: A:  No, regardless of how many Digimon with [Sistermon] in its name you have in play, you only delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with this effect.
BT6-011.question: Q: If I have 2 Digimon with [Sistermon] in their name in play, do I get to delete 2 of my opponent's Digimon with 5000 DP or lower with this card's effect?

BT6-013.answer: A:  Yes you can, as this Digimon is also treated as a Black Digimon on your turn.
BT6-013.question: Q: Can I digivolve this Digimon into a Digimon with a digivolution requirement of “Black, level 5”?

BT6-013.answer: A:  No, as [Your Turn] effects do not activate in the Breeding Area, this card is not treated as a Black Digimon in your Breeding Area.
BT6-013.question: Q: When this card is in my Breeding Area, can I digivolve it into a Digimon that digivolves from a Black Digimon?

BT6-016.question: Q: When this Digimon attacks and plays a Digimon with [Sistermon] in its name, does that Digimon being played also activate this Digimon's [Your Turn] effect?

BT6-017.answer: A:  Yes, as using the Option Card or not is up to you. As long as no Option Cards were used by this effect, you delete 1 of your opponent's 4000 DP or lower Digimon.
BT6-017.question: Q: When I digivolve into this Digimon, can I intentionally not use a Cost 7 Option Card so that I can delete 1 of my opponent's 4000 DP or lower Digimon?

BT6-017.answer: A:  No, you cannot ignore the colour restriction.
BT6-017.question: Q: When I use a Cost 7 Option Card from this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect, do I ignore the colour restriction?

BT6-018.question: Q: When I use this card's [When Attacking] effect to delete 1 of my opponent's 13000 DP or lower Digimon, does this card's [Your Turn] effect also activate and trash 1 of my opponent's security cards from the top?

BT6-018.answer: A:  Yes, you win the game.
BT6-018.question: Q: When my opponent only has 1 security card left, and this Digimon attacks, and trashes that security card with its [Your Turn] effect, leaving my opponent with 0 security cards, do I win the game if that same attack is not blocked?

BT6-019.answer: A:  Yes, both Digimon's effects are activated so you get a total of gain 2 memory.
BT6-019.question: Q: If I have 2 of this Digimon in my Battle Area when I play a [Matt Ishida], does that mean I get a total of gain 2 memory after activating each of their effects?

BT6-019.answer: A:  No, the turn is only passed after that attack fully resolves.
BT6-019.question: Q: When my Tamer with [Matt Ishida] in its name is played by a [Security] effect, this Digimon's effect gives me gain 1 memory and puts the memory to 1 on my side, does it become my turn immediately?

BT6-020.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when my opponent does not have any Digimon at all in their Battle Area?

BT6-021.answer: A: No, you don't gain any memory from it.
BT6-021.question: Q: My opponent has this card in play. Do I gain memory from [ST2-13 Hammer Spark]'s [Security] effect?

BT6-021.answer: A: Memory gain effects of the cards do not happen, but the memory loss effects are still able to activate. So at the end of the turn, the memory loss of the specified amount will happen. The memory effects above are mandatory.
BT6-021.question: Q: When my opponent has this Digimon on their side, what happens to the "[When Attacking] Gain 3 memory. At the end of the turn, lose 3 memory" effects of [BT1-090 Gravity Crush], [BT1-021 MetalGreymon], [BT1-040 WereGarurumon], and [BT1-058 Chirinmon]?

BT6-021.answer: A: Yes, you can still lose memory from effects even if your opponent cannot gain memory.
BT6-021.question: Q: I have this card in play and use the effect of a card like [BT1-090 Gravity Crush], [BT1-021 MetalGreymon], [BT1-040 WereGarurumon], [BT1-058 Chirinmon], or [BT1-075 Digitamamon]. Does my opponent still gain memory from my card effect?

BT6-021.answer: A: Yes, this card's [Your Turn] effect is no longer active when MaloMyotismon's effect resolves.
BT6-021.question: Q: I have this card in play and my opponent has [BT3-092 MaloMyotismon]. My opponent plays [BT2-077 Kimeramon] and deletes 1 of their Digimon and this card. Does my opponent gain memory with [BT3-092 MaloMyotismon]'s effect?

BT6-021.answer: A: No, that Tamer's inherited effect is treated as a Digimon's effect.
BT6-021.question: Q: If my opponent has a Digimon with [BT7-087 Koji Minamoto] in its digivolution cards. Does my opponent gain memory from that Tamer's effect when I have this card in play?

BT6-024.question: Q: Does this card's effect activate when my opponent does not have any Digimon at all in their Battle Area?

BT6-027.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when my opponent does not have any Digimon at all in their Battle Area?

BT6-028.answer:
A: When your Digimon attack, your opponent cannot redirect the attack when activating ＜Blocker＞.
[1]
BT6-028.question: Q: What does “All of your Digimon cannot be blocked by your opponent's Digimon” mean exactly?
Q: When my opponent's Digimon with this card's inherited effect attacks, even if I cannot block, can I still declare to activate my Digimon's ＜Blocker＞ to suspend it?

BT6-029.answer: A: Yes, it gains ＜Security Attack +1＞ from its effect and updates its security attack value. You re-calculate its security attack and continue checking security based on its new security attack. (For more information see Attack Resolution)
BT6-029.question: Q: If my opponent has no Digimon in play but reveals a [ST8-06 Coredramon] from this card's security check, does this card check another Security card?

BT6-031.answer: A: It ends when the current turn ends.
BT6-031.question: Q: If this card's [On Deletion] effect is activated on my opponent's turn, when does the ＜Security Attack -1＞ end?

BT6-032.answer: A:  Yes, both Digimon's effects are activated so you get to draw a total of 2 cards.
BT6-032.question: Q: If I have 2 Digimon with this card in their digivolution cards in my Battle Area when 1 card is removed from your security stack, do I get a total of 2 cards after activating each of their ＜Draw 1＞ effect?

BT6-033.answer: A:  No, as this card's [On Play] effect says "You may trash", whether you trash cards from the top of your security stack or not is up to you.
BT6-033.question: Q: Must I trash cards from the top of your security stack until there are 3 left from this card's [On Play] effect?

BT6-033.answer: A:  As you cannot trash any security cards, nothing happens.
BT6-033.question: Q: What happens to this card's [On Play] effect when I have 3 or fewer security cards?
Q: When I have 5 security cards, can I choose to only trash 1 security card and gin 1 memory with this card's [On Play] effect?

BT6-034.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate even if a card is removed from my security stack because of my own effects?

BT6-040.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate even if a card is removed from my security stack because of my own effects?

BT6-041.answer: A:  No, as the effect requires you to "trash the top card of your security stack" to activate, if you cannot trash the top card of your security stack, the effect cannot activate.
BT6-041.question: Q: When I have 0 security cards, can I still activate this card's effect?

BT6-044.answer: A:  No, as this card's [When Digivolving] effect says "You may trash", it is up to your choice.
BT6-044.question: Q: When I digivolve into this Digimon, must I trash the top card of my security stack because off this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

BT6-044.answer: A:  No, as the effect requires you to "trash the top card of your security stack" to activate, if you cannot trash security cards, the effect cannot activate.
BT6-044.question: Q: Can this card's [When Digivolving] effect activate when I have 0 security cards?
Q: After using this card's [When Digivolving] effect, my security is then at 3 or less. Does this card's [All Turns] effect then take effect?

BT6-044.answer: A: Yes, as your Security Stack was reduced once, you can. However, in order to ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞ your security must be at 3 or less after the resolution of [BT1-107 Holy Wave]'s effect. (See more in Attack Resolution)
BT6-044.question: Q: When I have this Digimon in my Battle Area, my opponent's Digimon checks [BT1-107 Holy Wave] from my Security, and I gain 1 card from my Security Stack from the [Security] effect. Although the number of Security cards I end up with is the same, can I ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞ with its [All Turns] effect?

BT6-044.answer: A: Yes, as your Security was reduced once, you can. However, in order to ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞ your security must be at 3 or less after the resolution of [BT1-087 T.K. Takaishi]'s effect. (See more in Activation#Activation Conditions)
BT6-044.question: Q: When I have this Digimon in my Battle Area, and I Play [BT1-087 T.K. Takaishi] and activate its [On Play] effect to add a Yellow Card from my Security to Hand, then activate ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞. Although the number of Security cards I end up with is the same, can I ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞ with its [All Turns] effect?
Q: When my Security is reduced by being trashed from effects, like of Digimon like [BT2-020 Gallantmon] etc. instead of from Security Check, does this card's [All Turns] effect still activate?
Q: Can I use this card's [All Turns] effect when I reduce my Security Stack by my own card's effects like [BT4-104 Blinding Ray] etc?

BT6-044.answer: A: Fundamentally, this is possible. However, the effects don’t activate simultaneously, but one at a time in any order. Once one results in you having 4 cards in your security stack, any remaining copies of the effect don’t activate. Any [BT6-044 Dynasmon] whose effects failed to activate can still be activated later in the turn. (They don’t count toward the [Once Per Turn] limit.)
BT6-044.question: Q: I have 2 or more copies of this Digimon in play. My opponent attacks with a Digimon, removing a card from my security stack. Do all of the effects on copies of this Digimon activate simultaneously, activating for each one?

BT6-044.answer: A: No, you cannot. The [Security] effect must be activated before [All Turns]'s effect.
BT6-044.question: Q: I check a card with a [Security] effect. Can I choose to use this card's effect first before the [Security] effect?

BT6-044.answer: A: The [Security] effect activates first. After the [Security] effect and any effects triggered by its activation have finished activating, this card’s [All Turns] effect activates.
BT6-044.question: Q: When I have this Digimon in my Battle Area, my opponent’s Digimon performs a security check, flipping over a card with a [Security] effect. Which activates first: This card’s [All Turns] effect, or the [Security] effect?

BT6-047.answer: A:  No, if only either 1 of them are revealed, you can add just that to your hand.
BT6-047.question: Q: For this card's effect, must both 1 [Menoa Bellucci] Tamer card and 1 Digimon card with [Eosmon] in its name be revealed among the 5 cards to be able to add them to my hand?

BT6-049.answer: A: No, the Tamer card's [Security] effect does not become an inherited effect.
BT6-049.question: Q: When this card has a Tamer card as a digivolution card, does that Tamer Card's [Security] effect become this card’s inherited effect?
Q: Can this card digivolve from aLV3 Digimon if the requirements are fulfilled instead of a Tamer Card?

BT6-049.answer: A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies Digimon cards, Digi-Egg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a tamer card, it can't be targeted by that effect.
BT6-049.question: Q: If I use this card's effect to make a tamer card into a digivolution card, is that card affected by effects that say "trash digivolution cards"?

BT6-049.answer: A: Yes, you draw a card from the digivolution Bonus even when digivolving from a Tamer.
BT6-049.question: Q: When I digivolve a Tamer card into this card, do I draw a card from the digivolution bonus?

BT6-049.answer: A: Yes, as digivolving is not Playing, it can attack.

BT6-111.answer: A: No, you cannot. As the timing for [When Attacking] effects to trigger has already passed. (From Card Rulings:EX1-040)
BT6-111.question: Q: My [BT8-066 Hisyaryumon] attacks, and digivolves into [BT6-111 Alphamon] via it's own effect. Can I use [BT6-111 Alphamon]'s [When Attacking] effect?

BT6-112.answer:
A:  No, you cannot ignore the colour restriction.
[1]
BT6-112.question: Q: When I use a Cost 7 Option Card from this Digimon's [On Play] effect, do I ignore the colour restriction?

BT6-112.answer:
A: No. The cards in your hand count as private information, so you don’t have to reveal whether you have an Option card you can use in your hand. As such, you can choose not to use an Option card regardless of whether you have one you can use in your hand. (For example, after using this card’s [On Play] effect to return a 7-cost Option card from your trash to your hand.)
[1]
BT6-112.question: Q: Does this card’s [On Play] effect force me to use an Option card?

BT6-112.answer:
A: No, you can use a different card.
[1]
BT6-112.question: Q: I use this card’s [On Play] effect to return an Option card from my trash to my hand. Do I have to use that card with this card’s effect?
Q: If I have 1 memory and only 1 [Three Musketeers] card in my trash. Can I play this card from my hand?

BT6-112.answer:
A: No, you can not. These option cards "change the cost to pay" when they are used, but the card's cost itself has not changed, so they cannot be used with this card's effect. However, [BT2-099 Glorious Burst] has an effect that changes the cost of the card when it is in your hand, so if you have two yellow Tamers in the Battle Area, its cost is 7 and it can be used with this Digimon's [On Play] effect.
[3]
BT6-112.question: Q: When I use a 7-cost Option Card for this Digimon's [On Play] effect, can I use an option card that changes its cost depending on a condition, such as [BT7-100 Qualialise Blast] or [BT11-108 DG Dimension]?

BT7-005.answer: A: No. Even if multiple cards are added to the Digimon’s digivolution cards, if they were added by a single effect, you only draw 1 card.
BT7-005.question: Q: If one of my effects places 2 or more cards at the same time under a Digimon that has this card's inherited effect, can I draw that many cards?

BT7-006.answer: A: Yes. You can choose whether or not to reveal cards from your deck, but if any Tamer cards are revealed among the cards, you must trash 1 of them.
BT7-006.question: Q: If there are Tamer cards among the cards revealed with this card's inherited effect, do I have to trash 1 of them?

BT7-011.question: Q: When this Digimon digivolves onto a Tamer card, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 3 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?

BT7-011.answer: A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies that it trashes Digimon cards, DigiEgg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't affect Tamer cards.
BT7-011.question: Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?

BT7-011.answer: A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.
BT7-011.question: Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?

BT7-011.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn
BT7-011.question: Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?

BT7-011.answer: A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.
BT7-011.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?

BT7-011.answer: A: No. This card's Japanese name (ヴリトラモン) does not have "Greymon" (グレイモン) in its name.
BT7-011.question: Q: Does this card have [Greymon] in its name?

BT7-011.answer: A: No, this card's effect treats the tamer as a pure Red Digimon, so it is not counted as green.
BT7-011.question: Q: If I digivolve my dual-coloured Red-Green Tamer into this card, can I use the effect of [BT3-103 Hidden Potential Discovered!]?

BT7-013.answer: A: No. If you play this card with no Tamers in play, you only get to play 1 red Tamer card from your hand.
BT7-013.question: Q: If I play this card while I have no Tamers in play, and play a red Tamer from my hand with this card's effect, do I then also gain 2 memory from this effect since I now have a Tamer in play?

BT7-013.answer: A: No. Even if multiple Digimon are deleted, if they were deleted by a single effect, you only gain 1 memory.
BT7-013.question: Q: If I delete 2 or more of my opponent’s Digimon at the same time, does this card’s inherited effect allow me to gain 1 memory for each Digimon deleted?

BT7-014.answer: A: Yes. All [Security] effects on non-Option cards activate normally.
BT7-014.question: Q: When a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards performs a security check, if the checked card is a Digimon card or a Tamer card, does its [Security] effect activate?

BT7-015.answer: A: No, its play cost is reduced by the total number of Option cards in both you and your opponent's trashes.
BT7-015.question: Q: Is this card’s play cost reduced by 1 for each Option card in ONLY my trash or my opponent’s trash?

BT7-015.answer: A: This card's owner decides the order the cards are returned to the bottom of the deck.
BT7-015.question: Q: I use this card’s [On Play] effect to return cards from both players’ trashes to the bottom of their owners’ decks. Who decides which order the cards are placed in?

BT7-016.answer:
A: Immediately after the attack target is changed by a block. Since the effect of this Digimon is triggered by blocking the opponent, it will be activated before the battle with the blocked Digimon.
[1]
BT7-016.question: Q: I attack with this Digimon, and it is blocked by an opponent's Digimon at the block timing. When does this card's [Your Turn] effect activating?

BT7-016.answer:
A: This card's effect activates first. The [Your Turn] effect is triggered by your opponent activating ＜Blocker＞ to block this Digimon's attack. Because ＜Blocker＞ is a reaction timing effect, that means the [Your Turn] effect is triggered after reaction timing effects have been triggered. According to the rules, effects that were triggered later have activation priority, so the [Your Turn] effect activates first.
[2]
BT7-016.question: Q: I attack with this Digimon, and it is blocked by an opponent's Digimon at the reaction timing. My opponent has another "when an opponent's Digimon attacks" effect that is still pending activation. Does that effect activate before this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT7-017.question: Q: Can I place 1 red or black level 5 card with the [Cyborg] trait in its traits from my hand or trash on top of this Digimon's digivolution cards with this card's [When Digivolving] effect even if my opponent has no Digimon with 6000 DP or less in play?
Q: If I use an effect to digivolve my Digimon in the Battle Area, can I use it to digivolve my [Machinedramon] into this card?

BT7-018.answer: A: No. Having this card become a Digimon as a result of ＜De-Digivolve＞ doesn’t count as playing it, so you can’t draw any cards.
