BT7-027.answer: A: No. It enters play as a new Digimon, unsuspended. Additionally, it does not carry over any effects on the source Digimon.
BT7-027.question: Q: This card's [On Play] effect plays a level 3 Digimon card from the digivolution cards of a suspended Digimon. Does the level 3 Digimon enter play suspended?

BT7-028.answer: A: No. Having a digivolution card become a Digimon as a result of ＜De-Digivolve＞ does not count as playing that card, so this card's [Your Turn] effect does not trigger.
BT7-028.question: Q: One of my Digimon with digivolution cards is targeted by my opponent’s ＜De-Digivolve＞, resulting in it becoming one of the Digimon in its digivolution cards. When this happens, can I return 1 of my opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon to its owner's hand with this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT7-029.answer: A: It means the effect can be activated both [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking]. You can activate it as a [When Digivolving] effect when you digivolve this Digimon, then activate it again on following turns as a [When Attacking] effect by attacking with this Digimon.
BT7-029.question: Q: This card has an effect that activates at both [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking] timings. What does this mean, exactly?

BT7-029.answer: A: No. No matter which timing the effect is triggered at, it is still the same effect and can only be activated [Once Per Turn]. If the effect has been triggered at [When Digivolving] and activated, it can not be activated again on the same turn, even if it's triggered [When Attacking].
BT7-029.question: Q: This card has a [When Digivolving][When Attacking][Once Per Turn] effect, but can I activate it twice in the same turn by both digivolving and attacking?
Q: Will this card's [Your Turn] effect activate when my Digimon is returned to my hand?
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate when a card effect allows you to draw and trash card from your hand?

BT7-029.answer: A: No, it is not treated as drawing from an effect.
BT7-029.question: Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate if my card effect performs a digivolution and draws from its digivolution bonus?

BT7-031.answer: A: Return this card to its owner’s hand after ＜Digi-Burst＞ activates.
BT7-031.question: Q: I trash this card from a Digimon's digivolution cards to activate ＜Digi-Burst＞. Do I return this card to its owner's hand before or after the ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect activates?

BT7-039.question: Q: I use ＜Digi-Burst＞ to trash this card from a Digimon’s digivolution cards. Which activates first: This card’s inherited effect, or the effect that activates when you trash this card with ＜Digi-Burst＞?

BT7-040.answer: A: The digivolution cost is equal to the number of cards in your security stack minus the amount reduced by the effect. If you have 4 security cards and activate an effect that reduces digivolution costs by 2, the final digivolution cost will be 2. (4 minus 2.)
BT7-040.question: Q: When digivolving into this card from my hand, I activate an effect on another card that reduces digivolution costs. What happens to this card’s digivolution cost?

BT7-040.answer: A: Yes, you can. This card's ＜Digi-Burst up to 4＞ allows you to choose any number of digivolution cards to trash, from 1 to 4. If you have 3 or fewer digivolution cards, you can activate the effect as long as you can trash 1 or more of them.
BT7-040.question: Q: This card’s ＜Digi-Burst up to＞ reads “up to 4.” Can I activate the effect if I have 3 or fewer digivolution cards?

BT7-040.answer: A: No, this effect can only target 1 of your opponent's Digimon.
BT7-040.question: Q: I trash 2 digivolution cards to activate this card's ＜Digi-Burst up to＞. Can I have 2 of my opponent's Digimon both get -3000 DP?

BT7-040.answer: A: Yes, this card's effect sets the digivolution cost. It does not reduce.
BT7-040.question: Q: Can I digivolve into this card for 4 cost or less even if my opponent has [BT5-021 Syakomon]?

BT7-041.answer: A: No. If you digivolve into this card while at 2 or fewer security cards, you only go up to 3 security cards with ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞.

BT7-049.question: Q: I digivolve into a green level 6 Digimon with this card's [When Attacking] effect. Can I activate that Digimon’s [When Attacking] effects?

BT7-049.answer: A: Yes, the effect is mandatory. You reveal as many cards as you can, up to 3.
BT7-049.question: Q: When attacking, do I have to reveal 3 cards from my deck with this card’s [When Attacking] effect?

BT7-049.answer: A: No. The effect reads, “You may digivolve,” so you can choose not to.
BT7-049.question: Q: If a green level 6 Digimon card is among the cards revealed with this card’s [When Attacking] effect, do I have to digivolve into it?

BT7-049.answer: A: Yes, you can digivolve into the Digimon of your choosing.
BT7-049.question: Q: If 2 or more green level 6 Digimon cards are among the cards revealed with this card’s [When Attacking] effect, can I choose either card to digivolve into?

BT7-051.question: Q: I have a card with the [Hybrid]/[Insectoid] trait in this Digimon's digivolution cards. Does this card’s [When Attacking] effect force me to digivolve this Digimon into a Digimon card with the [Insectoid]/[Ten Warriors] trait in my hand?

BT7-051.answer: A: The attack continues. The turn doesn’t switch over just yet. If the memory gauge is still at 1 or more on your opponent’s side after the attack ends and any effects triggered by it finish activating, only then does the turn switch over.
BT7-051.question: Q: When digivolving with this card's [When Attacking] effect, paying the digivolution cost moves the memory gauge to 1 or more on my opponent’s side. What happens to the attack?

BT7-051.answer: A: No, it is too late to trigger this card's [When Attacking] effect, since the Digimon didn't have it when the attack was declared.
BT7-051.question: Q: I attack with [EX1-035 Kabuterimon] and digivolve into this card with its [When Attacking] effect. Can I then digivolve again on the same attack with this card's [When Attacking] effect?

BT7-051.answer: A: No, you can’t ignore its digivolution requirements.
BT7-051.question: Q: When digivolving into a Digimon card in my hand with the [Insectoid]/[Ten Warriors] trait in its traits with this card's [When Attacking] effect, can I ignore that card's digivolution requirements?

BT7-051.answer: A: Yes, you can reduce the digivolution cost of 3 with another effect.
BT7-051.question: Q: If I am using this card's [When Attacking] effect to digivolve, can I reduce its digivolution cost of that effect?

BT7-053.question: Q: Using this card's [When Digivolving] effect, can I prevent my opponent's Digimon from becoming unsuspended during my opponent's next unsuspend phase by applying this effect to it while it's suspended?

BT7-055.answer: A: No. Your opponent must trash 1 card in their hand for each Digimon they unsuspend.
BT7-055.question: Q: My opponent unsuspends 2 or more of their Digimon. Does this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect allow my opponent to unsuspend all of their Digimon by trashing 1 card in their hand?

BT7-055.answer: A: Yes. If anything causes an opponent’s Digimon to unsuspend, whether it’s an effect or your opponent’s unsuspend phase, your opponent must trash a card in their hand to unsuspend it.
BT7-055.question: Q: If an effect causes an opponent’s Digimon to unsuspend, does this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect force my opponent to trash a card in their hand?

BT7-055.answer: A: No, you can choose which of your Digimon to unsuspend, and trash a card in your hand for each one. Digimon will not unsuspend unless you choose to trash a card in your hand, so even if you have fewer cards in hand than suspended Digimon in play, you can still choose to unsuspend specific Digimon.
BT7-055.question: Q: My opponent has this Digimon in play. If I have 3 suspended Digimon in play, do I need to have 3 or more cards in hand during my unsuspend phase in order to unsuspend my Digimon?

BT7-055.answer: A: No. This effect only affects Digimon. Your opponent can unsuspend their Tamers normally, without trashing cards in their hand.
BT7-055.question: Q: Does this card’s [Opponent's Turn] effect require my opponent to trash cards in their hand to also unsuspend their Tamer cards?

BT7-055.answer: A: Yes. Your opponent’s Digimon now have two copies of “[Your Turn] You must trash 1 card in your hand to unsuspend this Digimon” on them, which means they have to trash 2 cards in their hand to unsuspend 1 of their Digimon.
BT7-055.question: Q: I have two of these Digimon in play. Does my opponent have to trash 2 cards in their hand for each Digimon they want to unsuspend?

BT7-055.answer: A: No, it is not mandatory. You can choose not to trash a card, but the Digimon will remain suspended.
BT7-055.question: Q: If it would be mandatory to unsuspend a Digimon, is it mandatory to trash a card from your hand?

BT7-055.answer: A: It will only activate after all Digimon affected by this card's [Your Turn] effect have unsuspended. So your opponent trashes all of their cards first before unsuspending all the Digimon that were not prevented from unsuspending, only after the Digimon have unsuspended will the "when this card is trashed from your hand" effects activate. (For more information see Effect Resolution)
BT7-055.question: Q: If my opponent trashes a card with the effect of "when this card is trashed from your hand by one of your effects" for the [Your Turn] effect of this card, when does it activate during the unsuspend phase?

BT7-055.answer: A: It will only trigger after the effect has fully resolved along with other effects triggered by the currently resolving effect. (For more information see Effect Resolution)
BT7-055.question: Q: If my opponent is unsuspending by an effect and I have this card in play. My opponent trashes a card with "when this card is trashed from hand" for the [Your Turn] effect of this card. When does that effect activate?

BT7-055.answer: A: After your opponent finishes trashing cards from their hand for each Digimon they want to unsuspend, all of their Digimon, Tamers, and your Digimon with ＜Reboot＞ will be unsuspended at the same time.
BT7-055.question: Q: If I also have a Digimon with ＜Reboot＞ and my opponent has suspended Tamers, what order does every card unsuspend during the Unsuspend Phase?

BT7-056.answer: A: Yes. Even if you revealed only a card with the [X Antibody] trait in its traits or [Kota Domoto], you still add that card to your hand.
BT7-056.question: Q: I reveal 3 cards with this card's [On Play]

BT7-056.answer: A: No. When a Digimon digivolves, even if it happens due to an effect, it is not counted as an effect placing digivolution cards under that Digimon.
BT7-056.question: Q: When one of my effects digivolves a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, does this card’s inherited effect activate?

BT7-056.answer: A: No. Even if multiple cards are added to the Digimon’s digivolution cards, you only gain 1 memory.
BT7-056.question: Q: If one of my effects places 2 or more cards at the same time under a Digimon that has this card's inherited effect, do I gain that much memory?
Q: When this card is placed in one of my Digimon’s digivolution cards, does this card’s inherited effect activate?

BT7-058.answer: A: Yes, you can choose a [DeadlyAxemon] with no digivolution cards with this effect.
BT7-058.question: Q: Can this card's [When Attacking] effect place one of my [DeadlyAxemon] with no digivolution cards at the bottom of this Digimon’s digivolution cards?

BT7-058.answer: A: No, this card's effect to trash digivolution cards is considered reminder text, so it does not trigger.
BT7-058.question: Q: If I activate this card's effect to trash a digivolution card from my [DeadlyAxemon]. Does this trigger the effect of my opponent's [BT8-029 Frozomon]?

BT7-060.question: Q: When this Digimon digivolves onto a Tamer card, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 3 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?

BT7-060.answer: A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies that it trashes Digimon cards, DigiEgg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't affect Tamer cards.
BT7-060.question: Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?

BT7-060.answer: A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve using a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.
BT7-060.question: Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?

BT7-060.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn
BT7-060.question: Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?

BT7-060.answer: A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.
BT7-060.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with that Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?

BT7-060.answer: A: No, this card's effect treats the tamer as a pure Black Digimon, so it is not counted as green.

BT7-063.answer: A: Yes. You don't have to place both a [SkullKnightmon] and a [DeadlyAxemon]. You can also place either of them on their own from either your hand or trash in this Digimon's digivolution cards. However, if both are in your trash, you must place them into its digivolution cards.
BT7-063.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect place cards in this Digimon's digivolution cards if I don’t have both a [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] in either my hand or trash?

BT7-063.answer: A: Yes, if you have both cards you must play both. Otherwise, play as much as you can.

BT7-063.answer: A: This card's [All Turns] effect triggers at the same time as ＜Decoy＞  (When your other nocategory Digimon would be deleted by an opponent's effect, you may delete this Digimon to prevent you may delete this Digimon to prevent 1 of those Digimon's deletion). So it activates before the Digimon has been deleted. Its effect does not prevent its own deletion but you can use ＜Decoy＞  (When your other nocategory Digimon would be deleted by an opponent's effect, you may delete this Digimon to prevent you may delete this Digimon to prevent 1 of those Digimon's deletion) and this card's effect to protect it from deletion.
BT7-063.question: Q: When does this card's [All Turns] effect activate?

BT7-063.answer: A: No, the Digimon that were played are not deleted.
BT7-063.question: Q: My opponent plays [BT6-105 Geralt Schwärmer] and I use this card's effect to play [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] from its digivolution cards. Do those Digimon also get deleted?

BT7-063.answer: A: No, it does not trigger as it was not about to be deleted.
BT7-063.question: Q: If my Digimon has already an effect applied that says it "can't be deleted", does this card's [All Turns] still trigger?

BT7-064.answer: A: No. This card's Japanese name (ドルグレモン) does not have "Greymon" (グレイモン) in its name.
BT7-064.question: Q: Does this card have [Greymon] in its name?

BT7-070.answer: A: Yes. The effect reads, “You may,” so you can choose not to activate it. However, after revealing a card from your deck, you must perform the rest of the effect to the best of your ability.

BT7-109.question: Q: I have 10 or more cards in my trash. Can I use this card's effect to play a purple level 5 Digimon card?
Q: If I have 10 or more cards in my trash, can I play a Yellow Digimon card with [Lucemon] in its name?

BT7-109.answer: A: No, you cannot. It must be played from the trash.
BT7-109.question: Q: If I have 10 or more cards in my trash, can I play a Digimon card with [Lucemon] in its name from my hand?

BT7-110.answer: A: If you have a Digimon with the [Hybrid] trait in your battle area, you can use this Option card even if you don’t have a white Digimon or Tamer in play.
BT7-110.question: Q: "If you have a Digimon card with the [Hybrid] trait in play, you may use this Option card without meeting its colour requirement" how does this effect work, exactly?

BT7-111.answer:
A: It means the effect can be activated both [On Play] and [When Digivolving].
[1]
BT7-111.question: Q: This card has an effect that has both [On Play] and [When Digivolving] timings. What does this mean, exactly?
Q: If I use an effect to digivolve my Digimon in the Battle Area, can I use it to digivolve my [Lucemon] into this card?

BT7-112.answer:
A: This card’s digivolution requirement icon refers to all colors. Currently, this Digimon can digivolve onto a level 6 Digimon that’s red, blue, yellow, green, black, purple, or white.
[1]
BT7-112.question: Q: What color cards does this card’s digivolution requirement icon refer to?

BT7-112.answer:
A: No, you can mix and match cards from your hand and trash. As long as you return a total of 10 cards to the bottom of your deck, you can activate the effect.
[1]
BT7-112.question: Q: This card’s effect reads, "10 Tamer cards and/or cards with the [Hybrid] trait in their traits from your hand and/or trash," but does this mean I can only activate the effect by returning 10 cards in my hand or 10 cards in my trash?
Q: When this card adds a Tamer card to its digivolution cards, does the Tamer card’s [Security] effect become an inherited effect?
Q: Instead of a Tamer card, can I digivolve this card onto a level 6 Digimon that meets the digivolution requirements?

BT7-112.answer:
A: Yes, it is. However, if the effect specifies that it trashes Digimon cards, DigiEgg cards, or any other type of card that isn't a Tamer card, it can't affect Tamer cards.
[1]
BT7-112.question: Q: After a Tamer card ends up in this Digimon's digivolution cards, is that card affected by effects that trash digivolution cards?

BT7-112.answer:
A: Yes, you do. Even if you digivolve onto a Tamer card, make sure to draw 1 card as the digivolution bonus.
[1]
BT7-112.question: Q: If I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card, do I still get the digivolution bonus?

BT7-112.answer: A: Yes. Digivolution doesn't count as “playing” a card, so you can attack that turn.
BT7-112.question: Q: Can I attack the turn I digivolve this card on top of a Tamer card?

BT7-112.answer:
A: No. Since it's the first turn the Tamer was played, the limitation for attacking on the first turn a card is played still applies.
[1]
BT7-112.question: Q: I play a Tamer card, then digivolve it into this Digimon. Can I then attack with this Digimon during that same turn?
Q: If I've digivolved this card on top of a Tamer card and the Digimon is deleted, what happens to the Tamer card?

BT7-112.answer:
A: No, you must reveal this card from your hand in advance. You must perform the "placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with the [Hybrid] trait from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck" part of the effect before the digivolution takes place, so you must reveal the card from your hand first. If it is revealed, it is no longer treated as being in your hand.
[1]
BT7-112.question: Q: Can I activate this card's "placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with the [Hybrid] trait from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck" effect while this card is still in my hand?

BT7-112.answer:
A: Yes, you can. In this case, you can’t digivolve even after performing the actions described by the effect. After revealing this card, it is trashed. Note that the game will not view this as you trashing a card in your hand.
[1]
BT7-112.question: Q: Can I activate this card’s "placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with the [Hybrid] trait from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck" effect when I have no Tamers in play?
Q: Can I digivolve this card from a Tamer by activating an effect other than this card's effect?

BT7-112.answer:
A: Yes, this card's effect is "By doing <X>, you may <Y>", but if you do, this card will be trashed. You must have 10 cards in your trash and/or hand to reveal this card, but you can also do this without a Tamer in the battle area.The procedure is:
Reveal the Susanoomon to the opponent,
Place 10 cards on the bottom of your deck in any order,
Trash the Susanoomon.
[3]
BT7-112.question: Q: Can I activate this card’s "placing 10 Tamer cards and/or cards with the [Hybrid] trait from your hand and/or trash at the bottom of your deck" effect but choose not to digivolve this card?

BT7-112.answer:
A: The colour of the tamer does not change because colour is not mentioned in this card's text.
[1]
BT7-112.question: Q: What colour is the Tamer treated as, when digivolving into this Digimon?

BT8-002.question: Q: Does this card's effect activate if my opponent does not have a single Digimon in their battle area?

BT8-003.answer: A: No, this effect gives +1000 DP even if you have 6 security cards.
BT8-003.question: Q: If I have 6 security cards, does this card's effect give +2000 DP?

BT8-005.question: Q: When this card itself is added to my Digimon's digivolution cards, does this card's inherited effect activate?

BT8-006.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate even if cards are trashed from my deck by my own effects?

BT8-006.answer: A: No, cards that revealed from deck then trashed are not treated as "trashed from deck".
BT8-006.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when an effect reveals cards from my deck and "trash any remaining cards"?

BT8-009.question: Q: Can I add an option card with 2 colours that includes red to my hand with this card's effect?
Q: Can I add a card with an effect that says "This colour of this Digimon is also treated as red" to my hand with this card's effect?

BT8-010.answer: A: No, even if you have 2 yellow Digimon in play, this effect only reduces its play cost by 1.
BT8-010.question: Q: Does this card's effect reduce its play cost by 2 if I have 2 yellow Digimon in play?

BT8-012.answer: A: As the effect has already been activated, the +3000 DP effect will continue "for the turn".
BT8-012.question: Q: After this card gets +3000 DP from its [When Attacking] effect, if I activate ＜Armor Purge＞ to trash this card. What happens to the +3000 DP?

BT8-012.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-021 Flamedramon] can digivolve from [Veemon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area.
BT8-012.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 2 from [Veemon]>", written in the text for [BT8-021 Flamedramon], as an effect? Can [BT8-021 Flamedramon] digivolve from [Veemon] in the breeding area?

BT8-016.question: Q: Does this card count itself as a Digimon with [Tyrannomon] in its name for this card's effect to gain ＜Security Attack +1＞?

BT8-019.answer: A: Other than this Digimon and 1 of your opponent's Digimon that was chosen, delete all of you and your opponent's Digimon, and gain 1 memory for each Digimon that was deleted by this effect.
BT8-019.question: Q: What does this card's [When Digivolving] effect do exactly?

BT8-019.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding area cannot be a target of any effects, so they are not deleted.
BT8-019.question: Q: Does this card's [When Digivolving] effect also delete Digimon in breeding area?

BT8-019.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding area cannot be a target of any effects, so they cannot be chosen. Also, regardless of the choice, this effect does not delete Digimon in breeding area.
BT8-019.question: Q: Can my opponent choose the Digimon in their breeding area for this card's [When Digivolving] effect?

BT8-019.answer: A: Delete all of your Digimon except this Digimon, then gain 1 memory for each Digimon deleted.
BT8-019.question: Q: What happens to this card's [When Digivolving] effect if my opponent does not have a single Digimon in their battle area?

Q: When Digimon would be deleted by this effect, can my opponent activate ＜Decoy＞  (When your other nocategory Digimon would be deleted by an opponent's effect, you may delete this Digimon to prevent you may delete this Digimon to prevent 1 of those Digimon's deletion) or ＜Armor Purge＞ etc, to stop their Digimon that was not chosen, from being deleted?

BT8-020.answer: A: At the end of your turn, the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards, and 1 of your other Digimon, can DNA digivolve into a Digimon in your hand that can DNA digivolve, before the turn is passed to your opponent.
BT8-020.question: Q: What kind of effect is this card's inherited effect?

BT8-020.answer: A: No, as digivolution requirements cannot be ignored. You cannot DNA digivolve into a Digimon card without a DNA digovolution effect.
BT8-020.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to DNA digivolve into a Digimon card in my hand that does not have a DNA digivolve effect?

BT8-020.answer: A: No, as digivolution requirements cannot be ignored. You cannot DNA digivolve your Digimon that is not the correct colour or level  specified by the card with DNA digivolve.
BT8-020.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to DNA digivolve my Digimon in play that is not the colour and level specified by the card with DNA digivolve in my hand?

BT8-020.answer: A: No, the Digimon from DNA Digivolve is treated as a new Digimon so the old DIgimon is no longer in the battle area.
BT8-020.question: Q: This card's [End of Your Turn] effect has triggered, and the Digimon it is underneath is used as part of a DNA Digivolve. Can I still activate this effect?

BT8-021.question: Q: Can I add an option card with 2 colours that includes blue to my hand with this card's effect?
Q: Can I add a card with an effect that says "This colour of this Digimon is also treated as blue" to my hand with this card's effect?.

BT8-023.answer: A: No, even if you couldn't trash any digivolution card of your opponent's Digimon, the effect "1 of your opponent's Digimon without digivolution cards gets -3000 DP" will still activate.
BT8-023.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, if my opponent has no Digimon with digivolution cards, thus no digivolution card can be trashed, does that mean the part of "1 of your opponent's Digimon without digivolution cards gets -3000 DP" cannot activate?

BT8-023.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-023 Submarimon] can digivolve from [Armadillomon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area. (From Card Rulings:BT8-012)
BT8-023.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 2 from [Armadillomon]>", written in the text for [BT8-023 Submarimon], as an effect? Can [BT8-023 Submarimon] digivolve from [Armadillomon] in the breeding area?

BT8-024.answer:
A: "When this Digimon would digivolve" is after declaring a digivolution, but before paying the digivolution cost.
[1]
BT8-024.question: Q: When exactly is the timing to activate this card's [Your Turn] effect of ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞?
Q: Does this card's [Your Turn] effect activate even when DNA digivolving?
Q: If my security is 3 or less, and my opponent's [EX3-016 SnowAgumon] and [EX3-019 Paledramon] cause the digivolution to fail. Will this card still ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞?

BT8-026.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-026 Halsemon] can digivolve from [Hawkmon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area. (From Card Rulings:BT8-012)
BT8-026.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 2 from [Hawkmon]>", written in the text for [BT8-026 Halsemon], as an effect? Can [BT8-026 Halsemon] digivolve from [Hawkmon] in the breeding area?

BT8-028.answer: A: No, digivolving a Digimon is not playing it, so it does not activate.
BT8-028.question: Q: Does this card's effect activate if my opponent's Digimon digivolves into level 5 or above?

BT8-028.answer: A: No, moving a Digimon from breeding area is not playing it, so it does not activate.
BT8-028.question: Q: Does this card's effect activate when my opponent moves a level 5 or above Digimon from breeding area to battle area?

BT8-029.answer: A: No, Digimon in breeding area are not referenced for effects, so it can attack.
BT8-029.question: Q: When my opponent has a Digimon with digivolution cards in their breeding area, does that mean this Digimon cannot attack?
Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when my opponent activates ＜Digi-Burst＞?

BT8-032.question: Q: Do both of this card's [When Attacking] effects activate if it has both blue and green cards its digivolution cards?
Q: Do both of this card's [When Attacking] effects activate if it only has 1 two-coloured card that is both blue and green its digivolution cards?

BT8-032.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-032 Imperialdramon Fighter Mode] can digivolve from a Digimon [Dragon Mode] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area. (From Card Rulings:BT8-012)
BT8-032.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 2 if name contains [Dragon Mode]>", written in the text for [BT8-032 Imperialdramon Fighter Mode], as an effect? Can [BT8-032 Imperialdramon Fighter Mode] digivolve a Digimon whose name contains [Dragon Mode] in the breeding area?

BT8-033.question: Q: Can I add an option card with 2 colours that includes yellow to my hand with this card's effect?
Q: Can I add a card with an effect that says "This colour of this Digimon is also treated as yellow" to my hand with this card's effect?

BT8-036.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when the Digimon itself that has this card in its digivolution card is a blue Digimon?

BT8-038.answer: A: As the effect has already been activated, the instances of +2000 DP will persist "until the end of your opponent's next turn".
BT8-038.question: Q: After this card gets +2000 DP for each Digimon card with the [Armor Form] trait in my trash from its [When Digivolving] effect, if I activate ＜Armor Purge＞ to trash this card, what happens to the instances of +2000 DP?

BT8-038.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-038 Magnamon] can digivolve from [Veemon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area. (From Card Rulings:BT8-012)
BT8-038.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 3 from [Veemon]>", written in the text for [BT8-038 Magnamon], as an effect? Can [BT8-038 Magnamon] digivolve from [Veemon] in the breeding area?

BT8-039.answer: A: No, regardless of how many tamers you have in play, only up to 3 Digimon get -5000 DP .
BT8-039.question: Q: Does this card's [When Digivolving] effect give up to 6 of my opponent's Digimon -5000 DP if I have 2 tamers in play?

BT8-039.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-039 Rapidmon] can digivolve from [Terriermon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area. (From Card Rulings:BT8-012)
BT8-039.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 3 from [Terriermon]>", written in the text for [BT8-039 Rapidmon], as an effect? Can [BT8-039 Rapidmon] digivolve from [Terriermon] in the breeding area?

BT8-040.answer:
A: Yes, it counts as having 2 colours, so you draw 2.
[1]
BT8-040.question: Q: If I trash a red card for this card's effect, does this Digimon then count as having 2 colours of yellow & red, letting me draw 2 cards?

BT8-040.answer:
A: Yes, it is counted as a 3-coloured Digimon.
[1]
BT8-040.question: Q: If I trash a blue/green 2-coloured card for this card's effect, does this Digimon then count as having 3 colours of yellow, blue, & green?
Q: If this card activated its [When Digivolving] effect and then is ＜De-Digivolve＞ into a Tamer card. Does the Tamer also get treated as the colour of the trashed card?

BT8-043.answer: A: Yes, this [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect is activated as many times as the number of your tamers in play, so you can choose different targets for each activation.
BT8-043.question: Q: For this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect, when I have multiple tamers in play, can I choose that many separate Digimon to give ＜Security Attack -2＞?

BT8-043.answer: A: No, they are treated to be activated at the same time.
BT8-043.question: Q: When this card's [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect activates 2 or more times, are they considered to be activated in separate different timings?

BT8-044.answer: A: No, it cannot. This card's [Your Turn] effect is an effect that unsuspends your other Digimon when they digivolve.
BT8-044.question: Q: When my suspended digimon digivolves into this Digimon, can its [Your Turn] effect unsuspend this Digimon?

BT8-048.answer: A: No, at the point of time when this card's [When Digivolving] effect activates, if a Digimon was a valid target for having ＜Blocker＞, this card's effect will still continue and that Digimon cannot attack and block even if it loses its ＜Blocker＞ afterwards.
BT8-048.question: Q: When a Digimon that was targeted by this card's [When Digivolving] effect loses ＜Blocker＞ due to digivolving, DNA digivolving, or losing digivolution cards, does that Digimon then become able to attack and block?

BT8-048.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-048 Shurimon] can digivolve from [Hawkmon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area. (From Card Rulings:BT8-012)
BT8-048.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 2 from [Hawkmon]>", written in the text for [BT8-048 Shurimon], as an effect? Can [BT8-048 Shurimon] digivolve from [Hawkmon] in the breeding area?

BT8-050.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, can it suspend itself to suspend 1 of my opponent's Digimon?

BT8-051.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-051 Digmon] can digivolve from [Armadillomon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area. (From Card Rulings:BT8-012)
BT8-051.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 2 from [Armadillomon]>", written in the text for [BT8-051 Digmon], as an effect? Can [BT8-051 Digmon] digivolve from [Armadillomon] in the breeding area?

BT8-053.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-053 Lighdramon] can digivolve from [Veemon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area. (From Card Rulings:BT8-012)
BT8-053.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 2 from [Veemon]>", written in the text for [BT8-053 Lighdramon], as an effect? Can [BT8-053 Lighdramon] digivolve from [Veemon] in the breeding area?

BT8-057.answer: A: No, as those option cards are already used and their effects have already activated, they are not nullified by this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect.
BT8-057.question: Q: When my opponent has this Digimon in play, and on my turn after I used option cards such as [BT1-109 Smashed Potatoes] or [EX1-071 Win Rate: 60%] etc, to "reduce the digivolution cost the next time my Digimon digivolves", all of my opponent's Digimon then become suspended. In this scenario, do those option cards effects becomes nullified when my Digimon digivolves?

BT8-057.answer: A: Yes, you can. Activating the effect of ＜Delay＞ of an option card that was already placed in your battle area does not count as using an option card.
BT8-057.question: Q: When my opponent has this Digimon in play, can I activate ＜Delay＞ of my option card with ＜Delay＞ that was already placed in my battle area from before?

BT8-059.answer: A: This effect stops both players from digivolving with effects that says "ignore digivolution requirements", or from Digimon that do not meet the digivolution requirements.
BT8-059.question: Q: What kind of effect is this card's effect?

BT8-059.answer: A: No, as it doesn't say "Ignore digivolution requirements", and it is digivolving according to the digivolution requirements while treating the tamer as a Digimon, it can digivolve.
BT8-059.question: Q: Does this card's effect stop effects of [Hybrid] form card's digivolutions of "Your red tamer can digivolve into this card in your hand as if it was a red level 3 Digimon" etc?

BT8-059.answer: A: No, DNA digivolution and special digivolutions written on the cards are treated as the digivolution requirements, so they are not stopped by this card.
BT8-059.question: Q: Does this card's effect stops DNA digivolutions or special digivolutions?

BT8-059.answer: A: Yes, as activates, as it is an effect that allows digivolving without paying its cost without ignoring digivolution requirements.
BT8-059.question: Q: When this Digimon is in play, can the effect "can digivolve without paying its cost" activate?

BT8-059.answer: A: No, your opponent cannot digivolve ignoring level while this card's [All Turns] effect is active.
BT8-059.question: Q: Can my opponent activate the effect of [BT6-087 Tai Kamiya] to ignore level while this card is in play?

BT8-059.answer: A: Yes, your opponent can digivolve with the effect [BT7-051 RhinoKabuterimon] because it does not ignore digivolution requirements.
BT8-059.question: Q: Can my opponent digivolve with the effect of [BT7-051 RhinoKabuterimon] which changes the memory cost of the digivolution?

BT8-059.answer: A: Yes, it does not ignore digivolution requirements.
BT8-059.question: Q: Can my opponent digivolve into [BT7-040 Rasenmon] for an alternate digivolution cost?

BT8-059.answer: A: No, the effect requires you to digivolve "ignoring the digivolution requirements" so you cannot digivolve using the effect of [BT9-098 Awakening of the Golden Knight].
BT8-059.question: Q: If I use [BT9-098 Awakening of the Golden Knight] and my opponent has this card. Can I digivolve my [Magnamon] into [BT9-044 Magnamon (X Antibody)] because it fulfills the digivolution requirements?

BT8-061.question: Q: Does this card's effect treat this card as being [Mamemon] even in the hand, deck, trash, and digivolution cards?

BT8-061.answer: A: No, as effects do not activate in the breeding area, this card/Digimon is not treated as being [Mamemon] in the breeding area.
BT8-061.question: Q: Does this card's effect treat this card as being [Mamemon] even in breeding area?

BT8-062.question: Q: Does this card's effect treat this card as being [SkullKnightmon]/[DeadlyAxemon] even in the hand, deck, trash, and digivolution cards?

BT8-062.answer: A: No, as effects do not activate in the breeding area, this card/Digimon is not treated as being [SkullKnightmon]/[DeadlyAxemon] in the breeding area.
BT8-062.question: Q: Does this card's effect treat this card as being [SkullKnightmon]/[DeadlyAxemon] even in breeding area?

BT8-064.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when the Digimon itself that has this card in its digivolution card is a red Digimon?

BT8-065.answer: A: Yes, you return up to 4 cards from both your hands and trash.
BT8-065.question: Q: For this card's effect, can I return up to 4 Digimon cards with [Mamemon] in their names from both my hand and trash to the top of my deck?

BT8-066.answer: A: No, you cannot. As this effect does not allow you to ignore digivolution requirements.
BT8-066.question: Q: Can I digivolve into any Digimon with the [X Antibody] trait regardless of digivolution requirements with this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT8-066.answer: A: No, you cannot. As the timing for [When Attacking] effects to trigger has already passed. (From Card Rulings:EX1-040)
BT8-066.question: Q: My [BT8-066 Hisyaryumon] attacks, and digivolves into [BT6-111 Alphamon] via it's own effect. Can I use [BT6-111 Alphamon]'s [When Attacking] effect?

BT8-068.answer: A: After revealing the 3 cards, all of them are trashed. However, since the effect is "you may reveal the top 3 cards of your deck", regardless of your opponent's Digimon, you can choose not to activate the effect when digivolving. If the effect is not activated, you do not reveal any cards, and no cards will be trashed.
BT8-068.question: Q: What happens for this card's [When Digivolving] effect if my opponent does not have a single Digimon on play?
Q: For this card's "play 1 Digimon card with [Mamemon] in their names a memory cost of 10 or less ", which cost is it referring to?

BT8-070.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, if there are both red and black cards in its digivolution cards, can I delete my opponent's tamer and Digimon?

BT8-070.answer: A: No, it must be a combination of Digimon and tamers with an added total of play cost of up to 6.
BT8-070.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, if there are both red and black cards in its digivolution cards, can I choose my opponent's Digimon with play cost of up to 6, and my opponent's tamers with play cost of up to 6 separately?
Q: Do both of this card's [When Digivolving] effects activate if it only has 1 two-coloured card that is both red and black in its digivolution cards?

BT8-070.answer: A: Yes, if there is a valid target (Digimon or Tamer) that exists for this effect, you must delete at least 1.
BT8-070.question: Q: Do I have to delete a Digimon or Tamer with this effect?

BT8-071.answer:
A: It is an effect that nullifies "reduce play cost by x". You and your opponent will be unable to activate effects that reduce play costs, and must pay the play cost written on the cards in order to play them.
[1]
BT8-071.question: Q: What kind of effect is this card's "can't reduce play costs."?

BT8-071.answer:
A: Yes, "play without paying its memory cost" is not an effect that reduces play costs, so it can activate.
[1]
BT8-071.question: Q: When this Digimon is in play, can "play without paying its memory cost" effects activate?

BT8-071.answer:
A: Yes, it will.Since the effect does not target Digimon, it will still take effect even if the Digimon reducing the play cost is in the Breeding Area.
[2]
BT8-071.question: Q: Can this card's effect prevent the cost reduction of my opponent's [BT13-007 Yggdrasil 7D6]?

BT8-071.answer:
A: No, the cost cannot be reduced. Because of this card's effect, effects that reduce the play cost of Tamers cannot be activated.
[3]
BT8-071.question: Q: When this Digimon is present, can the opponent's [BT14-046 Togemon]'s [Your Turn] effect reduce the play cost of the green Tamer card?

BT8-072.answer: A: Yes, you can only trash 1 purple Digimon card.
BT8-072.question: Q: For this card's [On Play] effect, must the 1 trashed card among the revealed cards be a purple Digimon card?
Q: Does this card's [On Play] effect activate "when a card is trashed from deck" effects?

BT8-074.answer: A: No, cards that revealed from deck that are then trashed are not treated as "trashed from deck".
BT8-074.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when an effect reveals cards from my deck and I must "trash any remaining cards"?

BT8-079.answer: A: No, cards that revealed from deck that are then trashed are not treated as "trashed from deck".
BT8-079.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when an effect reveals cards from my deck and I must "trash any remaining cards"?

BT8-082.question: Q: Do both of this card's [When Digivolving] effects activate if it has both purple and yellow cards its digivolution cards?
Q: Do both of this card's [When Digivolving] effects activate if it only has 1 2-coloured card that is both purple and yellow its digivolution cards?

BT8-082.answer: A: Yes, [BT8-082 Ophanimon: Falldown Mode] can digivolve from [Ophanimon] in the breeding area. Special digivolutions are a digivolution requirements with reference to special conditions, not effects. Therefore, special digivolution conditions can be fulfilled even in the breeding area. (From Card Rulings:BT8-012)
BT8-082.question: Q: Do you treat the special digivolution requirements of "<Digivolve: 2 from [Ophanimon]>", written in the text for [BT8-082 Ophanimon Falldown Mode], as an effect? Can [BT8-082 Ophanimon Falldown Mode] digivolve from [Ophanimon] in the breeding area?

BT8-084.answer: A: In addition to this card's own colour of "white", it is also treated as the colours of the cards in its digivolution cards. For example when this card has a red card and a green card in its digivolution cards, this card is treated as a card with 3 colours, white, red, and green.
BT8-084.question: Q: What kind of effect is this card's [Your Turn] effect?

BT8-085.answer: A: No, regardless of the colour of the cards in digivolution cards, it only counts the colours of that Digimon, and the effect activates if it has 2 or more colours.
BT8-085.question: Q: Does this card's "When your Digimon with 2 or more colours attacks", does it count the colour of the attacking Digimon's digivolution cards as well?

BT8-087.answer:
A: No, your opponent has to target your blue Digimon when attacking to trigger this effect.
[1]
BT8-087.question: Q: Does this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect trigger when my opponent's Digimon attacks, and I block with my blue Digimon?

BT8-087.answer:
A: Yes, as long as the initial target of the attack was a Blue Digimon you can activate this card's effect.
[2]
BT8-087.question: Q: If my opponent declares an attack on a Blue Digimon and then ＜De-Digivolve＞ it into a non-Blue Digimon. Can I activate this card's effect?

BT8-088.question: Q: Do both of this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effects activate if I have both blue and green Digimon in play?
Q: Do both of this card's [Start of Your Main Phase] effects activate if I only have 1 2-coloured Digimon that is both blue and green in play?

BT8-089.answer: A: No, regardless of the colour of the cards in digivolution cards, it only counts the colours of that Digimon, and the effect activates if it has 2 or more colours.
BT8-089.question: Q: Does this card's "When your Digimon with 2 or more colours attacks", does it count the colour of the attacking Digimon's digivolution cards as well?

BT8-094.question: Q: Does this card's[Opponent's Turn] effect activate when my opponent activates the effect of cards such as [BT1-089 Mimi Tachikawa] to move their level 3 Digimon from the breeding area to the battle area when it is not their breeding phase?

BT8-096.answer: A: No, it does not. This effect only counts Digimon that has 1 single card that has 2 or more colours among its digivolution cards.
BT8-096.question: Q: Does this card's "card with 2 or more colour in its digivolution cards" include Digimon with 1 red card and 1 blue card in its digivolution cards?

BT8-096.answer: A: No, it does not. Effects that add colours do not activate while they are in digivolution cards, it is only treated as a card with 1 colour.
BT8-096.question: Q: Does this card's "card with 2 or more colour in its digivolution cards" include Digimon that has cards such as [BT3-040 Shakkoumon] with effects of "This Digimon's colour is also treated as blue" in its digivolution cards?

BT8-097.answer: A: No, in this scenario the memory cost is reduced to 0. Use memory does not become negative, and 0 is the lowest value possible.
BT8-097.question: Q: If my opponent has 7 Digimon in play, and this card's memory cost is reduced by 7 by this card's effect, can I use this card to gain 1 memory?

BT8-097.answer: A: After the battle with the security Digimon, since that security Digimon cannot be played by its own effect, it is trashed as normal.
BT8-097.question: Q: After using this card, I attack and the security check reveals a Digimon with an effect of "[Security] At the end of battle, play this Digimon without paying its memory cost". What happens to the security Digimon in this scenario?

BT8-097.answer: A: No, the [Main] effect of this card has been changed to "Until end of your opponent's turn, "your opponent cannot play Digimon with effects. Then, delete all of your opponent's Digimon with 6000 or less.". So the effect to stop your opponent from playing is applied first before DarkKnight can interrupt the deletion.
BT8-097.question: Q: My opponent has [BT7-063 DarkKnightmon] with [SkullKnightmon] and [DeadlyAxemon] in its digivolution cards. Can the interruptive [Your Turn] effect of [BT7-063 DarkKnightmon] play the Digimon before it's deleted?

BT8-097.answer: A: It ends when the current turn ends.
BT8-097.question: Q: If this card's [Security] effect is activated on my opponent's turn, when does the "opponent cannot play cards due to effects" effect end?

BT8-097.answer: A: No, in that case, since the usage cost of this card has been changed to 1, it is not considered that an option card with a usage cost of 2 or more was used, so it will not be demonstrated.
BT8-097.question: Q: If I use this card and a [EX2-003 Viximon] in my Digimon's digivolution cards while my opponent has 5 or more Digimon in play, will that card's inherited effect be triggered?

BT8-098.answer: A: No, you cannot. You can only target Digimon for the "cannot attack and block" effect at the point of time of activating this card's effect.
BT8-098.question: Q: After using this card, my opponent does not have any Digimon without digivolution cards, so I am unable to target any Digimon for the "cannot attack and block" effect. Afterwards, if a Digimon without digivolution cards enters my opponent's battle area, can I target that Digimon for the "cannot attack and block" effect?

BT8-098.answer: A: It ends when the current turn ends.
BT8-098.question: Q: If this card's [Security] effect is activated on my opponent's turn, when does the "cannot attack or block" effect end?

BT8-100.answer: A: No, it does not. This effect only counts Digimon that has 1 single card that has 2 or more colours among its digivolution cards.
BT8-100.question: Q: Does this card's "card with 2 or more colours in its digivolution cards" include Digimon with 1 red card and 1 blue card in its digivolution cards?

BT8-100.answer: A: No, it does not. Effects that add colours do not activate while they are in digivolution cards, it is only treated as a card with 1 colour.
BT8-100.question: Q: Does this card's "card with 2 or more colour in its digivolution cards" include Digimon that has cards such as [BT3-040 Shakkoumon] with effects of "This Digimon's colour is also treated as blue" in its digivolution cards?

BT8-101.question: Q: For this card's effect, if I have 1 Digimon with the [Armor Form] trait in my trash, does the Digimon that received -4000 DP also get an additional -1000 DP?

BT8-102.answer: A: No, although you can target your opponent's Digimon or tamer that are already suspended with this card's effect, that card must be "suspended by this card's effect" for "Your opponent's cards suspended with this effect can't unsuspend until the end of their next turn" to be applicable.
BT8-102.question: Q: If I target my opponent's Digimon or tamer with this card's effect that is already suspended, does the part of the effect that reads "Your opponent's cards suspended with this effect can't unsuspend until the end of their next turn" apply to that Digimon?

BT8-105.answer: A: You can choose any number of your opponent's Digimon, as long as the play costs of those Digimon are 15 or less when they are added together. For example, "1 Digimon with play cost of 3" + "1 Digimon of play cost of 12", or "1 Digimon with play cost of 2" + "2 Digimon with play cost of 6" etc, the effect that activates targets those Digimon.
BT8-105.question: Q: What exactly does "Choose any number of your opponent's Digimon whose play costs add up to 15 or less" mean exactly?

BT8-105.answer: A: Yes, you are free to choose in any way as long as the total play cost is 15 or less. However, you must choose at least 1 Digimon with play cost of 15 or less.
BT8-105.question: Q: Can I choose in a way so that the total play cost is less than 15 on purpose?

BT8-105.answer: A: No, regardless of what was the memory cost paid when the cards were played, you add together the play costs written on the cards, up to 15.
BT8-105.question: Q: For Digimon that were played with reduced costs, or played without paying their memory costs, do I treat them as that reduced play cost value or 0 play cost for this card's effect?

BT8-106.answer: A: Yes, you can freely choose as long as the total play cost is 15 or less.
BT8-106.question: Q: Can I choose in a way so that the total play cost is less than 15 on purpose?

BT8-107.question: Q: When my opponent does not have a single Digimon in play, or does not have any Digimon with level equal or lower than my Digimon in play, can I use this card to delete 1 of my Digimon?
Q: If this card deletes a Digimon without a level, can I delete one of my opponent's Digimon that does not have a level?

BT8-109.answer: A: No, even though it will have 0 DP the Digimon will not be deleted until the effect of Flame Hellscythe is over. As such, you cannot play a Digimon via the effect of Flame Hellscythe. (Rules Processing)
BT8-109.question: Q: If my opponent has [BT9-047 Pomumon] or [BT9-033 Pillomon] in play. If I target that Digimon with the -6000 DP effect of this card. Can I still play a Digimon?

BT8-110.answer: A: Yes, you can. In that scenario, you only unsuspend the Digimon that digivolved.
BT8-110.question: Q: After using this card, I trash 1 card from the top of my Digimon with the [Armor Form] trait, can I digivolve another one of my Digimon into a Digimon with the [Armor Form] trait in my hand instead?

BT8-110.answer: A: Yes, you can. However, in this scenario the part of the effect "unsuspend that Digimon" is not applied.
BT8-110.question: Q: After using this card, I trash 1 card from the top of my Digimon with the [Armor Form] trait, can I then choose not to digivolve into an Digimon with the [Armor Form] trait in my hand?

BT8-110.answer: A: No, this card's effect does not ignore digivolution requirements.
BT8-110.question: Q: When I use this card to digivolve my Digimon into an Digimon with the [Armor Form] trait in my hand, does it allow me to digivolve while ignoring the digivolution requirements?

BT8-110.answer: A: It cannot be trashed, and as you will not trash any card from your Digimon. You can still perform the rest of the effect.
BT8-110.question: Q: If I target my Digimon [Armor Form] trait and no digivolution cards to trash the top card. What happens?

BT8-111.answer: A: No, even if you trash more than 4 cards, you can only play 1 purple level 5 or lower Digimon card.
BT8-111.question: Q: If I trash 8 cards from the top of my deck with this card's [When Digivolving] effect, can I play 2 purple level 5 or lower Digimon cards from my trash without paying their memory costs?

BT8-111.answer: A: Yes, as the effect is "For every 10 cards in your trash", if you have 20 cards in your trash, you trash 6 cards from the top of your opponent's deck and give this Digimon +6000 DP.
BT8-111.question: Q: For this card's [When Attacking] effect, if I have 20 cards in my trash, do I trash 6 cards from the top of my opponent's deck and give this Digimon +6000 DP?

BT8-112.answer: A: This effect will activate in both timing [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking]. When you digivolving into this Digimon, it will activate as a [When Digivolving] effect, and for the following turns when this Digimon attacks, it will then activate again as a [When Attacking] effect.
BT8-112.question: Q: This card's effect has 2 timing, [When Digivolving] and [When Attacking]. What does that mean?

BT8-112.answer: A: No, you cannot. If you do not do <X> you cannot do the rest of the effect. (See more in Effect Structure#Optional and Mandatory Effects
BT8-112.question: Q: This card has "you may <X> to <Y>. Then, <Z>" If I do not do <X>, am I still allowed to do <Z>?

BT9-002.question: Q: Does this effect activate when I return my own Digimon to my hand?
Q: Does this effect activate when a card effect allows you to draw and trash card from your hand?

BT9-002.answer: A: No, it is not treated as drawing from an effect.
BT9-002.question: Q: Does this card's effect activate if my card effect performs a digivolution and draws from its digivolution bonus?

BT9-003.question: Q: Will this card effect activate during the timing of “Add a card from your security to your hand, then perform ＜Recovery +1 (Deck)＞” ?

BT9-009.answer: A: This effect refers to deletion effect that states "Delete Digimon with X DP or less" and "Select opponent’s Digimon with the total of X or less". This effect enables the player to increase the limit by 1000 DP. However, this effect does not apply to effects such as "Delete the Digimon that has lower DP than this Digimon".
BT9-009.question: Q: What does the effect "Add +1000 DP to the maximum DP of your effects that delete Digimon" mean?

BT9-009.answer: A: No, it does not. It only affects the maximum DP, so [BT3-098 Plasma Stake] will still delete only Digimon with 13000 DP or more.
BT9-009.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect increase the minimum DP deletion of [BT3-098 Plasma Stake] from 13000 DP to 14000 DP?

BT9-011.answer: A: This effect refers to deletion effect that states "Delete Digimon with X DP or less" and "Select opponent’s Digimon with the total of X or less". This effect enables the player to increase the limit by 1000 DP. However, this effect does not apply to effects such as "Delete the Digimon that has lower DP than this Digimon".
BT9-011.question: Q: What does the effect "Add +1000 DP to the maximum DP of your effects that delete Digimon" mean?

BT9-011.answer: A: No, it does not. It only affects the maximum DP, so [BT3-109 Plasma Stake] will still delete only Digimon with 12000 DP or more.
BT9-011.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect increase the minimum DP deletion of [BT3-109 Plasma Stake] from 12000 DP to 13000 DP?

BT9-012.answer: A: No, the effect states to trash 2 cards from the digivolution cards that have the same level. For example, by trashing 2 level 5 Digimon cards from its digivolution cards, this Digimon will not be deleted or returned to the deck/hand.
BT9-012.question: Q: Does the effect of this card, "by trashing 2 cards with the same level", require the 2 cards to be the same level as the current Digimon?
Q: Is it possible to trash this card when activating this card’s inherited effect?

BT9-012.answer: A: No, you can’t. Due to the fact that the Digimon DP becomes 0 and it will be deleted due to rules and not the effect of the card. It will not be considered as deleted by card effect.
BT9-012.question: Q: Can this evolution source effect activate when this Digimon DP reaches 0?

BT9-012.answer: A: No, you cannot unsuspend a Digimon if the Digimon is not deleted.
BT9-012.question: Q: This card is chosen to be deleted by [BT5-106 Demonic Disaster], if it uses its [All Turns] effect to prevent its deletion do I still get to unsuspend a Digimon?

BT9-013.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [OmniShoutmon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-013.question: Q: The effect of "When you have [OmniShoutmon]

BT9-014.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it's required to meet the condition you have cards with [WarGrowlmon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-014.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [WarGrowlmon]

BT9-015.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [MetalGreymon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-015.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [MetalGreymon]

BT9-015.answer: A: No, since this effect activates and checks for the card named [MetalGreymon]/[X Antibody] when digivolving, this Digimon does not gain +3000 DP if you place the card [X Antibody] under this card’s digivolution cards after digivolving it.
BT9-015.question: Q: After I digivolve this Digimon, if I place the card [X Antibody] under this card’s digivolution cards in the same turn, do I get +3000 DP due to its effect?

BT9-016.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [WarGreymon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-016.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [WarGreymon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards" does that mean I can activate the effect, if I have cards with the [X Antibody] trait in its digivolution cards?

BT9-016.answer: A: Since the security will be reduced when performing checks, if there is a [Security] effect during the checks, [Security] effects will be activated first, and this effect will be activated after. After that, if there are no other effects to be activated, you will gain 1 memory before battling the security Digimon.
BT9-016.question: Q: For this card’s [All Turns] effect, when the player attacks the security and checks a Security Digimon and battles it. Does the player gain 1 memory?

BT9-017.answer: A: The effect of [When Digivolving] is when your opponent has no Digimon or Digimon with the lowest DP does not get deleted by this card effect. It also means during the timing when there is no target that can be deleted by this card effect.
BT9-017.question: Q: What is the effect of [When Digivolving] "Delete 1 of your opponents Digimon with the lowest DP, if there is no Digimon was deleted by this effect" meant?

BT9-017.answer: A: No, you can’t. You are required to pick a target if possible, during the activation of this effect.
BT9-017.question: Q: Can I choose not to delete my opponent’s Digimon when I activate this card’s [When Digivolving] effect?

BT9-017.answer: A: Yes, you can. If there are multiple Digimon with the lowest DP you can select either 1 of them as a target. So it’s possible to choose a Digimon that has the effect of "Can’t be deleted by opponent card effects" which will allow you to active this Digimon.
BT9-017.question: Q: When an opponent has a Digimon that "Can’t be deleted by opponent’s card effects" and the Digimon has the same DP as this Digimon. During the activation of this card’s [When Digivolving] effect, can I choose my opponent’s Digimon that has the effect of "can’t be deleted by your opponent’s card effect"?

BT9-017.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [Gallantmon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-017.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [Gallantmon]

BT9-018.question: Q: Does [When Digivolving] allow you to gain 1 memory for each Tamer your opponent has?
Q: While my opponent has multiple Tamers and only has 1 Digimon. Can I only suspend the Digimon and gain memory for each Tamer that my opponent has?

BT9-018.answer:
A: It’s a "You May" effect. You can choose not to use it and if it's not used [Once Per Turn], it will not be used.
[1]
BT9-018.question: Q: Can I choose not to use the [All Turns] effect?

BT9-018.answer:
A: Since the blocking Digimon is deleted by this card effect and due to the attack target no longer being present, the battle will be skipped, and the attack will end.
[1]
BT9-018.question: Q: When I declare an attack. My opponent Digimon with 6000 DP blocks with a ＜Blocker＞ Digimon and suspends it. Due to the [All Turns] effect that Digimon is deleted. What will happen to the attack in this situation?

BT9-018.answer:
A: Yes, it had 6000 or less DP at the time it was suspended.
[2]
BT9-018.question: Q: If my opponent declares an attack with [BT7-049 MameTyramon]. If they digivolve into a new Digimon, can this Digimon's effect still delete the newly digivolved Digimon even if it has more than 6000 DP?

BT9-018.answer:
A: No, it is triggered as soon as the opponent declares an attack suspending the Digimon. (See more in Attack Resolution)
[3]
BT9-018.question: Q: Is this card's [All Turns] effect on the opponent's turn considered a [Reaction] effect during battle?

BT9-018.answer:
A: No, it does not. It is not a "Delete 1 of your opponent's Digimon with X DP or less" effect.
[4]
BT9-018.question: Q: Does this card's [All Turns] effect receive the boost from [BT9-009 Guilmon X Antibody]?

BT9-020.answer: A: No. You can add the card to your hand even though you only revealed cards with [Garurumon]/[Omnimon]/[X Antibody] in its name.
BT9-020.question: Q: Does the effect mean that I can’t add the cards to my hand unless I add both card with [Garurumon]/[Omnimon] in its name

BT9-020.answer: A: No because the effect stated "Add to hand", thus you are required to add as much as possible from the revealed cards. You are required to add cards with [Garurumon]/[Omnimon] in its name and [X Antibody] to your hand.
BT9-020.question: Q: If I reveal cards with [Garurumon]/[Omnimon] in its name

BT9-021.question: Q: Will this card's inherited effect activate when my Digimon is returned to my hand?
Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate when a card effect allows you to draw and trash card from your hand?

BT9-021.answer: A: No, it is not treated as drawing from an effect.
BT9-021.question: Q: Does this card's effect activate if my card effect performs a digivolution and draws from its digivolution bonus?

BT9-024.answer: A: No, the effect states to trash 2 cards from the digivolution cards that have the same level. For example, by trashing 2 level 5 from the digivolution cards, this Digimon will not be deleted or returned to the deck/hand.
BT9-024.question: Q: Does the effect of this card "By trashing 2 cards with the same level" require the trashed cards to be the same level as the current Digimon?
Q: Is it possible to trash this card when activating this card’s inherited effect?

BT9-024.answer: A: As the requirement of "when this Digimon attacks and deletes an opponent's Digimon and survives the battle" of ＜Piercing＞ was not met, it does not activate.
BT9-024.question: Q: My opponent's Digimon with ＜Piercing＞ attacked my Digimon, and my Digimon lost the battle. I then activate my Digimon's [All Turns] effect to prevent it from being deleted. What happens to my opponent's ＜Piercing＞?

BT9-024.answer: A: Yes, because the Digimon will still have ＜Piercing＞ and it deleted a Digimon battle and survived it will trigger.
BT9-024.question: Q: My Digimon has ＜Piercing＞ gained from [BT8-103 Lightning Blade] and battles a Digimon with equal DP. I activate its [All Turns] effect to prevent it from being deleted. Does ＜Piercing＞ trigger?

BT9-024.answer: A: No, it lost ＜Piercing＞ before the timing it would trigger and if it doesn't trigger it cannot activate.
BT9-024.question: Q: This card has ＜Piercing＞ from [EX1-008 MetalGreymon] in its digivolution cards, this card attacks a Digimon with equal DP and uses its [All Turns] effect to prevent its deletion by trashing [EX1-008 MetalGreymon]. Does ＜Piercing＞ still trigger?

BT9-028.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [WereGarurumon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-028.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [WereGarurumon]

BT9-029.answer: A: This effect will be activated during the Main Phase, by revealing this card from your hand.
BT9-029.question: Q: When is the timing of this card effect [Hand] [Main] activated?

BT9-029.answer: A: Yes, you can reveal this card and not pay the cost. The card will be returned to your hand.
BT9-029.question: Q: Can I reveal this card in my hand if I don't want to pay 1 memory?

BT9-029.answer: A: No, you must fulfil the condition to reveal this card from your hand.
BT9-029.question: Q: Can I reveal this card in my hand if I don't have a Digimon [Justimon]/[Raidenmon] in its name in play?

BT9-031.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [MetalGarurumon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-031.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [MetalGarurumon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards" does that mean I can activate the effect, if I have cards with the [X Antibody] trait in its digivolution cards?
Q: Can this card [Your Turn] effect be activated during my active phase?

BT9-033.question: Q: Can this Digimon prevent Digimon from being played by the effect of an option card?

BT9-033.answer: A: Yes. This effect only applies to card effects that allows a Digimon to be played in the battle area.
BT9-033.question: Q: If this Digimon is in the battle area, can play cost be reduced?

BT9-034.answer: A: It will remain the top of the security stack.
BT9-034.question: Q: What will happen if I don’t add the card to my hand, after I check the top card of the security stack?

BT9-040.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [Angewomon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-040.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [Angewomon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards" does that mean I can activate the effect, if I have cards with the [X Antibody] trait in its digivolution cards?

BT9-041.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [RizeGreymon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-041.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [RizeGreymon]

BT9-042.answer: A: This effect will be activated during the Main Phase, by revealing this card from your hand.
BT9-042.question: Q: When is the timing of this card effect [Hand] [Main] activated?

BT9-042.answer: A: Yes, you can reveal this card and not pay the cost. The card will be returned to your hand.
BT9-042.question: Q: Can I reveal this card in my hand if I don't want to pay 1 memory?

BT9-042.answer: A: No, you must fulfil the condition to reveal this card from your hand.
BT9-042.question: Q: Can I reveal this card in my hand if I don't have a Digimon [Justimon]/[Raidenmon] in its name in play?

BT9-043.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [Magnadramon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-043.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [Magnadramon]

BT9-044.question: Q: The effect of "If you have a card with the [Armor Form]/[X Antibody] trait in its digivolution cards" does that mean I can activate the effect, if I have cards with the [X Antibody] trait in its digivolution cards?

BT9-044.answer: A: Magnamon X will place itself into the top of security by its [All Turns], however, the minus DP effects will continue to apply on the new Digimon afterwards. If it still has 0 DP it will still be deleted.

BT9-044.answer: A: No, it cannot activate the [All Turns] effect at all.

BT9-046.answer: A: No, you can’t because it specifies the card name and you can only add a card with the name [X Antibody] to your hand. It does not apply to cards with the [X Antibody] trait.

BT9-046.answer: A: No, even if you only revealed a card with the [Insectoid]/[X Antibody] trait you can add it to your hand.

BT9-046.answer: A: No because the effect states "Add to hand", thus you are required to add as much as possible from the revealed cards. You are required to add cards with the [Insectoid] trait and 1 [X Antibody] to your hand.

BT9-047.answer: A: Yes. This effect only applies to card effects that makes a Digimon to be played in the battle area.

BT9-050.answer: A: No, because this card only specifies [Leomon].

BT9-051.answer: A: No. You can’t target this card as [Leomon] as the card name. This effect can’t be applied to cards with [Leomon] in its name.

BT9-052.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [Okuwamon]

BT9-054.answer: A: This effect will be activated during the Main Phase, by revealing this card from your hand.

BT9-054.answer: A: Yes, you can reveal this card and not pay the cost. The card will be returned to your hand.
BT9-054.question: Q: Can I reveal this card in my hand if I don't want to pay 1 memory?

BT9-054.answer: A: No, you must fulfil the condition to reveal this card from your hand.
BT9-054.question: Q: Can I reveal this card in my hand if I don't have a Digimon [Justimon]/[Raidenmon] in its name in play?

BT9-055.question: Q: By using this Digimon’s [When Digivolving] effect, can I suspend my opponent’s Digimon and change the attack target to that suspended Digimon by this card effect?

BT9-055.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [GranKuwagamon]/[X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-055.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [GranKuwagamon]

BT9-055.answer: A: Yes, the effect condition only prevents the declaration of an attack on that Digimon.
BT9-055.question: Q: If my opponent's Digimon has "This Digimon cannot be attacked.", can this card's effect change the attack target to that Digimon?

BT9-056.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [Leomon]/[X Antibody] in its name in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-056.question: Q: The effect of "If you have cards with [Leomon] in its name

BT9-063.question: Q: Does this card have [Leomon] in its name?

BT9-067.answer: A: No, even if you have either 1 of them in the trash the effect still activates.

BT9-067.answer: A: Yes, you will gain +3000 DP and you can ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ on 1 of your opponent's Digimon.

BT9-068.answer: A: No, as effects do not activate in the breeding area, this card/Digimon is not treated as being [Greymon] in its name in the breeding area.

BT9-068.answer: A: No. This Digimon only has [Greymon] in its name, it does not count as being [Greymon].

Q: Can I use the [When Digivolving] effect to unsuspend 1 of my Tamers and 1 of my opponent’s Tamers?

BT9-069.answer: A: It will be only be 2 in total. It can be done by unsuspending 2 Tamers or 2 Digimon.
BT9-069.question: Q: Does the [When Digivolving] effect allow me to unsuspend 2 Tamers and 2 Digimon at the same time?

BT9-069.answer: A: No. Divide the total of unsuspended Digimon and Tamer by 2. For example, if there are 3 unsuspended Digimon and 1 unsuspended Tamer, 2 security will be trashed.

BT9-071.answer: A: Yes, you can only add and trash cards with the [Undead] trait or [Dark Animal] trait.

BT9-071.answer: A: No, you must add it to your hand as adding to hand happens first.
BT9-071.question: Q: When I activate [On Play] effect, among the revealed cards there is only 1 [Undead] trait or [Dark Animal] trait. Can I choose to either trash it or add it to my hand?

BT9-071.answer: A: No, you can’t ignore the digivolution requirements with this effect.
BT9-071.question: Q: Can this inherited effect digivolve into any Digimon that has the [Undead] trait or [Dark Animal] trait in it’s trait?

BT9-071.answer: A: No, because it’s not there during the timing of declaring an attack.
BT9-071.question: Q: If this Digimon digivolves to a Digimon that has the effect of [When Attacking], can I activate [When Attacking] effect?

BT9-073.answer: A: No, you can’t ignore the digivolution requirements with this effect.
BT9-073.question: Q: Can this inherited effect digivolve into any Digimon that has the [Undead] trait or [Dark Animal] trait in it’s trait?

BT9-073.question: Q: If this Digimon digivolves into a Digimon that has the effect of [When Attacking], can I activate [When Attacking] effect?

BT9-076.answer: A: Yes, since dual coloured card is also treated as both colours, both effects will activate.
BT9-076.question: Q: If the card trashed from hand by this card’s [On Play] [When Digivolving] effect was both a yellow and purple dual coloured card, will both effects of "Delete 1 of opponent’s level 3 Digimon" and "During this turn, 1 of your opponent’s Digimon loses -3000 DP" activate?
Q: If this card is a digivolution card of Digimon with effects such as "This Digimon is also treated as red", will the inherited effect activate?

BT9-077.answer: A: No, this card itself can’t be digivolved by its own effect. This effect can be used with another card’s effect to digivolve from the trash by paying the digivolution cost.

BT9-079.answer: A: No, you can’t ignore the digivolution requirements with this effect.
BT9-079.question: Q: Can this Digimon’s [End of Attack] effect digivolve a card into any Digimon that has the [Undead] trait or [Dark Animal] trait?

BT9-082.answer: A: No, the digivolution cards will remain in the trash. Only this card will come into play.
BT9-082.question: Q: Will this Digimon come back into play with its digivolution cards during the activation of its [On Deletion] effect?

BT9-082.answer: A: No, you can’t because this Digimon will be treated as a new Digimon.
BT9-082.question: Q: If this Digimon has an inherited effect with an [On Deletion] effect that was deleted  and then comes into play, can I choose the unresolved effect to be resolved when it comes into play?

BT9-083.answer: A: The player of this card chooses.
BT9-083.question: Q: Which player chooses the arrangement order and the cards to be returned to the bottom of them?

BT9-083.answer: A: Yes it is possible to target a Digi-Egg with this effect, however it will be returned to the bottom of the Digi-Egg deck.
BT9-083.question: Q: Is it possible to return a Digi-Egg to the bottom of the deck with this card effect?

BT9-083.answer: A: No, you will only return 10 cards to the bottom of your opponent’s deck.
BT9-083.question: Q: When activating the [When Digivolving] effect, if I have 2 Digimon with the [Mega] trait, does that mean I can return 20 cards to the bottom of the deck?

BT9-083.answer: A: Yes, if that is the case do return as much as possible to the bottom of the deck.

BT9-083.answer: A: No, this effect is mandatory to be activated.
