BT9-083.answer: A: No, even if the opponent’s security stack has 0 cards, it will activate. In this case, the security cards of the opponent can’t be trashed, but "trash the top card of this stack" will be performed.
BT9-083.question: Q: Does the [Start of Your Turn] effect not activate when my opponent has 0 security cards?

BT9-083.answer: A: No, it cannot be trashed and because of that your opponent does not trash security.
BT9-083.question: Q: What happens if this card has no digivolution cards, does this Digimon still get trashed?

BT9-083.answer: A: No, if there is a valid target and you have not deleted equal to the number of [Mega] trait in its digivolution cards you must delete that target.
BT9-083.question: Q: Can I attempt to delete less Digimon than the number of [Mega] trait in this Digimon's digivolution cards?

BT9-084.answer: A: Yes, you will gain 2 memory due to the conditions being met.

BT9-085.answer: A: Yes, you will gain 2 memory due to the conditions being met.

BT9-087.answer: A: Yes, you will gain 2 memory due to the conditions being met.

BT9-088.answer: A: Yes, you will gain 2 memory due to the conditions being met.

BT9-088.answer: A: Yes, it does. [Start of Your Turn] effects are activated before Digimon are unsuspended in the Unsuspend Phase.

BT9-090.answer: A: No, even you only reveal a [Tapirmon] or a 2-colored black card you can add both cards to your hand.

BT9-092.answer: A: No because the effect stated "Add to hand", thus you are required to add as much as possible from the revealed cards. You are required to add cards with the [X Antibody] trait and [X Antibody] to your hand.
BT9-092.question: Q: If I reveal cards with the [X Antibody] trait

BT9-093.answer: A: No, the digivolution requirements still apply.
BT9-093.question: Q: By using this card’s [Main] effect, can I digivolve my Digimon to any card with [Shoutmon] in its name by ignoring the digivolution requirements?

BT9-094.question: Q: Can this card’s [Main] effect be stacked with "Add 1000 to the maximum DP you can choose with DP-based deletion effects" to make it able to delete a Digimon with 11000 DP or lower?

BT9-094.answer: A: Choose any number of your opponent’s Digimon so that the total DP of those Digimon adds up to 11000 or less, such as two 3000 DP Digimon and a 5000 DP Digimon, or two DP 4000 Digimon and a DP 3000 Digimon, and then activate the effect on those Digimon
BT9-094.question: Q: The card reads, 'Choose any number of your opponent's Digimon whose total DP adds up to 11000 or less'. What does that actually mean?

BT9-094.answer: A: Yes. You are free to choose so long as the total DP is 11000 or less. However, you must choose at least 1 Digimon if your opponent has any Digimon with DP 11000 or less.
BT9-094.question: Q: Can I deliberately choose fewer targets so that the total DP is less than 11000?

BT9-094.answer: A: No. Your opponent’s Digimon’s DP will only be reduced after Golemon is Deleted when this card’s effect has finished activating. You may not choose an additional target at that point
BT9-094.question: Q: If my opponent has [BT4-066 Golemon] and I include Golemon as one of the targeted Digimon my opponent’s other Digimon’s DP will be reduced by 1000 when Golemon is Deleted. Can I include that loss of DP in my calculations when selecting Digimon to target?

BT9-095.question: Q: With this card’s [Main] effect, can I choose my suspended Digimon with [Greymon] in its name to attack the player?

BT9-095.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.

BT9-095.answer: A: No, you can’t. This card’s effect only allows you to attack the opponent.
BT9-095.question: Q: When using this card’s [Main] effect, If I have a card effect that allows me to attack my opponent’s active Digimon, can I choose to attack the active Digimon instead?

BT9-097.answer: A: No, you can’t because this effect specifies the card name and it’s required to meet the condition you have cards with [X Antibody] in its digivolution cards. It does not refer to the traits of the cards.
BT9-097.question: Q: The effect of "If you have [X Antibody] in its digivolution cards" does that mean I can activate the effect, if I have cards with the [X Antibody] trait in its digivolution cards?

BT9-102.answer: A: Yes, as long the conditions are met. It will activate ＜Blitz＞ and gain ＜Rush＞.
BT9-102.question: Q: After using this card if there is a Digimon that digivolves into a level 6 Digimon with the [Machine] trait during the turn it was played, or when a level 6 Digimon with the [Machine] trait comes into play, will that Digimon activate ＜Blitz＞ and gain ＜Rush＞?

BT9-103.answer: A: No, it doesn’t. This effect applies to all levels. The part of opponent Digimon with 7 play cost or lower applies to the effect of "Can’t attack the player".
BT9-103.question: Q: Does the effect of "Your opponent can’t increase either players' security" only apply to your opponent’s Digimon with 7 play cost or lower?

BT9-103.answer: A: The cards are not considered to be added back into security.
BT9-103.question: Q: If this card was used previously and then the opponent uses an effect that reveals cards from security. What happens?

BT9-103.answer: A: The rest of the cards are returned to security. Returning a card revealed by an effect from a hidden location, such as a deck or security, in its original location is not considered to have increased/decreased the number of cards from the original location, so this card's effect will not impact that situation.
BT9-103.question: Q: While this card's "cards can't be added to security stacks by your opponent's effects" is active, I digivolve into [BT10-086 Omnimon (X Antibody)] to reveal all of my opponent's security. What happens to the card revealed from the security?

BT9-104.answer: A: No, the digivolution requirements still apply.
BT9-104.question: Q: By using this card’s [Main] effect, can I digivolve my Digimon in to any card with the [X Antibody] trait by ignoring the digivolution requirements?

BT9-105.question: Q: Is it possible to place the card with the [X Antibody] trait that was revealed by this card effect and trashed, at the bottom of 1 of your Digimon’s digivolution cards?

BT9-106.answer: A: No, the digivolution requirements still apply.
BT9-106.question: Q: By using this card’s [Main] effect, can I digivolve my Digimon to any card with [Dex]/[DeathX] in its name by ignoring the digivolution requirements?

BT9-106.answer: A: Yes, it’s possible if the conditions are met.
BT9-106.question: Q: By digivolving with this cards effect, is it possible to reduce the digivolution cost?

BT9-107.answer:
A: No, you can’t. It is only applied to 1 Digimon. For the effect "Then," you can select another Digimon other than the selected Digimon for ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ on 1 of your opponent's Digimon.
[1]
BT9-107.question: Q: During the activation of the [Main] effect if I trash 2 cards from my hand, can I ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ on 2 of your opponent's Digimon?

BT9-107.answer:
A: ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ will be activated twice. Even if the top card becomes a Tamer or Option card, the top card will continue to be trashed by ＜De-Digivolve＞.
[2]
BT9-107.question: Q: During the activation of the [Main] effect if I trash 2 cards from my hand, will I ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ on 1 of your opponent's Digimon twice or ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ on 2 of your opponent's Digimon?

BT9-107.answer:
A: It performs ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ 3 times on the same Digimon. So you must do as much as you can.
[3]
BT9-107.question: Q: Does this card perform ＜De-Digivolve  3＞ on 1 of my opponent's Digimon, or does it perform ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ 3 times on the same Digimon?

BT9-109.answer: A: Yes, the [Main] effect allows it to be placed into 1 of your Digimon digivolution cards. Like Digimon and Digi-Egg cards, this card can activate it’s inherited effect when it’s in its digivolution cards.
BT9-109.question: Q: This card is an option card, but it has inherited effect?

BT9-109.answer: A: No, the digivolution requirements still apply.
BT9-109.question: Q: By using this card’s [When Attacking] effect, can I digivolve my Digimon to any card with the [X Antibody] trait by ignoring the digivolution requirements?

BT9-109.answer: A: Yes, it’s possible if the conditions are met.
BT9-109.question: Q: By digivolving with this card effect, is it possible to reduce the digivolution cost?

BT9-109.answer: A: It can't be trashed by ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect due to its effect.
BT9-109.question: Q: Can this card be trashed with the effect of ＜Digi-Burst＞ ?

BT9-109.answer: A: It’s like level 2 Digimon, this card can’t exist in the battle area, thus it will be trashed. If there are digivolution cards beneath this card, they will be trashed as well.
BT9-109.question: Q: What will happen if this card becomes the top card of a Digimon due to ＜De-Digivolve＞ effect?

BT9-109.answer: A: This card can’t be trashed, however the card above this card will be trashed.
BT9-109.question: Q: What will happen if my opponent card effect such as "trash 2 digivolution cards from the bottom of 1 of your opponent Digimon" when this card is at the bottom of the digivolution cards?

BT9-109.answer: A: No, "as the bottom digivolution card" tells you where to place X Antibody, it is not part of the conditionl.
BT9-109.question: Q: Can this card be placed as a digivolution card underneath a Digimon which has [X Antibody] in its digivolution cards but not as the bottom digivolution card?

BT9-110.question: Q: Does the effect of "If both players have 3 or more Digimon in play in total" include both you and your opponent?

BT9-110.answer: A: No, all Digimon without [X Antibody] trait will be deleted.
BT9-110.question: Q: When both players have 3 or more Digimon, is it possible to only delete 1 Digimon without with the [X Antibody] trait?

BT9-111.answer: A: No, your current turn will resume without a turn change.
BT9-111.question: Q: By using the [End of Your Turn] effect, if the memory returns to your side from your opponent’s side, will it be considered as the changing from your turn to your opponent's turn, and then to your turn again?

BT9-111.answer: A: Yes, you can because it’s not considered trashing.
BT9-111.question: Q: Can I return [BT9-109 X Antibody] from this Digimon’s digivolution cards to the bottom of the deck when using [End of Your Turn] effect?

BT9-111.answer: A: You would resolve both the lose 2 memory effect of Gravity Crush and the [End of Your Turn] effect of this card. If after both have resolved, the memory is at 0 or more on your side. Your Main Phase will continue, if the turn would end again Gravity Crush will trigger again. The same will apply for any other [End of Your Turn], [End of All Turns], and [End of Opponent's Turn] effects. (For more information see End of Turn Procedures)
BT9-111.question: Q: What happens if I have activated [BT1-090 Gravity Crush] in the same turn as I activate this card's [End of Your Turn] effect?

BT9-112.answer: A: No, it counts the overall total of your opponent’s Digimon and Tamer. If your opponent has 2 Digimon and 1 Tamer, the cost reduction will be 9.
BT9-112.question: Q: When this card comes into play, do I reduce 3 cost for each pair of your opponent’s Digimon and Tamers?

BT9-112.answer: A: Yes, after this card has ＜De-Digivolve＞ a Digimon into a Level 2 Digimon, it will be deleted by this effect before it gets trashed.
BT9-112.question: Q: Can this card's effect delete Level 2 Digimon before they get trashed by Rules Processing?

EX1-001.answer: A: No, you can only add either 1 of them to your hand
EX1-001.question: Q: When I reveal both a Digimon card with [Agumon] in its name and a Tamer card from this card's Evolution Source effect, can I add them both to my hand?
Q: Can I add a Tamer card or a Digimon card with  [Agumon] in its name that is not Red with this card's Evolution Source effect?

EX1-002.answer: A: Yes, it activates. [When Attacking] effects activate before a block can be declared. (See more in Attack Resolution)
EX1-002.question: Q: My Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards and attacks the opposing player, and my opponent's Digimon blocks the attack. Does this card's effect still activate?

EX1-003.answer: A: Yes, it activates. [When Attacking] effects activate before a block can be declared. (See more in Attack Resolution)
EX1-003.question: Q: My Digimon with this card in its Evolution Source attacks my opponent Player, and my opponent's Digimon blocks the attack. Does this card's effect still activate?

EX1-004.answer: A: No, this card's inherited effect can only play cards that are named [Tai Kamiya].

EX2-056.question: Q: If I attempt to digivolve into a Digimon with [Growlmon]/[Gallantmon] in its name, but the effect of [EX3-016 SnowAgumon] and [EX3-019 Paledramon] cause the digivolution to fail. Will the effect of "[When Digivolving] ＜Blitz＞." still be given to that Digimon?

EX2-056.answer:
A: No, you cannot declare an attack while you are in the middle of resolving an attack (from the first ＜Blitz＞). The second ＜Blitz＞ will fail to declare an attack.
[2]
EX2-056.question: Q: I gave my Digimon "[When Digivolving] ＜Blitz＞" effect of this card. I digivolve into [BT5-086 Omnimon]. Since there are two instances of the same "[When Digivolving] ＜Blitz＞" effect, can I activate the first ＜Blitz＞, unsuspend, and then activate the second ＜Blitz＞ effect?

EX2-056.answer:
A: Yes, the new Digimon keeps the "[When Digivolving] ＜Blitz＞" effect and if the memory is at 1 or more on the opponent's side, it can activate ＜Blitz＞. (For more information see Persistent Effects)
[3]
EX2-056.question: Q: If I digivolve into a Digimon with [Growlmon]/[Gallantmon] in its name but the memory remains at 0 or more on my side so ＜Blitz＞ cannot activate. If that same Digimon then digivolves into a Digimon without [Growlmon]/[Gallantmon] in its name, can that Digimon activate ＜Blitz＞?

EX2-064.answer: A: No, it is not triggered by a digivolution in the breeding area.
EX2-064.question: Q: Is this card's [Your Turn] effect triggered when my Digimon digivolves from level 5 to level 6 in the breeding area?

EX2-064.answer: A: It cannot digivolve, and the level 6 Digimon card issued for evolution will be returned to your hand. The level 5 Digimon will be deleted and you will not pay the digivolution cost.

EX2-064.answer: A: Yes, you can choose to use either the [When Digivolving] or [On Deletion] effect first.

EX2-064.answer: A: Yes, if you do you will reduce the digivolution cost by the total.

EX2-065.answer: A: No, it does not satisfy the condition.

EX2-067.answer: A: No, since the effect does not have "you may", if there is a suitable target, it cannot be intentionally excluded.

EX2-070.answer: A: No, the two effects of this card and [BT6-087 Tai Kamiya] cannot interrupt each other.

EX2-070.answer: A: No, when you choose the Digimon to digivolve from for this card's effect, the Tamer is still being treated as a Tamer.

EX3-045.answer: A: Yes, "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:VegetationCategory:Ancient PlantCategory:Carnivorous Plant
EX3-045.question: Q: When it says "[Vegetation] in one of its traits" (植物型), does it include traits other than [Vegetation] (植物型)?

EX3-045.answer: A: Yes, "[Fairy] in one of its traits" includes the following traits:Category:Fairy
EX3-045.question: Q: When it says "[Fairy] in one of its traits" (妖精型), does it include traits other than [Fairy] (妖精型)?

EX3-048.answer: A: No, if you only reveal one or the other, you get to add the one card to your hand.
EX3-048.question: Q: If the cards I reveal from my deck do not include both 1 Digimon card [Rock Dragon]/[Earth Dragon]/[Bird Dragon]/[Machine Dragon]/[Sky Dragon] trait and 1 [Hina Kurihara], am I not allowed to add a card to my hand?

EX3-048.answer: A: No, you should add to your hand as much as possible.
EX3-048.question: Q: If I reveal both 1 Digimon card [Rock Dragon]/[Earth Dragon]/[Bird Dragon]/[Machine Dragon]/[Sky Dragon] trait and 1 [Hina Kurihara], am I allowed to add 1 card to hand and put the other on the bottom of my deck?

EX3-049.answer:
A: Yes, all of them gain ＜Rush＞.
[1]
EX3-049.question: Q: If multiple Digimon with the [D-Brigade] trait are played at the same time. Does all of them gain ＜Rush＞?

EX3-049.answer:
A: No, only the Digimon with [D-Brigade] trait will gain ＜Rush＞.
[2]
EX3-049.question: Q: If a Digimon with [D-Brigade] trait and a Digimon without [D-Brigade] trait are played by the same effect. Do both Digimon gain ＜Rush＞?

EX3-051.answer: A: Yes, if you choose not to play the valid Digimon card. The Digimon card will still get trashed.
EX3-051.question: Q: If I choose not to play a Digimon with the [D-Brigade] trait using this card's [When Digivolving] effect. Does it get trashed?

EX3-053.answer: A: No, both Digimon must be suspended otherwise they will not be able to DNA Digivolve.
EX3-053.question: Q: During my turn after my opponent's [On Play] effect of this card was activated, can an unsuspended Digimon and a suspended Digimon be used for a DNA Digivolution?

EX3-053.answer: A: No, it cannot. ＜Digisorption＞ is an effect that occurs "when you would digivolve", so if the Digimon you are digivolving from is unsuspended it cannot digivolve and the ＜Digisorption＞ effect cannot be activated.
EX3-053.question: Q: During my turn after my opponent's [On Play] effect of this card was activated, can ＜Digisorption＞ be used to suspend an unsuspended Digimon and digivolve from that Digimon?

EX3-053.answer: A: No, it cannot. The effect of Agunimon will treat the Tamer as a "level 3 red Digimon", so it is considered an unsuspended Digimon and cannot digivolve.
EX3-053.question: Q: During my turn after my opponent's [On Play] effect of this card was activated, is it possible to digivolve from an unsuspended Tamer into [BT4-011 Agunimon]?

EX3-054.answer: A: No, you must finish the digivolution. The effect of "when you would digivolve into this card" is to reveal this card from your hand and declare evolution, then return cards with the [D-Brigade] trait to the top of the deck and reduce the evolution cost. The digivolution cannot be cancelled by a player once declared.
EX3-054.question: Q: For this card's "when you would digivolve into this card" effect, can I choose not to digivolve after returning cards with the [D-Brigade] trait from my trash to the top of my deck?

EX3-055.answer:
A: You can only trash a purple or red card with the [Free] trait or a card with [Imperialdramon] in its name.
[1]
EX3-055.question: Q: When activating this card's [On Play] effect, after adding 1 purple or red card with the [Free] trait or 1 card with [Imperialdramon] in its name to my hand, can I trash either of the remaining 2 cards? Or can I only trash a purple or red card with the [Free] trait or a card with [Imperialdramon] in its name?

EX3-056.answer:
A: No, the [Your Turn] effect will not be active.
[1]
EX3-056.question: Q: If this Digimon has [BT12-001 Gigimon] in its digivolution cards when it gets deleted. Can I delete a Digimon with 4000 DP?

EX3-058.question: Q: If digivolving with this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect moves the memory to my opponent's side. Is it possible to use this card's inherited effect to perform a DNA Digivolution?

EX3-058.answer: A: No, it does not have to be Red. Only the Digimon card you digivolve into has to be red.
EX3-058.question: Q: If I use this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect to digivolve a Digimon into a Level 4 Red Digimon card with the [Free] trait. Does that other Digimon have to be Red?

EX3-060.answer:
A: No, once the attack is declared, the attack will continue even if it loses is digivolution cards during the attack.
[1]
EX3-060.question: Q: After this Digimon has declared an attack, its digivolution cards are all trashed by an effect. Will the attack be stopped?

EX3-064.answer: A: No, you will not draw. This card's [On Deletion] effect only places the Option card it into the Battle Area. It does not use the Option card.
EX3-064.question: Q: When I place [EX3-069 Trial of the Four Great Dragons] from my hand in the Battle Area with this card's [On Deletion] effect, will the Option card's "[Main] ＜Draw 1＞. After that, place this card in the Battle Area." effect let me draw 1 card?

EX3-065.answer:
A: Yes, but it is not possible to activate both effects at the same time, so they will be activated one by one. Finish resolving the first [On Play] effect activated by this card before suspending the next one to activate it again.
[1]
EX3-065.question: Q: If I have 2 of this card in my battle area. After digivolving into a Digimon with the [Rock Dragon]/[Earth Dragon]/[Bird Dragon]/[Machine Dragon]/[Sky Dragon] trait. Can I suspend both Tamers and activate the [On Play] effect of that Digimon twice?

EX3-065.answer:
A: No, the [On Deletion] effect was triggered most recently, so it activates first before the next [Your Turn] effect of Hina Kurihara.
[1]
EX3-065.question: Q: If I have two of this card, and after using this card's [Your Turn] effect to activate the effect of [EX3-012 Volcanicdramon]. Will the [On Deletion] effect happen after the [Your Turn] effect of the second Hina?

EX3-065.answer:
A: No, it is considered to be activating a Digimon's card effect.
[2]
EX3-065.question: Q: If I activate this card's effect to activate an [On Play] effect, does that count as activating a Tamer's card effect?

EX3-066.answer: A: As long as you have a level 6 Digimon with the [Machine] trait in the battle area, you can use this Option card even if you don't have both a Red and Black Digimon and/or Tamer.
EX3-066.question: Q: What does this card's "While you have a level 6 Digimon with the [Machine] trait in play, you may use this card without meeting its color requirements." effect mean?

EX3-069.answer: A: Yes, it is still the Digimon that was played by this effect. So it is deleted at the end of your opponent's turn.
EX3-069.question: Q: If I the Digimon played with this effect is digivolved into a new Digimon, or de-digivolved into a Digimon by a combination of effects. Is it still deleted by "and at the end of your opponent's turn, delete that Digimon."?

EX3-069.answer: A: No, you cannot DNA Digivolve into a Level 7 Digimon using the Digimon played with this effect.
EX3-069.question: Q: Is it possible to DNA Digivolve the Digimon into a Level 7 Digimon that was played with this effect?

EX3-070.answer: A: No, if only your opponent has a Digimon in the Battle Area, suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon. If only you have a Digimon in the Battle Area, unsuspend 1 of your Digimon.
EX3-070.question: Q: Does this card's [Security] effect fail to activate if either only me or my opponent has a Digimon in the Battle Area?

EX3-074.answer: A: Yes, you can only activate that effect when DNA Digivolving.
EX3-074.question: Q: Can I activate the effect of "you may play 1 green or blue Digimon card with the [dramon] trait and 12000 DP or less from your hand without paying the cost." when DNA Digivolving?

EX4-001.answer:
A: No, it cannot. Since [On Deletion] effect activates after moving to the trash the Digimon with this card's inherited effect is not in the Battle Area. So the effect does not meet its conditions.
[1]

EX4-002.answer:
A: No, it does not work. Even if an effect causes the attack, it is suspended by an attack and so it is not considered to be "suspended by a card effect".
[1]

EX4-004.answer:
A: Yes, deletion by ＜Retaliation＞ is not considered deleted by battle.
[1]
EX4-004.question: Q: Will this card's inherited effect activate if the Digimon was deleted by ＜Retaliation＞?

EX4-006.answer:
A: It means that if the total number of your trash and your opponent's trash is 20 or more. For example, if your trash is 12 and your opponent's trash is 8. The total is 20 so the conditions are met.
[1]
EX4-006.question: Q: What does "if both players have a total of 20 or more in their trash" mean?

EX4-006.answer:
A: No, if the conditions are met when the effect activates, the effect will continue for the duration of the turn
[1]
EX4-006.question: Q: If the total number of cards in both player's trash becoems 19 or less after being played. Does it lose ＜Rush＞ gained by its [On Play] effect?

EX4-008.answer:
A: Yes, you must trash the top 2 cards of each player's deck as much as possible.
[1]
EX4-008.question: Q: Does this card's [When Digivolving] effect always trash the top two cards of each player's deck?

EX4-008.answer:
A: Yes, it is a "you may return to hand" effect. So it's possible not to return it to your hand. However, the top two cards of each player's deck is still trashed.
[1]
EX4-008.question: Q: With this card's [When Digivolving] effect, if I have [Guilmon] or a card with [Growlmon]/[Gallantmon] in its name, can I choose not to return that card to my hand?

EX4-008.answer:
A: Yes, it is a "you may return to hand" effect. So it's possible not to return it to your hand.
[1]
EX4-008.question: Q: With this card's [On Deletion] inherited effect, if I have [Guilmon] or a card with [Growlmon]/[Gallantmon] in its name, can I choose not to return that card to my hand?

EX4-009.question: Q: When this card's [When Digivolving] effect activates while the opponent has no Digimon, does it still activate the effect of giving -4000 DP to the opponent's Security Digimon?

EX4-010.answer:
A: No, it means that the number of your trash and the number of your opponent's trash are totaled, and every 10 of that total number. For example, if you have 15 cards in your trash, and 9 cards in your opponent's trash. You'll have a total of 24 cards. So 4000 DP will be added to the maximum DP of the deletion.
[1]
EX4-010.question: Q: For "every 10 cards in each player's trash" does it mean "every 10 cards in your trash" and "every 10 cards in the opponent's trash"?

EX4-011.answer:
A: It means, if this card is in the trash at that specific timing the effect can be activated.
[1]
EX4-011.question: Q: For this card's [End of Your Turn] effect, what does [Trash] mean?

EX4-011.answer:
A: Yes, it is a "you may play this card". So it's possible to not play this card with the effect.
[1]
EX4-011.question: Q: Can this card's [End of Your Turn] effect delete a Digimon with [Gallantmon] in its name but not be played afterwards?

EX4-011.answer:
A: No, it means that the number of your trash and the number of your opponent's trash are totaled, and every 10 of that total number. For example, if you have 15 cards in your trash, and 9 cards in your opponent's trash. You'll have a total of 24 cards. So 4000 DP will be added to the maximum DP of the deletion.
[1]
EX4-011.question: Q: For the [On Play] effect's "every 10 cards in each player's trash" does it mean "every 10 cards in your trash" and "every 10 cards in the opponent's trash"?

EX4-013.answer:
A: No, you cannot. In that case, it will remain in the trash.
[1]

A: Yes, you can choose to stop a suspended Digimon from unsuspending during the opponent's unsuspend phase.

EX4-013.answer:
A: Since, [Security] effects cannot activate. The battle will be held as usual. After the battle ends, this card is placed in the trash.

EX4-014.answer:
A: No, they will not.If multiple Digimon that feature either the [Blue Flare]/[Twilight] trait are played with different effects. The effect of this card will be triggered separately for each effect. According to the rules, the effect that triggered later will take precendence. In the case of this question the effect triggered by [Twilight] trait will activate first. So a card with the DigiXros requirement is returned to your hand. Because of the [Once Per Turn], you cannot ＜Draw 1＞.
[1]

A: Yes, if you play this card it will trigger its own effect.

A: No, if you have a target for this effect, add it to your hand as much as possible.

EX4-016.question: Q: FOr this card's [On Play] effect. If I have both 1 [Kiriha Aonuma] and 1 black or blue card with the DigiXros requirement among the cards revealed by the effect. Can I choose to add only 1 of them to my hand and trash the other one?

EX4-018.answer:
A: The Digimon targeted at the time of this effect will continue having "[When Attacking] Lose 2 memory." until the end of the opponent's turn.

EX4-020.answer:
A: The Digimon will still be unable to attack until the end of the opponent's turn.

A: Yes, it can attack. This effect is "all of your opponent's Digimon that are level 4 or lower", so Digimon that become level 5 or higher will no longer be affected. But, Digimon that has enter the battle area afterwards as Level 4 or lower will be affected.

EX4-023.answer:
A: The card revealed from your hand will be placed on the top of your security stack face down.
[1]

EX4-023.answer:
A: It can be activated, but the security will not be increased. So the revealed cannot be laced in security and will be trashed by the rules.

A: No, you cannot. [EX2-045 Calumon] does not have a level. So it is not considered as a card with the same level as [EX2-045 Calumon] and cannot be revealed by this card's effect.

A: Yes, [BT7-100 Qualialise Blast] has the effect of "when this card would be used", and the use cost of the card has not changed, so the option card still has a memory of 5. Assuming that you have done so, the inherited effect of this card can be activated.

A: No, suspending for ＜Blocker＞ doesn't count as an effect.

EX4-036.question: Q: If a Digimon with ＜Blocker＞ suspends to block, does this card's inherited effect trigger to give my Digimon ＜Piercing＞?

EX4-038.answer:
A: Yes, you can still add that card to your hand if you only have one or the other.

EX4-038.answer:
A: No, if you have a target for this effect, add it to your hand as much as possible.

EX4-039.answer:
A: Yes, you can still add that card to your hand if you only have one or the other.
[1]

EX4-039.answer:
A: No, if you have a target for this effect, add it to your hand as much as possible.
[1]
EX4-039.question: Q: For this card's [On Play] effect. If I have both 1 [Garurumon] in its name and 1 [Agumon]/[Greymon]/[Omnimon] in its name among the cards revealed by the effect. Can I choose to add only 1 of them to my hand and put the other one on the bottom of deck?

EX4-040.answer:
A: Yes, it is treated as [Nene Amano] by its effect.
[1]
EX4-040.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect play [EX4-062 Kiriha Aonuma & Nene Amano] without paying its cost?

A: No, it is treated as [Nene Amano] by its effect.

EX4-040.question: Q: Can this card's [On Play] effect play a [Nene Amano] while I have [EX4-062 Kiriha Aonuma & Nene Amano] in play?

EX4-050.answer:
A: If the ＜Security Attack +1＞ is lost before the second check, the second check is not performed.

EX4-050.question: Q: The opponent attacks with a Digimon that has ＜Security Attack +1＞, and the security is reduced by 1. What happens if this card's [Opponent's Turn] effect that ＜De-Digivolve  1＞ on nocategory of your opponent's Digimon (Trash up to 1 card from the top of one of your opponent's Digimon. If it has no digivolution cards, or becomes a level 3 Digimon, you can't trash any more cards) on the attacking Digimon causes it to lose that ＜Security Attack +1＞?

EX4-052.answer:
A: No, you cannot. [EX2-045 Calumon] does not have a level. So it is not considered as a card with the same level as [EX2-045 Calumon] and cannot be trashed by this card's effect.
[1]

A: Yes, you can still add that card to your hand if you only have one or the other.

EX4-053.answer:
A: No, if you have a target for this effect, add it to your hand as much as possible.

EX4-055.answer:
A: Your opponent will choose the card to be trashed.
[1]

EX4-056.answer:
A: Yes, deletion by ＜Retaliation＞ is not considered deleted by battle.
[1]
EX4-056.question: Q: Will this card's inherited effect activate if the Digimon was deleted by ＜Retaliation＞?

EX4-058.answer:
A: Your opponent will choose the card to be trashed.

EX4-060.answer:
A: This Digimon will leave the battle area when it is placed as a digivolution card for another Digimon. So this card's [All Turns] effect will trigger and activate. So, it will be placed in your security face down instead of becoming a digivolution card.

A: Yes, if you out of all Digimon between you and your opponent there are 2 or more Digimon, it will activate.

EX4-062.answer:
A: Yes, you can add 1 card from trash and/or tamers for each of this card suspended.
[2]

EX4-062.answer:
A: You can choose to place 0, 1, or both.
[3]
EX4-062.question: Q: When I place cards for a DigiXros with this card's [All Turns] effect, if there's 1 valid card under my Tamers and 1 valid card in my trash, can I choose to place just 1 of those cards, or am I required to place both?

EX4-064.answer:
A: Yes, you will get both effects if it was deleted by an effect.
[1]

EX4-068.answer:
A: Yes, this effect will activate in addition to the number of colours you have, so you can select different targets for each effect.
[1]

EX4-068.answer:
A: No, they will be treated as being performed at the same timing.
[2]

Q: Does this card's [Main] effect activate 3 times when I have 1 Digimon with 2 colours?

EX4-068.answer:
A: No, duplicate colours are counted as 1 colour. So in the case of this scenario, there are 3 colours. It will be activated 4 times.
[1]
EX4-068.question: Q: If I have a red/blue Digimon, and a red/black Digimon. Does this card's effect activate 5 times with 4 colours?

EX4-068.answer:
A: Yes, it's an effect that activates multiple times, so you can select different targets for each activation.
[2]

EX4-069.answer:
A: The player who activated this effect decides.
[1]
EX4-069.question: Q: With this card's effect, which players chooses the Digimon with the highest play cost?

EX4-070.answer:
A: No, you the owner of the card gains 2 memory. The card to be discarded is chosen by the opponent.
[1]

EX4-072.answer:
A: It is looking for a level 6 Digimon card whose name contains the selected Digimon's name.For example, if you select [WarGreymon], you can digivolve into [WarGreymon (X Antibody)]/[BlackWarGreymon (X Antibody)]/[BlackWarGreymon] and digivolve into them ignoring their digivolution conditions.
[1]

EX4-072.answer:
A: Yes, its effect treats it as a Digimon with [Sakuyamon] in its name.
[2]

EX4-072.answer:
A: No, [EX4-030 Kuzuhamon] has [Sakuyamon] in its name, but the [Sakuyamon] does not have "[Kuzuhamon] in its name".
[2]
EX4-072.question: Q: If [EX4-030 Kuzuhamon] is selected as the target of this card, can it digivolve into any level 6 [Sakuyamon] with this card's effect?

EX4-072.answer:
A: No, if card A has an effect that says "This card/Digimon is also treated as if it's [B]", then A and B will not satisfy the "card names are different" condition.
[3]
EX4-072.question: Q: If a [ChaosGallantmon] is selected as the target of this card, can it digivolve into a [Megidramon] with an effect that says "This card/Digimon is also treated as if it's [ChaosGallantmon]", or vice-versa (Megidramon into ChaosGallantomon)?

EX4-072.answer:
A: No, if two cards already have the same name, a "This card/Digimon is also treated as if it's [X]" effect cannot satisfy the "card names are different" condition.
[3]
EX4-072.question: Q: If a [Megidramon] is selected as the target of this card, can it digivolve into a [Megidramon] with an effect that says "This card/Digimon is also treated as if it's [ChaosGallantmon]"?

EX4-073.answer:
A: No, only the card with lowest play cost among all of your opponent's Digimon and Tamers overall will be deleted. If multiple Digimon/Tamers share the lowest play cost then this card's controller chooses 1 from among them.
[1]

EX4-073.answer:
A: Yes, for each level 6 or higher digivolution card you trash with this effect, delete your opponent's Digimon/Tamers in ascending order of play cost.

EX4-073.answer:
A: No, if it is possible you must select at least 1 of your opponent's Digimon with a play cost of 6 or less with this effect.

A: No, it cannot. Its [On Play] effect will trigger, but it will be deleted before it can be activated.

EX4-074.answer:
A: Yes, please do as much of it as possible.

When your opponent's digivolution cards are trashed as a result, can you activate this card's effect?

P-012.answer: A: No, it doesn't check Digimon in the breeding area.

P-029.answer: A: Yes, the effect to delete the Digimon at the end of the turn persists.

P-029.answer: A: Since the "delete this Digimon" and "return the Digimon to the bottom of its owner's deck" trigger at the same time. The player chooses which effect goes first. The effect that happens after is not applied.

P-029.answer: A: The effect of [BT3-109 Back for Revenge!] will persist on the evolved Digimon. So the [AncientGreymon] is played.

P-029.answer: A: After the attack ends, the End of Turn Procedures will start and this Digimon will get deleted bringing the memory back 1 on your side. After the opponent resolves [ST5-04 ToyAgumon]'s [End of Opponent's Turn] effect you continue your turn. You would end your turn twice so [End of Your Turn], [End of Opponent's Turn], and [End of All Turns] would trigger twice this turn.

P-029.answer: A: Yes, you can reduce the digivolution cost of 2 with another effect.

P-030.answer: A: Yes, the effect to delete the Digimon at the end of the turn persists.

P-030.answer: A: Since the "delete this Digimon" and "return the Digimon to the bottom of its owner's deck" trigger at the same time. The player chooses which effect goes first. The effect that happens after is not applied.
P-030.question: Q: After using this card's [When Digivolving] effect to digivolve into [AncientGarurumon] and then using [BT5-109 Mega Digimon Fusion!] to digivolve into a level 7 Digimon. Since the deletion effect persists, what happens first?

P-030.answer: A: The effect of [BT3-109 Back for Revenge!] will persist on the evolved Digimon. So the [AncientGarurumon] is played.
P-030.question: Q: After using [BT3-109 Back for Revenge!] on a Digimon, that Digimon then digivolves into [P-030 Lobomon] and then [AncientGarurumon]. Which Digimon will be played by this effect [P-030 Lobomon]?

P-030.answer: A: Even though End of Turn Procedures have started, when your memory moves back to 0, you no longer continue ending your turn, [End of Your Turn], [End of Opponent's Turn], and [End of All Turns] would happen twice in this instance as you would end your turn twice.

As my turn is ending, AncientGarurumon is deleted and [BT1-030 Gomamon]'s effect gives me +1 memory moving my memory back to 0. What happens?

P-031.answer: A: No, this Digimon did not have ＜Blocker＞ at the [Reaction] timing. So it cannot use ＜Blocker＞. (See more in Attack Resolution)

P-033.answer: A: The Digimon loses the ＜Security Attack +1＞ and if no other effects are increasing its security attack no further checks will be performed and the attack will end.

P-034.answer: A: Yes, when you activate this effect you will have 7 or more Digimon cards with [Devimon] in their name in the trash, the [On Deletion] inherited effect be able to play a [DanDevimon] from your trash without paying its memory cost.

P-035.answer: A: No, this card in the battle area does not meet the colour requirement for you to play Red Options.

P-036.answer: A: Yes, the colour requirement for Options is only applied when using Option cards from your hand.

P-037.answer: A: No, this card in the battle area does not meet the colour requirement for you to play Yellow Options.

P-037.answer: A: Yes, the colour requirement for Options is only applied when using Option cards from your hand.

P-038.answer: A: No, this card in the battle area does not meet the colour requirement for you to play Green Options.
P-038.question: Q: If this card is in my battle area, can I play Green Options even though I do not have a Green Digimon or Tamer in my battle area or breeding area?

P-038.answer: A: Yes, the colour requirement for Options is only applied when using Option cards from your hand.

P-039.answer: A: No, this card in the battle area does not meet the colour requirement for you to play Black Options.

ST2-08.question: Q: One of my Digimon has this card as a digivolution card and attacks one of my opponent's Digimon that has 1 digivolution card. If this Digimon has another [When Attacking] effect that activates and trashes that digivolution card, does this card's inherited effect activate?

ST2-08.answer: A: No, it doesn't check Digimon in the breeding area.
ST2-08.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect apply if my opponent has a Digimon with no digivolution cards in their breeding area?

ST2-08.answer: A: No, it doesn't. Your opponent has to have a Digimon in their battle area for it to activate.
ST2-08.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect apply when my opponent doesn't have any Digimon in their battle area?

ST2-09.answer: A: No. This inherited effect does nothing to your opponent's Digimon if they have no digivolution cards.
ST2-09.question: Q: Can this card's [When Digivolving] effect be used to delete an opponent's Digimon with no digivolution cards?

ST2-09.answer: A: Yes, it can. In that case, it would only trash that 1 digivolution card.
ST2-09.question: Q: Can this card's [When Digivolving] effect be used on an opponent's Digimon that has only 1 digivolution card?

ST2-11.answer: A: No, it only unsuspends itself once per turn. In other words, it only unsuspends the first time it attacks each turn.
ST2-11.question: Q: Does this Digimon unsuspend itself each time it attacks?

ST2-11.answer: A: No. You can use the effect again during your next turn.
ST2-11.question: Q: Does this Digimon's effect only activate once per game?

ST2-11.answer: A: After you declare your attack, suspend the Digimon, then declare your attack target. When performing your security check or resolving a battle with your opponent's Digimon, this Digimon will already be unsuspended.
ST2-11.question: Q: At what timing does this Digimon unsuspend itself?

ST2-12.answer: A: No. You only gain 1 memory no matter how many Digimon your opponent has without digivolution cards.
ST2-12.question: Q: Do I gain 1 memory for each Digimon my opponent has without digivolution cards?

ST2-12.answer: A: No, it doesn't check Digimon in the breeding area.
ST2-12.question: Q: Does this Tamer's effect apply if my opponent has a Digimon with no digivolution cards in their breeding area?

ST2-12.answer: A: No, it doesn't. Your opponent has to have a Digimon in their battle area for it to activate.
ST2-12.question: Q: Does this Tamer's effect apply when my opponent has no Digimon in their battle area?

ST2-12.answer: A: Yes. The effect of each copy activates, causing you to gain 2 memory.
ST2-12.question: Q: If I have two of this Tamer in play and my opponent has a Digimon with no digivolution cards, do I gain 2 memory from this Tamer's effect?

ST2-13.answer: A: Yes, it does. However, this only happens after any attacks resolve. If there are any  effects or attacks that have not resolved, those must resolve before it becomes your turn.
ST2-13.question: Q: If the security effect of this card causes the memory counter to move to 1 or higher on my side, does my opponent's turn end?

ST2-14.question: Q: If one of my opponent's Digimon has this card's effect used on it and is suspended, can I attack that Digimon?

ST2-14.answer: A: This card can only be used to target cards that meet its requirements upon activation. So the effect would still apply, and even though the target Digimon has gained digivolution cards, it still can't attack or block.
ST2-14.question: Q: If one of my opponent's Digimon has this card's effect used on it and it digivolves and now has 1 or more digivolution cards, how does this card's effect resolve?

ST2-15.answer: A: No. Level 2 Digimon can't be in the battle area.
ST2-15.question: Q: Can I use the effect of this Option card to play a level 2 Digimon that is currently a digivolution card of one of my Digimon?

ST2-15.answer: A: No. Since it is played as another Digimon, it is played unsuspended.
ST2-15.question: Q: If I use this Option card's effect to play a digivolution card of one of my suspended Digimon, does it come into play suspended?

ST2-15.answer: A: No. Since it is played as another Digimon, it is not affected by any effects of the original Digimon it was under.
ST2-15.question: Q: If one of my Digimon has an effect applied to it that lasts a turn, then I use the effect of this Option card to play one of its digivolution cards as a Digimon, does that Digimon come into play with the same effect applied to it?

ST2-15.answer: A: No, since it would count as the turn they were played.
ST2-15.question: Q: Can Digimon played by this card's effect attack the turn they were played?

ST3-01.answer: A: Yes. Since it meets the activation conditions, they all activate.
ST3-01.question: Q: If the DP of an opponent's Digimon is reduced to 0 and deleted, if I have multiple Digimon with this Digimon as digivolution cards, do all of their effects activate?

ST3-04.answer: A: Yes. Since it meets the activation conditions, they all activate.
ST3-04.question: Q: If the DP of an opponent's Digimon is reduced to 0 and deleted, if I have multiple Digimon with this Digimon as digivolution cards, do all of their effects activate?

ST3-05.answer: A: No. If you have 4 or more cards in your security stack, you gain 1 memory. But you can only gain 1 memory from this effect.
ST3-05.question: Q: On attack, if I have 8 cards in my security stack, does this card's inherited effect cause me to gain 2 memory?

ST3-07.answer: A: Yes, it can. Even if this Digimon's attack effect causes your memory to move to 1 or greater on your opponent's side, it doesn't become your opponent's turn until the end of the attack.
ST3-07.question: Q: Can this Digimon attack when I have less than 2 memory?

ST3-08.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to target one of my opponent's Digimon with 1000 DP or less and delete it?

ST3-08.answer: A: You do not enter battle, then once any other [When Attacking] and [Reaction] effects resolve, the attack ends. (See more in Attack Resolution)
ST3-08.question: Q: A Digimon with this card as a digivolution card attacks an opponent's Digimon, then that Digimon's DP is reduced to 0 and deleted by this card's inherited effect. What happens to the attack?

ST3-08.answer: A: No. When Attacking effects resolve before block declaration, so you can't activate the inherited effect after a blocker has been declared.
ST3-08.question: Q: A Digimon with this card as a digivolution card attacks an opponent's Digimon, then the opponent blocks with a Digimon that has ＜Blocker＞. Can I use this card's inherited effect to reduce the DP of the blocking Digimon to 0 and delete it?

ST3-09.answer: A: Yes, you do. This effect behaves the same way as an effect that reads "If you have 3 or fewer security cards", so the condition is checked when the effect would be activated.
ST3-09.question: Q: I digivolve into this card while I have 4 or more security cards. While this Digimon's [When Digivolving] effect is pending activation, one of my other effects reduces my security cards to 3 or fewer. Do I?

ST3-11.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to target one of my opponent's Digimon with 4000 DP or less, reduce its DP to 0, and delete it?

ST3-11.answer:
A: You do not enter battle, then once any other [When Attacking] and [Reaction]/[Counter] effects resolve, the attack ends.
[1]
ST3-11.question: Q: This card attacks an opponent's Digimon, then that Digimon's DP is reduced to 0 and deleted by this card's effect. What happens to the attack?

ST3-11.answer:
A: No. [When Attacking] effects resolve before block declaration, so you can't activate the [When Attacking] effect after a blocker has been declared.
[1]
ST3-11.question: Q: This card attacks an opponent's Digimon, then my opponent blocks with a Digimon that has ＜Blocker＞. Can I use this card's effect to reduce the DP of the blocking Digimon to 0 and delete it?

ST3-11.answer:
A: Rosemon's condition of "If this Digimon is at rest" is no longer fulfilled, so Rosemon cannot rest your other Digimon.
[2]
ST3-11.question: Q: I play [ST3-16 Seven Heavens] to give -10,000 DP to the opponent's rested Rosemon. Then my [ST3-11 Seraphimon] attacks player. Both Seraphimon and Rosemon skills trigger at the same time [When Attacking] Seraphimon -4000 DP to Rosemon, killing it. Can Rosemon still rest an opponent's Digimon?

ST3-12.question: Q: Does the effect of this Tamer stack if there are multiple copies in play in my battle area?

ST3-12.answer: A: Yes. It doesn't affect normal Digimon.
ST3-12.question: Q: Does this Tamer's effect only affect Security Digimon?

ST3-13.question: Q: If there are two copies of this card in my security stack, and both copies are activated in the same turn, do their effects stack?

ST3-14.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to target one of my opponent's Digimon with 2000 DP or less, reduce its DP to 0, and delete it?

ST3-15.answer: A: That Digimon can't perform security checks, so the battle ends. Even if your opponent has no cards in their security stack, you would not win the game by attacking with that Digimon.
ST3-15.question: Q: What happens when a Digimon has a security check number of 0 because of this card's effect and it attacks a player?

ST3-15.answer: A: It would still check 0 cards. In order to check 1 or more security cards, that Digimon would need to gain ＜Security Attack +3＞ or higher.
ST3-15.question: Q: This card's effect causes a Digimon to gain ＜Security Attack -3＞, giving them a security check number of 0. How many security cards could that Digimon check if it gained edned ＜Security Attack +1＞

ST3-16.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to target one of my opponent's Digimon with 10000 DP or less, reduce its DP to 0, and delete it?

ST4-04.answer: A: No, if you declared an attack against your opponent, this card's effect doesn't activate, even if they use another Digimon to block it.
ST4-04.question: Q: I attack my opponent using a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this card's effect activate?

ST4-04.answer: A: Yes, if you declared an attack against an opponent's Digimon, this effect activates.
ST4-04.question: Q: I attack an opponent's Digimon using a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, and use another effect to delete an opponent's Digimon card. Does this card's effect activate?

ST4-06.answer: A: No, if you declared an attack against your opponent, this card's effect doesn't activate, even if they use another Digimon to block it.
ST4-06.question: Q: I attack my opponent using a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this card's effect activate?

ST4-06.answer: A: Yes, if you declared an attack against an opponent's Digimon, this effect activates.
ST4-06.question: Q: I attack an opponent's Digimon using a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, and use another effect to delete an opponent's Digimon card. Does this card's effect activate?

ST4-08.answer: A: Yes, it can. Even if your memory counter moves to 1 on your opponent's side due to this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect, your turn doesn't end until the attack does.
ST4-08.question: Q: Can this Digimon attack if I have less than 2 memory?

ST4-11.answer: A: No, [Security] effects only activate when flipped over from the security stack.
ST4-11.question: Q: I use this card's inherited effect to trash an opponent's Security Card. Does the security effect on that card activate?

ST4-11.answer: A: No, this effect only trashes the top card of your opponent's security stack. It doesn't win you the game if it's empty.
ST4-11.question: Q: My opponent has an empty security stack. If I have a Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards, and I use it to attack and delete an opponent's Digimon and survive, do I win the game?

ST4-12.answer: A: Yes. The effect simply prevents the Digimon from attacking or blocking. You can still attack it.
ST4-12.question: Q: I use this card's effect on an opponent's Digimon. Can I attack that Digimon if it's suspended?

ST4-12.answer: A: No, the effect persists, even if they digivolve.
ST4-12.question: Q: I use this card's effect on an opponent's Digimon. If that Digimon digivolves into a different Digimon, can it attack and block again?

ST4-12.answer: A: The effect preventing it from attacking takes priority. Your opponent's Digimon still can't attack.
ST4-12.question: Q: I use this card's effect on an opponent's Digimon. If that Digimon activates an effect that allows it to attack other Digimon or players, what happens?

ST4-14.question: Q: Can I activate this card's effect when my opponent uses ＜Blocker＞ to suspend one of their Digimon?

ST5-04.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate even if your opponent didn't have a Digimon in play for their entire turn?
Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if you activate effects to prevent all of your opponent's Digimon from attacking?

ST5-04.answer: A: No, it does not because your opponent still declared an attack this turn.
ST5-04.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activates if you ended an attack with [BT5-111 Omnimon X-Anti-body]?

ST5-06.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate even if your opponent didn't have a Digimon in play for their entire turn?
Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if you use effects to prevent your opponent's Digimon from attacking?

ST5-06.answer: A: No, it doesn't. They attacked this turn, so the effect doesn't apply.
ST5-06.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if your opponent's Digimon were all deleted in battle after attacking?

ST5-08.answer: A: Yes, it can. Even if your memory counter moves to 1 on your opponent's side due to this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect, your turn doesn't end until the attack does.
ST5-08.question: Q: Can this Digimon attack if I have less than 2 memory?

ST5-09.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to give this Digimon ＜Blocker＞?

ST5-09.answer: A: Digimon retain effects when digivolving or dedigivolving, so ＜Blocker＞ remains.
ST5-09.question: Q: I use this card to give a Digimon ＜Blocker＞. If that Digimon digivolves into a different Digimon, what happens to ＜Blocker＞?

ST5-12.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to give this Digimon ＜Reboot＞?

ST5-12.answer: A: Digimon retain effects when digivolving or dedigivolving, so ＜Reboot＞ remains.
ST5-12.question: Q: I use this card to give a Digimon ＜Reboot＞. If that Digimon digivolves into a different Digimon, what happens to ＜Reboot＞?

ST5-14.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect to unsuspend a Digimon that didn't suspend itself by activating ＜Blocker＞?

ST6-01.answer: A: No, you don't lose the game when your deck is empty. You will lose the game if your deck has 0 cards in it at your next draw phase, however.
ST6-01.question: Q: If this card's effect reduces the number of cards in my deck to 0, do I lose the game?

ST6-08.answer: A: Yes, it can. Even if your memory counter moves to 1 on your opponent's side due to this Digimon's [When Attacking] effect, your turn doesn't end until the attack does.
ST6-08.question: Q: Can this Digimon attack if I have less than 2 memory?

ST6-12.question: Q:  Can I use this card's effect to give this Digimon ＜Retaliation＞?

ST6-12.answer: A: Digimon retain effects when digivolving or dedigivolving, so ＜Retaliation＞ remains.
ST6-12.question: Q: I use this card to give a Digimon ＜Retaliation＞. If that Digimon digivolves into a different Digimon, what happens to ＜Retaliation＞?

ST6-13.question: Q: I use this card's ＜Digi-Burst＞ to trash a purple level 3 Digimon card in the Digimon with ＜Digi-Burst＞'s digivolution cards. Can I immediately use the ＜Digi-Burst＞ effect to play that Digimon without paying its memory cost?

ST6-15.answer:
A: No. You must fully activate this card's effect, then activate the [On Deletion] effect.
[1]
ST6-15.question: Q: I use this card's effect to delete one of my Digimon with a [On Deletion] effect. Can I activate the [On Deletion] effect before this card's "delete 1 of your opponent's level 4 or lower Digimon" effect?

ST6-15.answer:
A: They trigger at the same time, which means the turn player resolves their effect first.
[1]
ST6-15.question:
Q: I use this card to delete one of my own Digimon, and an opponent's Digimon. If they both have [On Deletion] effects, which
effect resolves first?

ST6-16.answer: A: Yes, you can. If you only have a level 3 or level 4 purple Digimon card in your trash, you can play it.
ST6-16.question: Q: Can I use this card's effect if I only have either a level 3 or level 4 purple Digimon card in my trash?

ST6-16.answer: A: No. If you have both a level 3 and a level 4 in the trash, you must play both of them or none at all. If you have only one of them, you can play just that one.
ST6-16.question: Q: If I have both a level 3 and a level 4 in the trash, can I choose to play only one of them?

ST6-16.answer: A: No, you only trigger that effect once.
ST6-16.question: Q: I use this card's [Main] effect to play 2 Digimon. Do I get to trigger "When you play a Digimon" twice?

ST7-02.answer: A: Yes. The effect was activated before your opponent blocked it. (See more in Attack Resolution)
ST7-02.question: Q: I attack my opponent with this Digimon. If they block it with one of their Digimon, does this Digimon's effect activate?

ST7-03.answer:
A: No. Your Digimon is placed in your trash before the effect can activate. It’s no longer in your battle area, so it doesn’t activate.
[1]
ST7-03.question: Q: A Digimon with this card in its digivolution cards and an opponent’s Digimon are deleted simultaneously. Does this card’s inherited effect activate?
Q: If my opponent has a level 6 or higher Digimon, can I activate [P-103 Offense Training]'s ＜Delay＞ effect to digivolve this Digimon into a [Gallantmon] in hand, reducing its cost to 2 memory?
Q: If my opponent has a level 6 or higher Digimon and I activate an effect that evolves one of my Digimon, can I evolve this Digimon into [Gallantmon] in my hand?

ST7-05.answer: A: No. Before you can activate the effect this card is moved to the trash and is no longer in the battle area, so you cannot activate the effect
ST7-05.question: Q: If your Digimon with this card as a source and an opponent’s Digimon are deleted at the same time, can you activate this card’s inherited effect?

ST7-06.answer: A: No. At the point this Digimon is played via this effect it is considered to be a standard Digimon
ST7-06.question: Q: When this Digimon is played due to its [Security] effect is it counted as a Security Digimon?

ST7-06.answer: A: Yes. The outcome of the battle doesn’t matter, at the end of the battle the Digimon is Played
ST7-06.question: Q: If this card is Security Checked and deleted in battle does is it still Played via its [Security] effect?

ST7-06.answer: A: This Digimon is Played prior to the next Security Check. The [On Play] ability also activates as soon as the Digimon is Played, prior to the next Security Check
ST7-06.question: Q: When this card is Security checked and battled, if the attacking Digimon has further security checks to make, does this Digimon get Played or do those Checks occur first? Furthermore, what is the timing for the activation of this card’s [On Play] effect?

ST7-06.answer: A: Yes. You may delete the attacking Digimon
ST7-06.question: Q: This card is played via its [Security] effect. The attacking Digimon has DP4000 or less but has <Jamming>. Can you use this Digimon’s [On Play] effect to delete the attacking Digimon?

ST7-08.question: Q: A Digimon with this card as a source and the ＜Piercing＞ effect attacks an opposing Digimon and only the opposing Digimon is deleted. Does the inherited effect of this card grant the attacking Digimon ＜Security Attack +1＞ for the ensuing Security Checks granted by ＜Piercing＞?

ST7-09.answer: A: This refers to a situation in which there are no opposing Digimon that can be deleted by this Digimon’s [When Attacking] effect, such as if your opponent does not have a Digimon with DP 4000 or less or if they only have Digimon that cannot be deleted by effect
ST7-09.question: Q: This card’s [When Attacking] ability reads, ‘Delete an opponent’s Digimon with DP4000 or less. If an opponent’s Digimon is not deleted by this effect,’ What does this mean?

ST7-09.answer: A: No. If this card’s [When Attacking] effect is activated and there is an opposing Digimon with DP 4000 or less you must target that Digimon. If there is an appropriate target for the effect you may not choose to not target it.
ST7-09.question: Q: If my opponent has a Digimon with DP 4000 or less, can I choose not to delete that Digimon to give this Digimon DP +3000?

ST7-09.answer: A: Yes. You may choose any opposing Digimon with DP 4000 or less. You may deliberately choose a Digimon that cannot be deleted by opponent’s effects to force the deletion to fail.
ST7-09.question: Q: If my opponent has two Digimon with DP 4000 or less, one which cannot be deleted by opponent’s effects and one that can, can I target the Digimon that cannot be deleted by opponent’s effects, fail to delete it, and then give this Digimon DP +3000?

ST7-11.answer: A: No. So long as your number of Security Cards remaining is equal or fewer than your opponent’s at the time of Use, you don’t lose the effect even if your opponent’s Security decreases later
ST7-11.question: Q: Upon using this card you and your opponent have the same number of Security Cards remaining, but then later in the turn your opponent’s number of Security Cards decrease, leaving you with more. Does the ＜Security Attack +1＞ granted by this card disappear at that time?

ST7-12.answer: A: Choose any number of your opponent’s Digimon so that the total DP of those Digimon adds up to 8000 or less, such as a DP 3000 Digimon and a DP 5000 Digimon, or two DP 2000 Digimon and a DP 3000 Digimon, and then activate the effect on those Digimon
ST7-12.question: Q: The card reads, 'Choose any number of your opponent's Digimon whose total DP adds up to 8000 or less'. What does that actually mean?

ST7-12.answer: A: Yes. You are free to choose so long as the total DP is 8000 or less. However, you must choose at least 1 Digimon if your opponent has any Digimon with DP 8000 or less
ST7-12.question: Q: Can I deliberately choose fewer targets so that the total DP is less than 8000?

ST7-12.answer: A: No. Your opponent’s Digimon’s DP will only be reduced after Golemon is Deleted when this card’s effect has finished activating. You may not choose an additional target at that point
ST7-12.question: Q: If my opponent has [BT4-066 Golemon] and I include Golemon as one of the targeted Digimon my opponent’s other Digimon’s DP will be reduced by 1000 when Golemon is Deleted. Can I include that loss of DP in my calculations when selecting Digimon to target?
Q: Can this card’s [Main] effect be stacked with "Add 1000 to the maximum DP you can choose with DP-based deletion effects" to make it able to delete a Digimon with 11000 DP or lower?

ST8-01.answer: A: Yes. The inherited effect activates the moment you have 8 cards in hand, even mid Attack, giving the attacking Digimon DP +1000
ST8-01.question: Q: I have 7 cards in hand and attack with a Digimon that has this card as a source, activating that Digimon’s [When Attacking] ability to ＜Draw 1＞. Now that I have 8 cards in hand does the inherited effect from this card give the attacking Digimon DP +1000 for the ensuing Check or Battle?

ST8-01.answer: A: No. This card's Japanese name (チビモン) does not have "Vee" (ブイ) in its name.
ST8-01.question: Q: Does this card have [Vee] in its name?

ST8-02.answer: A: Yes. The inherited effect becomes active the moment you have 8 cards in hand, even mid-atttack. Giving the attacking Digimon +1000 DP.
ST8-02.question: Q: I have 7 cards in hand and attack with a Digimon that has this card as a source, activating that Digimon's [When Attacking] ability to ＜Draw 1＞. Now that I have 8 cards in hand does the inherited effect from this card give the attacking Digimon DP+1000 for the ensuing check or battle?

ST8-04.question: Q: If my opponent has a level 6 or higher Digimon, can I activate [P-104 Mental Training]'s ＜Delay＞ effect to digivolve this Digimon into an [UlforceVeedramon] in hand, reducing its cost to 2 memory?
Q: If my opponent has a level 6 or higher Digimon and I activate an effect that evolves one of my Digimon, can I evolve this Digimon into [UlforceVeedramon] in my hand?

ST8-05.answer: A: Yes. So long as you choose to Activate this card’s inherited effect after the ＜Draw 1＞ you will have 8 cards in hand when this effect is activated allowing you to return an opponent’s Digimon to their hand
ST8-05.question: Q: I have 7 cards in hand and attack with a Digimon that has this card as a source, activating that Digimon’s other [When Attacking] ability to ＜Draw 1＞. Now that I have 8 cards in hand can I use this card’s inherited ability to return one of my opponent’s Lv. 3 Digimon to their hand?

ST8-06.answer: A: Yes. The outcome of the battle doesn’t matter, at the end of the battle the Digimon is Played
ST8-06.question: Q: If this card is Security Checked and deleted in battle does is it still Played via its [Security] effect?
Q: If this card is Played via its [Security] does its [On Play] effect activate?

ST8-06.answer: A: This Digimon is Played prior to the next Security Check. The [On Play] ability also activates as soon as the Digimon is Played, prior to the next Security Check
ST8-06.question: Q: When this card is Security checked and battled, if the attacking Digimon has further security checks to make, does this Digimon get Played or do those Checks occur first? Furthermore, what is the timing for the activation of this card’s [On Play] effect?

ST8-08.answer: A: Yes. The inherited effect activates the moment you have 8 cards in hand, even mid Attack, giving the attacking Digimon ＜Security Attack +1＞
ST8-08.question: Q: I have 7 cards in hand and attack with a Digimon that has this card as a source, activating that Digimon’s [When Attacking] ability to ＜Draw 1＞. Now that I have 8 cards in hand does the inherited effect from this card give the attacking Digimon ＜Security Attack +1＞ for the ensuing Check?

ST8-09.answer: A: In response to this Digimon attack, an opponent’s Digimon cannot redirect this Digimon's attack when activating the ＜Blocker＞ effect.
ST8-09.question: Q: This card reads, ‘This Digimon is unblockable.’ What exactly does that mean?

ST8-09.answer: A: Yes, the Digimon can still be suspended but the attack will not be redirected.
ST8-09.question: Q: Can my opponent still suspend their Digimon with ＜Blocker＞?

ST8-10.answer: A: Yes. So long as you choose to Activate this card’s inherited effect after the ＜Draw 1＞ you will have 8 cards in hand when this effect is activated allowing you to Unsuspend this Digimon
ST8-10.question: Q: I have 7 cards in hand and attack this Digimon, activating this Digimon’s other [When Attacking] ability to ＜Draw 1＞. Now that I have 8 cards in hand can I use this card’s [When Attacking] ability to Unsuspend this Digimon?

ST9-01.answer: A: Yes, it activates if the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards is blue.
ST9-01.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution cards is a blue Digimon?

ST9-02.answer: A: Yes, as it says to "Reveal", you must reveal the top 3 cards from your deck if you are able to.
ST9-02.question: Q: Must I reveal the top 3 cards of my deck for this card's [On Play] effect?

ST9-02.answer: A: Yes, at it says to “Add to your hand”, you must add a revealed card that fulfils the condition to your hand if you are able to.
ST9-02.question: Q: For this card's [On Play] effect, if I revealed a digimon card with the [Free] trait, must I add it to my hand?

ST9-04.answer: A: Yes, it activates if the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution card is Green.
ST9-04.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution card is a Green Digimon?

ST9-05.answer: A: Yes, it is an effect that can only activate if you DNA Digivolve.
ST9-05.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, does it not activate if I don't DNA digivolve?

ST9-06.answer:
A: Yes, if you have both digivolution cards, you must play both of them, or not play any of them. If you do not have both, you may play as much as you can.
[1]
ST9-06.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, if I have both a level 4 or lower blue Digimon card and a green Digimon card in its digivolution cards, must I play both Digimon?

ST9-06.answer:
A: Yes, you can choose to play the Blue-Green Digimon as the Blue Digimon so that no other Green Digimon can be played.
[2]
ST9-06.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, if the only level 4 or lower digivolution cards this Digimon has are a Blue-Green level 3 Digimon and a Blue level 3 Digimon, can I choose to only play 1 of them?

ST9-06.answer:
A: Yes, you can choose to play the Blue-Green Digimon as the Green Digimon so that no other Blue Digimon can be played.
[2]
ST9-06.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, if the only level 4 or lower digivolution cards this Digimon has are a Blue-Green level 3 Digimon and a Green level 3 Digimon, can I choose to only play 1 of them?

ST9-07.answer:
A: No, [When Attacking] effects activate before ＜Blocker＞ is activated/performed in [Reaction]/[Counter] timing, so it loses ＜Blocker＞ before it is able to block.
[1]
ST9-07.question: Q: When my opponent's Digimon attacks and deletes my blue Digimon with its [When Attacking] effect, leaving me with no other blue Digimon in play, can I still use this card's effect to block?

ST9-08.answer: A: At the end of your turn, the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution card, and 1 of your other Digimon, can DNA digivolve into a Digimon in your hand that can <DNA Digivolve>, before the turn is passed to your opponent.
ST9-08.question: Q: What kind of effect is this card's inherited effect?

ST9-08.answer: A: No, as digivolution requirements cannot be ignored. You cannot DNA digivolve into a Digimon card that cannot <DNA Digivolve>.
ST9-08.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to DNA digivolve into a Digimon card in my hand that cannot <DNA Digivolve>?

ST9-08.answer: A: No, as digivolution requirements cannot be ignored. You cannot DNA digivolve your Digimon that is not the correct colour or level specified by the card that can <DNA Digivolve>.
ST9-08.question: Q: Can I use this card's inherited effect to DNA digivolve my Digimon in play that is not the colour and level specified by the card that can <DNA Digivolve> in my hand?

ST9-08.answer: A: No, the Digimon from DNA Digivolve is treated as a new Digimon so the old DIgimon is no longer in the battle area.
ST9-08.question: Q: This card's [End of Your Turn] effect has triggered, and the Digimon it is underneath is used as part of a DNA Digivolve. Can I still activate this effect?

ST9-09.answer: A: Yes, it activates if the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution card is blue.
ST9-09.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect activate if the Digimon that has this card in its digivolution card is a blue Digimon?

ST9-10.answer: A: Yes, it is played at the end of battle regardless of the outcome of that battle.
ST9-10.question: Q: For this card's [Security] effect, if it lost the battle against the attacking Digimon, can I still play it?
Q: Does this card's [On Play] effect activate even if it is played by the effects of this card's [Security] effect?

ST9-10.answer: A: As this Digimon is to be played at the end of the battle with the attacking Digimon, it is played before the next check happens. Its [On Play] effect also activates befeore the next check.
ST9-10.question: Q: For this card's [Security] effect, if at the end of the battle which this card was checked, the attacking Digimon still has remaining checks not done, does this card's [Security] effect activate first or does the next check happens first?

ST9-11.answer: A: The first part "suspend 1 of your opponent's Digimon" activates even if you don't DNA Digivolve. The latter part "That Digimon is not unsuspended in your opponent's next unsuspend phase" can only activate if you DNA Digivolved.
ST9-11.question: Q: For this card's [When Digivolving] effect, does it not activate if I don't DNA Digivolve?

ST9-11.answer: A: No, this inherited effect only counts the colour of the topmost card. If it is a single-coloured card, it is counted as 1 colour even if there are cards of other colours in the digivolution card.
ST9-11.question: Q: Does this card's inherited effect also count the colours of cards in digivolution cards?

ST9-14.question: Q: Can I suspend a Digimon, but return a different Digimon that was already suspended to my opponent's hand with this card's effect?

ST9-15.question: Q: Can I give +2000 DP to a Digimon, but give ＜Piercing＞ to a different Digimon with this card's effect?
